column6: >Clicca qui per contribuire dopo aver scelto la tua ricompensa!

column1: <a href=""#englishversion"" name=""italianversion"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" style=""background-color: brown

Alla metà del secolo scorso una felice intuizione del Duca Luigi Silvestro Camerini e in seguito della Duchessa Adria Scaglia diede il via ad una nuova dimensione botanica nella leggendaria baia di San Montano: la vegetazione spontanea dove si allineava fra le altre la famosa Ipomoea imperati (pianta estinta in natura e qui ritrovata dall'Orto botanico di Napoli) fu con grande maestria integrata con specie provenienti da altre regioni del pianeta (dalle cycadales di provenienza tropicale alle Genista tyrrhena** di origini mediterranee). In seguito ad uno studio sul DNA si è potuto accertare che il ceppo di provenienza di questa Genista è quello endemizzato in origine sull'isola di Ponza.
Questo nuovo profilo botanico fu arricchito nel tempo e divenne parte integrante di una nuova dimensione della baia: Il Parco termale Negombo, oggi inserito nel circuito dei Grandi Giardini Italiani, e costantemente seguito ed arricchito dal paesaggista Ermanno Casasco.

Dopo più di 50 anni con un patrimonio vegetale, in buono equilibrio con le particolari condizioni pedo-climatiche della baia, il luogo è divenuto meta irrinunciabile di un turismo sempre più sensibile a valori botanici e paesaggistici. Le specie vegetali, molte delle quali naturalizzate nel parco, sono divenute elemento essenziale dell’esperienza “culturale” degli ospiti dell’isola di Ischia.

Le emozioni, i ricordi di un momento particolare, possono essere rivissuti dando continuità alla componente botanica attraverso i semi raccolti dalle piante del parco stesso. Infatti mettere a dimora questi semi, seguirne lo sviluppo e ricreare una flora delle “piante del Negombo” rinsalderebbe il legame che si stabilisce tra il luogo e i suoi fruitori.

L’esperienza “piante del Negombo” si può estendere ovviamente in un ideale viaggio di ritorno ai luoghi di origine delle piante tra coloro che pur non avendo ancora avuto la fortuna di conoscere il parco ne adotteranno i semi. È evidente che l’esperienza si può generalizzare a tutti coloro che hanno interesse e sensibilità per questo tipo di iniziative. Il proprio balcone, il proprio orto, un giardino, un parco possono diventare un angolo del Negombo.

Il nostro lavoro sul ""verde"" ci ha anche portato da tredici anni a questa parte ad organizzare ""Ipomea del Negombo"" una mostra mercato di piante rare ed inconsuete, per sensibilizzare il pubblico sui temi della botanica e ospitare vivaisti specializzati da ogni parte d'Italia. Ed anche questa frequentazione ci ha portato a migliorare le nostre conoscenze sui semi ed è stata occasione per organizzare eventi di carattere scientifico da parte di importanti università italiane ed approfondimenti sulla cultura del verde. Quest'anno in programma per il 22/23/24 maggio 2015.

Il progetto prevede di raccogliere con attenzione da persone competenti, durante la giusta stagione, una buona quantità di semi di diversissime specie significative (da quelle più rare a quelle più comuni ma tipiche della nostra macchia vegetativa) e farli confluire in una “Banca Negombiana dei Semi” con etichette, nomi botanici, indicazioni di germinabilità, zona climatica consigliata, informazioni sulla rapidità di crescita, stagionalità, altezze, esposizione.

Saranno privilegiate quelle essenze che già dalla prima stagione danno risultati soddisfacenti. Come anche il metro di giudizio non sarà semplicemente quello della rarità ma si privilegeranno gli accostamenti e la riscoperta di piante comuni, facili da crescere e troppo sottovalutate nel tempo.
Riteniamo importante ribadire che non si tratta di una semplice distribuzione di semi
column2: quello che proponiamo è una esperienza, una emozione: quella sperimentata al Negombo. Fondamentali sono gli accostamenti e i ""mix"", le miscellanee di colori e forme che, ci piace pensare, si trovano solo da noi.

column1: Da qui il nome del progetto: I semi della felicità. L'idea è nata proprio dalla ""reazione"" del pubblico che quotidianamente ci attraversa, ci visita e sovente esclama: ""ma questa cosa non posso riprodurla da me?""

Ovviamente i semi verranno distribuiti con criterio agli interessati (i nostri sostenitori), dando i giusti consigli affinché si garantisca al meglio la riuscita dell’impresa, come per esempio analizzando la zona climatica di destinazione e dando consigli sul terriccio da adoperare.

Contiamo di iniziare la consegna dei semi già dalla fine della campagna crowdfunding fino a maggio per le fioriture stagionali e infine proseguire nei mesi successivi con le specie annuali, biennali e perenni.
Saremo quindi in controtendenza con la normale procedura del crowdfunding che prevede l'inizio della produzione solo dopo aver raggiunto il traguardo e distribuisce le sue ricompense mesi dopo.
Inoltre nel caso di superamento del traguardo stanzieremo una serie di bonus aggiuntivi per ogni aderente.
Grazie, e buona esperienza!

Ci sono molti per aiutarci a realizzare questo progetto. Parla con i tuoi amici, distribuisci questa pagina e condividila sui social network. Clicca Mi piace e condividi i post su Facebook e infine ricorda di cliccare Mi piace ai video su YouTube. Puoi anche inviare questa pagina per email cliccando il pulsante sotto al titolo.

Per tutti gli aderenti al progetto che si trovano ad Ischia nelle date 22/23/24 maggio 2015: ingresso gratis alla fiera mercato di piante rare ed inconsuete della fascia mediterranea calda tredicesima edizione “Ipomea del Negombo”22/23/24 maggio 2015
raggiungimento obiettivo a 7000 euro
<ul>
• 630 euro per i costi di piattaforma Indiegogo e transazione
• 1000 euro per i “raccoglitori di semi” nel corso dell’anno solare
• 700 euro per la campagna di sensibilizzazione e comunicazione
• 450 euro per la realizzazione dei sacchetti dedicati in tessuto per contenere i semi
• 420 euro per tutta l’operazione di pulizia, stoccaggio, selezione e conservazione dei semi
• 500 euro per le spese di spedizione (gratuite per l'Italia)
• 1000 euro per le spese di ufficio e segreteria per seguire personalizzando tutti gli invii e i consigli
• 300 euro per la stampa materiale informativo sull’iniziativa (volantini, locandine, manifesti)
• 600 euro stima di costo delle ricompense

• 1400 euro per la creazione di un sito web, blog, pagina facebook e account twitter e canale youtube annesso specifico che segua l’evoluzione del progetto anche nella sua fase di piantumazione e crescita, instaurando un filo diretto con gli aderenti e ponendo le basi per una “banca semi negombiana” annuale e che prosegua nel tempo.
Seeds of Happiness
We are offering an unusual collection of seeds from the Negombo Park, Ischia, which will bring new life to your balcony, terrace or garden. We hope you will support us.
A brief history

In 1946, Duke Luigi Silvestro Camerini (and later Duchess Adria Scaglia) had the stimulating idea that an extended botanic dimension could be added to the legendary bay of San Montano. So the natural vegetation of the bay, including the famous Ipomoea Imperati (a plant previously considered extinct but discovered there by the Botanical Gardens of Naples) was skillfully integrated with species from other regions , for example, Cycadales from the tropics and the Genista Tyrrhena** whose origin from the nearby Island of Ponza was finally established through a dna test.

This botanical dimension of the Negombo thermal park, now on the circuit of the Great Italian Gardens (Grandi Giardini Italiani ), has been continued and enhanced in recent years under the supervision of the famous landscape designer, Ermanno Casasco.
Our goals

After over 50 years’ stewardship of this botanic heritage growing in natural equilibrium with the pedoclimactic conditions of the bay, the thermal park has become a magnet for tourists sensitive to the landscape and to the biodiversity of the plants. These now frequently naturalized in the park make up an essential element of the “cultural” experience of guests on the island of Ischia.

Our hope is that through the seeds collected from the plants in the park, the emotions and memories of a particular time can be revived and resonate in your gardens. In fact, by giving you the opportunity to plant these seeds yourselves, we hope you will re-create a personal flora of the “flowers of Negombo” and thereby consolidate the bond between you and us.

The “Seeds of Happiness” experience can also obviously be extended to those who have not yet had the opportunity to know the park, but would like to. You can travel on an ideal journey to the places where the seeds have come from. In both cases your balcony, garden, and terrace will become a corner of Negombo.
Ipomea del Negombo

Our sensitivity to botanic issues has moreover been reinforced since 2002 by the annual marketplace (Ipomea) of rare and unusual plants from specialized nurseries all over Italy organized at Negombo. This has helped us raise public awareness of botanical issues, and given us the opportunity to stage scientific events by major Italian universities with the aim of promoting environmental sensibility. This year the dates scheduled for Ipomea are from 22nd. to 24th. May 2015.
What We Want to Create

The “Seeds of Happiness” project will collect a range of seeds of diverse but significant species (from the most rare to the most common which are typical of our vegetation zone) and place them in a Negombo Seed Bank (“Banca Negombiana dei Semi”) duly labelled with their botanic names, indications of sprouting period, recommended climate conditions, and information of the speed of growth, season, height, and exposure to the sun.

We will first select the species that will immediately give satisfactory results even in the first year. The criteria behind this choice will on some occasions be rarity, on others the rediscovery of undervalued common plants. What counts particularly is that the plants go well together.

This project does not aim at being a mere distribution of seeds, but at evoking an experience, and an emotion like the ones you experienced in Negombo. To achieve this, the combination of seeds is fundamental just as the miscellany of colors and mixture of shapes at Negombo is unavailable anywhere else.

The idea for this project came to us from the “reactions” of the public who daily go through our gates and exclaim “Could I reproduce an atmosphere like this in my place?” With this project we hope you will be able to do just that and we hope the seeds will give you happiness.
Distribution of the Seeds

Obviously the seeds will be distributed with great care to the people who support this project. Advice will be given on how to obtain the best results, depending on the climate zone and the soil conditions of the destination.
We shall begin delivery of the seeds at the end of the crowdfunding campaign and will continue for the seasonal blooms until May and for the annuals, biennials and perennials in the following months.
This is the opposite of the usual crowdfunding campaigns where production is started after reaching the set goals and the rewards are distributed many months later.
If the goals are exceeded, additional bonuses will be given for each supporter.
Thank you, and may these seeds bring you pleasure!
Other ways to help

There are many ways you can contribute to this project: talk to your friends, share this page on the social networks, click “I like this” and share the Negombo Facebook posts. Remember also to click “I like this” for our videos on YouTube and e-mail this page to your friends by clicking on the button under the title.
One perk

For all our supporters who are on Ischia on 22nd., 23rd. and 24th. May 2015 free admission will be offered to the 13th edition of “Ipomea del Negombo” - the marketplace of rare and unusual plants of the Mediterranean. Just get your credentials checked at our offices.
How the raised funds will be used
We are setting our goal at 7000€
<ul>
• 630€ are for Indiegogo costs and transactions
• 1000€ are for the “seed gatherers” in the calendar year
• 700€ for the awareness-promotion campaign and other communication costs
• 450€ for the production of the fabric bags to hold the seeds
• 420€ for the cleaning, storage, selection and conservation of the seeds
• 500€ for postage (free in Italy)
• 1000€ for office expenses including sending gardening tips
• 300€ for the printing of flyers, brochures and posters
• 600€ for the rewards

• 1400€ for the creation of a website, blog and facebook page, and for the twitter and youtube accounts that will follow the project through to the early planting and sprouting phase. This will create a direct link with the supporters and set the ground to make the “Negombo seed bank” an annual initiative that continues over time.

Short Summary

The Fire and Water team have secured an asset transfer of 3 buildings in Sowerby Bridge that at present lay abandoned. The buildings are the old swimming pool, the original fire station and the old council chambers. These buildings will become a community hub.
Above: The old swimming pool that will become the theatre. (picture taken during filming with the BBC)
Why?
column6: Water project will create a purpose built venue to provide community training and to house arts, music and cultural events as well as providing space for other community activities.

column1: Above: The Fire &
column2:
Water Buildings. 

The creation of a community space on its own is not enough to effect social, cultural and economic change so the proposed site also provides commercial areas to provide a revenue stream to ensure the sustainability of the community centre and space to house new jobs for the town. This includes the provision of space for craftsmen, artists, and other sole traders to enhance the creativity and cultural flavor of the hub.

column1:
The Fire and Water group is made up of over 250 local residents who believe that if these buildings are converted into a community hub, they will  have a long and last impact on the town. 

Above:The community consultation to decided what services should be in the buildings.

Our local council have been very supportive, and are ready to sign the buildings over to the community. However for this to happen we must raise enough money to cover the insurance.

This campaign will literally secure the future of these buildings, and given them back to our community. Without the transfer we can not apply for the grants we need to renovate the buildings and supply the community hub we all want.
These buildings will be a lasting legacy for Sowerby Bridge, if you are able please do support us.

So far we have raised just over £2000 and had over 50 volunteers in the buildings clearing them out and taking part in DIY projects. 

The DIY SOS project.

There have been a few updates since we started this campaign:

1. There is an article written about us in the February issue of Farm Indiana (read our story here: http://issuu.com/screamingeaglemedia/docs/farm_... )

2. We were featured on the front page of the Journal &
column2:
Courier on February 6th, 2015. Read online article here: http://www.jconline.com/story/news/college/2015...

You can visit our official website at www.redgiantunion.org

The Red Giant Union is a not-for-profit grassroots organization. We will utilize revenue from each farm to fund the next one in our network. These small urban Tower Garden farms will be managed by individual teams, each member earning over 75% of the revenue from their indoor or outdoor farm(s). 

Our Mission is to provide the community with affordable, locally grown, Non-GMO produce, while creating jobs and inspiring a healthy way of living. 

Our efforts will further the innovation in urban agriculture.

We depend on donations in order to make this work, due to the start-up cost. This is why we are asking you to help us fund our first small farm - to be managed by one team of four gardeners. We need t
column6:
>o raise $10,000 dollars to purchase a total of 12 Tower Gardens, extensions, tomato-cages, and lights, including nutrients, seeds, pumps, timers, rockwool, and pH testing and adjustment kits.

Donations come with an incentive as well, check out the perks!

We believe this is the future of urban farming in West Lafayette and Lafayette, Indiana.

/>

Currently growing beans, broccoli, basil, arugula, lettuce, and kale!

Thank You for your support! This project would not be possible without you!

Sincerely,

Austin Kasso

Founder, Executive Director

(Du findest eine deutsche Übersetzung dieses Textes weiter unten.)

The Project

As a marine
biologist, I always try to address and help solving the main marine
conservation issues that we face today. There probably is no topic that
attracts and touches me more than the amazing and sad story of sharks. Since 5
years, I work as the scientific director of the NGO Shark Savers Germany and dedicate
my free time to improve the situation of these creatures.
During one year
of dedicated work and thanks to the help of many helping hands, I produced the
documentary ""A golden state for sharks?"", which tells the story of a shark attack
mitigation program that killed many sharks in order to protect people along the coast of Western Australia in 2014.

But soon, it became clear that such programs are not only killing endangered species, they are also not effective in protecting beachgoers. All around the world, people came together to protest for the rights of sharks. Thus I started a journey to look for alternative

strategies that ensure a more peaceful co-existence between humans and sharks.

Click here to watch the full movie
Your support
will help us with the promotion and distribution of the movie in order to raise
awareness about these misunderstood and highly endangered animals. The bad
reputation that sharks have is one of their biggest problems impeding that
people are willing to take actions to save them. Watch our documentary, learn
more about the many reasons why sharks are important to the oceans health and to

us as humans, and help us to achieve the fundraising goal.

What you get by helping us

In May this year, we finally presented
our documentary ""A golden state for sharks?"" at a diving event in
Germany and published the movie in German and English. I was overwhelmed
by the amazing feedback and the constructive discussions that the movie
provoked. Due to many pleads from the audience, we created a discussion guide with
useful links to background information in collaboration with teachers that can
be used for private events and school classes.
The movie was
produced at no costs, but now we need the necessary finances to promote and
distribute the movie. Specifically we will:
-
print question guides
-
burn DVDs and create DVD cases (DVD cases will be made

from recycled paper)

In total, we estimate the costs at
To thank your

contributions, we prepared some perks including a full DVD kit with a personal devotement, a Shark Savers Germany bottle opener, movie posters and postcards. Very generous donors will get a full package!

Why This Is Important

There are many reasons why protecting sharks is important. As apex
predators, sharks play a key role in maintaining marine ecosystem health. In fact, there
are a number of places where the killing of sharks caused serious problems to the marine environment and human communities. The extinction
of sharks would have very negative consequences for the global food security, livelihood
of millions of fishers, and thereby for the well being of hundreds of millions
of people.
Due to
overfishing, many shark species are endangered and so far there is not enough
support to protect them. Shark attacks are extremely rare events, but media
hypes keep the bad reputation of these animals alive. Creating awareness to correct
the false image of sharks and explaining their importance is therefore crucial
for their conservation.
Along my
career, I worked in a couple of shark projects where I had the chance to get to
know their beauty, experience their threats and raise awareness of the public.
In most cases, I could see how the fear and aversion of sharks from people
changed into curiosity and fascination. I am sure that this movie has the
strength to trigger this exact change and helps reducing the threat on these

animals.

Challenges

The objective to reduce
threats on sharks including overfishing and fatal shark attack mitigation
programs is a challenge that involves the change in consumers habits, the
creation of alternative incomes for fishers, the improvement of shark
reputation and many other initiatives. In short, it is a very complex task that
needs the effort of many people all over the world. Through the movie we will
contribute to the very important step to raise peoples' awareness. To maximize
the outreach of the project, we translated the movie and the question selection
into English, German, Spanish and Portuguese and plan to add translations into
languages spoken in countries where shark conservation is of special concern.
Even though the shark
culling was stopped in Western Australia, there are other countries and other Australian
states where the killing of sharks for alleged public safety is still conducted.
Our work will especially focus on these places. I will be working in Australia
in the next years and plan to distribute the movie in places

where it is mostly needed.

How Else You Can Help Us

Besides
financial support, there are many other ways to help us achieving our goals.

Below are some examples. 

-
Share the campaign with your friends and family (the
Indiegogo tool is very useful for that)
-
Watch, like and share the movie at social media platforms

such as Facebook or Twitter 

For the full movie, click here!
-
Speak with your friends and family about what you have
learned
-
Take action by starting a volunteer work with Shark Savers
Germany. We always need e.g. translators and new contacts. You can contribute

with whatever you know to do or whatever your interest is.

Thank you for your interest and attention. Your help is highly appreciated!


DEUTSCH

Das Projekt

Als Meeresbiologin versuche ich stets mich den wichtigen Problemen im Bereich des Meeresschutzes zu widmen. Wahrscheinlich gibt es kaum ein Thema, dass mich mehr in den Bann zieht wie die unglaubliche Geschichte der Haie. Seit 5 Jahren arbeite ich bereits als Wissenschaftlicher Vorstand des gemeinnützlichen Vereines Shark Savers Germany und widme meine Freizeit der Verbesserung dieser wunderschönen Tiere.

Im Laufe eines Jahres und mit Hilfe von vielen helfenden Händen, habe ich den Dokumentarfilm 'A golden state for sharks?' produziert. Der Film erzählt die Geschichte eines Programmes in Westaustralien, dass Haie gezielt tötete um Badegäste zu schützen. Doch recht schnell wurde klar, dass derartige Programme nicht nur bedrohte Tierarten tötet, sondern auch keinen Einfluss auf die Sicherheit von Menschen hat. Auf der ganzen Welt kamen Menschen zusammen um für die Rechte von Haien zu protestieren. Also startete ich eine Reise um nach alternativen Strategien zu suchen, die ein friedliches Zusammenleben von Hai und Mensch ermöglichen.

Deine Unterstützung wird uns dabei helfen den entstandenen Film zu bewerben und zu verbreiten. Unser Ziel ist es das öffentliche Bewusstsein für diese missverstandenen und bedrohten Tiere zu bessern. Denn der schlechte Ruf, den Haie haben, ist eine der größten Hürden um Menschen zu überzeugen aktiv für ihren Schutz zu werden. Schau dir unseren Film an, lerne mehr darüber warum Haie so wichtig für unsere Meere und uns Menschen sind und hilf uns unser Spendenziel zu erreichen! 

Was du davon hast

Unser Film wurde erstmalig im Mai 2015 auf einem Tauchevent in Deutschland ausgestrahlt. Eine Deutsche und eine Englische Version gibt es im Internet. Ich war komplett überrumpelt von dem positiven Feedback und der konstruktiven Diskussion, den der Film ausgelöst hat. Aufgrund vieler Nachfragen der Zuschauer, haben wir in Zusammenarbeit mit Lehrern einen Fragenkatalog erstellt, der sowohl auf privaten Events als auch für den Schulunterricht als Diskussionsgrundlage genutzt werden kann. 

Den Film selbst haben wir komplett umsonst produziert. Doch nun benötigen wir finanzielle Mittel um DVDs und den Fragenkatalog zu produzieren und den Film zu verbreiten. Wir werden:

- Den Fragenkatalog drucken lassen

- DVDs brennen und die Hüllen produzieren (Hüllen werden aus recycletem Material gemacht)

Hierfür brauchen wir in etwa 1.200 Euro.

Wir haben ein paar nette Perks vorbereitet, um uns bei dir für deine Spende zu bedanken. Unter anderem gibt es ein komplettes DVD-Set mit persönlicher Widmung, Filmplakate, Shark Savers Germany Flaschenöffner und Postkarten. Sehr großzügige Spender bekommen das komplette Paket!

Warum unser Projekt wichtig ist

Es gibt viele gute Gründe warum Haie schützenswert sind. Als große Jäger spiele Haie eine zentrale Rolle für die Gesundheit der Meere. Tatsächlich hat die Überfischung von Haien bereits in einigen Orten ernste Konsequenzen für die Umwelt inklusive der Menschen gehabt. Das Aussterben der Haie würde schwerwiegende Probleme für die Nahrungssicherstellung, das Einkommen von Millionen Fischern und das Wohlbefinden von hunderten Millionen Menschen mit sich bringen.

Aufgrund von starker Überfischung sind viele Haiarten vom Aussterben bedroht und bekommen bisher nicht genug Unterstützung um sie zu schützen. Haiattacken sind auf der anderen Seite extrem seltene Vorfälle. Doch Medien halten mit ihren Schlagzeilen den schlechten Ruf der Haie aufrecht. Diesen Ruf richtig zu stellen und die Bedeutung von Haien bewusst zu machen ist daher ein sehr wichtiger Schritt für ihren Schutz.

Während meiner Karriere habe ich bereits in einigen Haiprojekten gearbeitet und hatte die Gelegenheit mit ihre Schönheit und ihrer Bedrohung kennenzulernen und diese Erfahrungen mit der Öffentlichkeit zu teilen. In den meisten Fällen konnte ich sehen wie die Angst und Abneigung gegen Haie in Neugierde und Faszination umgeschlagen sind. Ich bin mir sicher, dass unser Film die Stärke hat eben diesen Unterschied zu machen.

Unsere Herausforderungen

Das Ziel die Bedrohung der Haie zu verringern ist eine große Herausforderung, die von viele Faktoren abhängt. Die Gewohnheiten von Konsumenten müssen sich ändern, alternative Einnahmequellen für Fischer müssen geschaffen werden, der Ruf der Haie muss verbessert werden, und und und. Kurz gesagt, es ist eine sehr komplexes Aufgabe, die der Arbeit von vielen Initiativen auf der ganzen Welt bedarf. Unsere Dokumentation wird zu einem sehr wichtigen Schritt beitragen: das Bewusstsein der Menschen für dieses Thema zu verbessern. Um möglichst viele Menschen zu erreichen wurde der Film auf Englisch und Deutsch produziert und erhielt Spanische Untertitel. Wir planen außerdem Übersetzungen in Sprachen wo der Haischutz von besonderer Bedeutung ist.

Obwohl das Haitötungsprogramm in Westaustralien beendet wurde gibt es eine Reihe anderer Staaten, wo derartige Programme immer noch aktiv sind. Unsere Arbeit soll ich besonders auf diese Orte spezialisieren. Ich persönlich werde in den nächsten Jahren in Australien leben und dafür Sorge tragen, dass der Film dorthin gelangt wo es am meisten gebraucht wird.

Wie du uns sonst noch helfen kannst

Neben einer finanziellen Spende, gibt es noch weitere Wege wie du uns helfen kannst. Hier sind einige Beispiele:

- Teile unsere Kampagne mit deinen Freunden und deiner Familie (das Indiegogo tool ist sehr nützlich)

- Schau dir unseren Film an und verbreite ihn in Sozialen Medien wie Facebook und Twitter. 

Den kompletten Film gibt es hier:

A Golden State for Sharks?

- Sprich mit deinen Freunden und deiner Familie darüber, was du gelernt hast.

- Werde selber als Voluntär bei Shark Savers Germany aktiv. Wir brauchen immer fleißige Helfer, Übersetzer und neue Kontakte. Du kannst dich ganz nach deinen Interessen einbringen.

Vielen Dank für dein Interesse. Wir wissen deine Hilfe zu schätzen!

Short Summary

The Lowcountry Pollinator Park will have ten miles of carefully planted flower beds, a bee apiary, an all native wild fruit orchard,  a tidal pond, a space observatory, and a planetarium/nature center. Did I mention that plans call for a primitive campground on site, so that out of state visitors will have a place to stay when they visit?

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

We already have an awesome funding program in place, which will cover the purchase of the land, and the full development of the site. All we need from you is $200k to cover the down payment on the land purchase because our funding campaign does not begin until after the contract has been signed.

column1: However . . . help this campaign go viral (over $1MM raised), and we will be able to fast track the opening of this park AND will donate half of what we raise to open parks just like it all across the country. In fact, since we will only need $3MM total to completely develop our site (including purchase of land), we will donate 100% of all funds raised above that to help open more parks like this one. Learn more about this by going to our website { www.L3PO.org }.

In return for your support, we offer two classes of perks. For those who live close enough, and would want to visit the park, we will provide free admission passes which will also include admission to the planetarium. For everybody else, we will be providing  design plans (includes a short video) for a bunch of really cool energy saving, sustainable, low cost projects that you can implement at home. These project ideas include an all new greenhouse design, an all new raised bed design, a fast-track solar soil sterilizer, a non electric attic cooler, and much more. We will also be offering an e-book (with video) detailing the entire project from planning stages, to fundraising, to site development, and all the way through to the grand opening.

The Impact

We will be creating habitat, raising awareness, providing educational and research opportunities  for Monarch Butterfly conservation, honey bees, native bee conservation,  native plants, and pollinators in general.  We will also have an area set up where we will demonstrate numerous different designs for solar ovens, solar heaters, solar dryers, bio-sand water filters, and much more. The park will be totally sustainable, and self supporting, acting as the ""Poster Project"" for radical resourcefulness. All fertilizer, compost, mulch, and energy will be generated on site (although we will also collect leaves, wood chips, etc. from off site too). Our ultimate goal is to take the entire park entirely off grid . . . electric, heating, waste, and water. We will be demonstrating radical water conservation methods utilizing large scale rainwater harvest and retention. In fact we have no plans to dig wells, wanting to demonstrate what can be done without relying on groundwater. Read all about these crucial components of our project by visiting our website at www.L3PO.org .
Risks &

We are seeking $200k to place a down payment on the land where L3PO will be built. We will then implement our innovative local sponsor program to pay off the land in five years, and develop the site in one year.  If we raise $1MM we will be able to purchase the land outright, and expedite the development of the site. We will donate 50% of dollar raised (less campaign fees) above $1MM (up to $5MM) to help open pollinator parks like this one all across the country. Once we have raised $3MM for our project (and able to donate $2MM for others like it) we will donate 100% of everything we raise(less campaign fees)!  Read more about this on our web site at www.l3po.org.  In the event that we were not able to raise enough money to make the down payment on the property ($200k), we will use all funds raised to create extensive pollinator habitat at Roxbury Park{ www.roxburypark.org },  which sits adjacent to the future site of L3PO. Ken Carman, the visonary behind L3PO, is the caretaker/naturalist for Roxbury Park, which is featured this month in South Carolina Wildlife Magazine. The bottom line is that if enough people show even the smallest level of support, this will happen . . . and more parks like it will be built in other locations.  Once the park is fully open, it will be entirely self sustaining by relying on revenue from admission passes, camping fees, and merchandise sales(plants, seeds, gift shop, etc.)

All funds raised above what we will need to develop and open this site($3MM) will be donated to the National Pollinator Garden Network (NPGN) http://millionpollinatorgardens.org/partners/ provided they agree to distribute the funds as promised in this campaign.
Going Off Grid:

The greatest challenge we will face in going entirely off grid (electric, heat, water, waste) will be approval from local authorities on ordinance compliance. We will start with the easiest, and continue to move in that direction until we have totally succeeded, or until everyone knows that we made every relentless effort we possibly could and could not overcome situations beyond our control.

Other Ways You Can Help

Your willingness to share our project with friends, family, co-workers, and everyone else in your network is critical to our success. Help us take this campaign global, and we will donate funds to help open parks just like this one . . . maybe even in your community. This includes ""liking"" our page on Facebook (and then ""sharing"" posts), as well as posting on Twitter, Pintrest, and any other social media outlet you are connected to. Remember that on Facebook, a share is worth a thousand likes, and pushes us higher in the interest indicators that Facebook uses to determine how many people see a post.

Most important is that you share our Indiegogo campaign so that others will have an opportunity to help fund this project.  Share our web site so that others will have a better understanding of all that this project entails.  ""Like"" our Facebook page, and encourage others to do so too.

Remember, when a task gets divided among many, the burden becomes very light. If all we asked for was a penny, no one would miss it. However if we had just one penny from everyone in the united states, we would have well over $3,000,000!

","Short Summary The Lowcountry Pollinator Park will have ten miles of carefully planted flower beds, a bee apiary, an all native wild fruit orchard,  a tidal pond, a space observatory, and a planetarium/nature center. Did I mention that plans call for a primitive campground on site, so that out of state visitors will have a place to stay when they visit? What We Need & What You Get We already have an awesome funding program in place, which will cover the purchase of the land, and the full development of the site. All we need from you is $200k to cover the down payment on the land purchase because our funding campaign does not begin until after the contract has been signed.

However . . . help this campaign go viral (over $1MM raised), and we will be able to fast track the opening of this park AND will donate half of what we raise to open parks just like it all across the country. In fact, since we will only need $3MM total to completely develop our site (including purchase of land), we will donate 100% of all funds raised above that to help open more parks like this one. Learn more about this by going to our website { www.L3PO.org }.

In return for your support, we offer two classes of perks. For those who live close enough, and would want to visit the park, we will provide free admission passes which will also include admission to the planetarium. For everybody else, we will be providing  design plans (includes a short video) for a bunch of really cool energy saving, sustainable, low cost projects that you can implement at home. These project ideas include an all new greenhouse design, an all new raised bed design, a fast-track solar soil sterilizer, a non electric attic cooler, and much more. We will also be offering an e-book (with video) detailing the entire project from planning stages, to fundraising, to site development, and all the way through to the grand opening.

The Impact We will be creating habitat, raising awareness, providing educational and research opportunities  for Monarch Butterfly conservation, honey bees, native bee conservation,  native plants, and pollinators in general.  We will also have an area set up where we will demonstrate numerous different designs for solar ovens, solar heaters, solar dryers, bio-sand water filters, and much more. The park will be totally sustainable, and self supporting, acting as the ""Poster Project"" for radical resourcefulness. All fertilizer, compost, mulch, and energy will be generated on site (although we will also collect leaves, wood chips, etc. from off site too). Our ultimate goal is to take the entire park entirely off grid . . . electric, heating, waste, and water. We will be demonstrating radical water conservation methods utilizing large scale rainwater harvest and retention. In fact we have no plans to dig wells, wanting to demonstrate what can be done without relying on groundwater. Read all about these crucial components of our project by visiting our website at www.L3PO.org .

The combination

The Product
For the
purchase price of one new electric hybrid bus, we can convert six buses from the
existing fleet, into fully functioning hydraulic hybrid vehicles.
The HRDS Am-Can hybrid
system (featuring anti-idle), produces up to a 40% reduction in fuel
consumption, but more importantly it significantly reduces those toxic exhaust
emissions.

A 100% reduction in toxic emissions occurs, while the bus is stationary at traffic lights and bus stops. The anti-idle system automatically shuts down the engine when stationary.  Depressing the gas-pedal instantly restarts the bus engine.

Alternative Fuels

The adoption of alternative fuels significantly reduces particular matter and other criteria pollutants. The combustion of alternative fuels still creates toxic emissions, but at a reduced level when compared to diesel buses. This includes, CNG, LPG, bio-fuels and ethanol based fuels. 

The Hydraulic Regenerative Drive System (HRDS) can

be fitted to any vehicle regardless of fuel type. The conversion significantly reduces fuel consumption and exhaust emissions, resulting in an economic benefit of up to a 40% reduction in fuel costs. <span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >The fitment of the HRDS hybrid system to alternative fueled vehicles, produces the cleanest and greenest outcome.

column1: New Vehicles
The HRDS hydraulic hybrid system can also be fitted to new vehicles. An electric-hybrid system carries a 100% premium on a new school buses purchase price.
column5:
>The HRDS hybrid system is a more affordable 30% premium. 

To complement our retrofit hybrid projects we plan to produce a complete turnkey hydraulic hybrid bus, in both a diesel/hybrid and a CNG/hybrid configuration. 

This is achieved by purchasing a suitable vehicle from one of the 6 recognized bus manufacturers, which is then converted and sold on as a new vehicle. The end product produces the most affordable hybrid bus on the market.


The Project 

With more than 35,000 school buses in service,Texan authorities face a daunting task in cleaning up the tailpipe emissions of their school buses. The Am-Can project  presents an alternative or additional option, which supports clean bus programs.

Austin Texas is our base of operation for the North American clean air project. Localized vehicle service centers will be enlisted to install and service the HRDS hybrid systems for the project buses. 

A small fleet of buses will be purchased and converted into fully functioning hybrid vehicles. On completion of shake down trials, the converted buses will be made available to transport operators for evaluation, at no cost. 

The Am-Can Project is designed to help promote and fast-track the adoption of hybrid school buses in North America. The outcome of this pilot project is to be used to develop a compelling case, in favor of vehicle hybridization and support the commercialization of the Am-Can project.

column1: What We Need
Without
adequate funding the “Clean Air Am-Can” project will not proceed, which is why
we are seeking contributions. The budget to launch this project is 2
million dollars (USD). Targeted budget will be spent on

hiring suitable buses
·  Installation of
hybrid conversions
·  Monitoring fuel
consumption and exhaust emissions of these buses
·  Maintenance and

tyres etc.

expenses and associated administrative costs.
If we

project in other ways.  This may be achieved using a scaled down hybrid
project.       If this option is not possible, monies will be utilized to raise
additional capital, using more traditional capital raising methods.
The
scale of our project is only limited by the amount of available funds.
event of receiving surplus funds, these will be used to expand the Clean Air
projects.  Resulting in a larger number of cities and states participating in the
project.  With additional funds the scope of the project may even spill
over to neighbouring countries in Latin America.
What You Get
The obvious and most important environmental and health  benefit is cleaner air. Contributors
to this project are an integral part of the Clean Air Am-Can campaign. You will
be credited with being a key player, in combating air pollution and improving
the well-being of those affected by air pollution.
The
potential market for our product is enormous.  Once the pilot project is
completed the commercialization of the project will begin.  As expected
this will require additional capital, to ramp up production.
The
best option in raising capital, is to float the company.  As a reward,
crowd funding contributors will be treated as a preferred client, in the
Initial Public Offering (IPO) of company shares.
<h3>Risks &amp
Risks for the project are negligible. As we are proposing a pilot-project not a commercial venture, there is no
financial risk.  The hybrid system has proven improved fuel economy of up to
40% for urban commercial vehicles and as a result the project will also produce
a significant reduction in toxic exhaust emissions.
The
outcome of the project will be used in supporting feasibility studies to
promote and fast track the adoption of hybrid vehicles.
Challenges for the Am-Can Project will be
the logistics, we are based in Australia. The logistic will be addressed by
setting up a base of operation in the US. We will seek out local partners, to

assist with installation and service of the hybrid system.

 A manufacturing plant for our product may be required in North
America to meet future demand.  The biggest challenge for the pilot
project is capital raising, which is why we are crowd funding.

RDS
Technologies Pty Ltd is a green technology company and a world leader in hybrid
propulsion systems for commercial vehicles. Our patented Hydraulic
Regenerative Braking System (HRDS™) is
a device that improves fuel economy whilst reducing emissions and
other toxic pollutants. <div>

PS
Below is additional information on air pollution and the effects it has on agriculture.
Effects of Air Pollution
Its common
knowledge that exhaust emissions from the transport sector contribute
largely to urban air pollution.  In recent times ""air pollution""
has become a global epidemic and responsible for the deaths of millions of
people.
Air pollution creates acid rain that's particularly damaging
to ecosystems which includes, soil, lakes, streams, forests, plants and
animals.  Acid rain is also a serious threat to our drinking water held in
reservoirs and dams.
Not so
well known is the adverse effect on plants and food production.  Air
pollution filters out sunlight, hindering photosynthesises in plants, which
severely effects a plant's ability to absorb carbon dioxide.  No doubt,
this will have a negative impact on the effectiveness of tree planting
initiatives in combating greenhouse gas emissions.
<h3>Food Crops
Affected
Symptoms
of damage to plants resulting from exposure to air pollution range from slow
growth to leaf browning, followed by premature leaf drop resulting in the death
of the plant.  Some of the more susceptible crops to air pollution are
listed below:
Tomato,
watermelon, squash, potato, string beans, snap beans, pinto beans, tobacco,
soybeans, cantaloupe, muskmelon, alfalfa, beets, sunflower, carrots, sweet
corn, gourds, green peas, turnips, grapes, peaches and strawberries.
The wine
industry could also be adversely effected in the near future.  Not only in
crop yield but the very essence of its flavours may become tainted.
Air
pollution, in particular ground level ozone, can effect crop yields of wheat
and rice.  One report from India quoted a 50% reduction in crop
production.  This will have a devastating effect on the region as they are
a major grain producer and may destabilise the nation’s food security.
Bees
A recent
study conducted by The University of South Hampton found that diesel
exhaust fumes change the profile of flora odour.  They say these profile
changes may effect honeybees foraging efficiency and ultimately could affect the
pollination of plants.  Without pollination, crops will fail and create
another threat to food security.  No Bees - No Food - No Us.
<blockquote style=""text-align: center
ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH RISK
List of 6 Criteria Pollutants
<blockquote>

Particulate Matter

Particulate matter (PM), also known as particle pollution, is a mixture of extremely small particles found in the air, including dust, dirt, soot, smoke, and liquid droplets. Two kinds of particulate matter are identified as being harmful to human health: fine particles (PM2.5), which are 2.5 micrometers in diameter or smaller and typically found in smoke or haze
column2: or inhalable coarse particles (PM10), which are between 2.5 micrometers and 10 micrometers in diameter and can be found near roadways and dusty industries. Particulate matter is derived from many different sources, including residential combustion activities and vehicle exhaust. Particulate matter is regulated as one of the six “criteria” pollutants under the federal CAA. Exposure to particulate matter has been linked to a variety of health problems, particularly within the respiratory and cardiovascular systems.

column1: <blockquote>

Nitrogen Dioxide

Nitrogen dioxide (NO2) is part of a group of highly reactive gases known as oxides of nitrogen (NOx) and is harmful to human health and the environment. Nitrogen dioxide is emitted from many sources when fuel is burned at high temperatures, including industrial, commercial and residential combustion, motor vehicles, and electric utilities. For this reason, individuals who spend time on or near major roadways are at higher risk for short-term exposure. Nitrogen dioxide is regulated as one of the six “criteria” pollutants under the federal CAA and is harmful to human health, particularly the respiratory system.
Carbon Monoxide

Carbon monoxide (CO) is a colorless, odorless gas that is regulated under the federal CAA as one of the six “criteria” pollutants. Carbon monoxide is primarily emitted from combustion processes and the majority of emissions come from mobile sources, especially in urban areas. It is considered very dangerous and harmful to human health and the environment because it can reduce the amount of oxygen delivered to the body’s organs, like the heart and the brain. At very high levels, it can lead to death. People with several types of heart disease may be more severely affected by short-term carbon monoxide exposure.
Ozone

Ozone (O3), or “ground-level ozone”, is one of the six major pollutants identified by scientists as being harmful to both humans and the environment. Ground-level ozone, which is regulated by the federal CAA, is emitted by a chemical reaction between oxides of nitrogen (NOx) and volatile organic compounds (VOCs). Major contributors of NOx and VOCs that lead to the creation of ozone include motor vehicle exhaust from cars, trucks, off-road vehicles, agricultural and construction vehicles, industrial emissions, gasoline vapors, and chemical solvents. Ground-level ozone can inflame and damage lungs, increase the frequency of asthma attacks, and make the lungs more susceptible to infection.
Sulfur Dioxide

Sulfur dioxide (SO2) is part of a group of highly reactive gases known as oxides of sulfur (SOx) and is primarily derived from fossil fuel combustion at power plants and other industrial facilities. Other sources of SO2 include industrial processes like extracting metal from ore and the burning of high sulfur fuels. Sulfur dioxide is one of the six “criteria” air pollutants regulated under the federal CAA. Sulfur dioxide is considered to be harmful to human health and has been linked with many adverse health effects, particularly within the respiratory system.
Lead

Lead (Pb) is a metal that is both naturally occurring and found in manufactured products, and is also one of the six “criteria” pollutants regulated under the federal CAA. Sources of lead include smelters, mining operations, waste incinerators, battery recycling, and the production of lead shot and fishing sinkers. Lead is also released by burning coal, oil, or solid waste. Lead-based paint may also be present in older homes. It is toxic to both humans and animals, with small children being at the highest risk for lead poisoning.

","The featured video was created by the  Environmental Defense Fund  (EDF).
The Clean Air Am-Can campaign is specifically targeting the toxic exhaust emissions that’s produced by North America's iconic yellow school buses.
The  Am-Can project includes both America and Canada, as both countries utilize the same platform in bus design, hence the project name.

There are half a million school-buses transporting  26 million students in the US (numbers for Canada are unavailable). As revealed in the above video, school children are exposed to unhealthy levels of toxic air pollutants on a daily basis.
That's 26 Million Reasons to Campaign for Clean Air

Diesel exhaust is known to cause or exacerbate many respiratory diseases including Asthma, which affects 6.3 million American school children. Asthma is the most common long-term childhood disease in America.
Researchers at Zuyd University in The
Netherlands, have found that after just 30 minutes of exposure, diesel
exhaust fumes affects brain activity. The EEG data suggested that the brain
displayed a stress response, indicative of changed information processing
in the brain cortex, which continued to increase even after the subjects
had left the exposure chamber.  Particles depositing in tissue and oxidative stress has
also been implicated in degenerative brain diseases such as Parkinson's and
Alzheimer's disease.
Projects Objective
The Am-Can objective
is to initiate a new course of

action in combating toxic air pollutants produced by North Americas school buses.  This new course being the retrofitting of the existing fleet of buses, with an aftermarket ""hydraulic hybrid system"".Over the
last decade there has been
a number of programs designed to combat exhaust emissions, such as the ""clean school bus"" and the on-going anti-idle campaigns. Unfortunately
the mass adoption of these past clean-air initiatives is failing

to be realized. Funding issues are preventing replacement of older buses and retrofitting of buses with emission reducing devices.Unlike other emission reduction methods, our product produces an economic benefit, which pays for itself within a few years with continued significant reduction in operating costs for the life of the bus.  This fact should be incentive enough, to guarantee a positive outcome for our clean air project.
Identifying the Problem
Toxic
fumes produced by idling buses, not only accumulate outside the bus but they
also penetrate inside the bus. Levels of Particular Mater (PM) inside a school
bus can be 5-10 times the levels of that outside of the bus. The California Air Resources Board (CARB)
found that school bus trips can increase children’s daily exposure to black
carbon, up to 34 percent compared to regular passenger cars.      School buses can have a usable life of some 20 to 30 years, unfortunately legislation
of emission standards only apply to newly built vehicles. The existing fleet will continue polluting
for decades to come.  Retrofit programs offer the most economical course of action in combating air pollution. Simple Solution
Eliminating
unnecessary idling is a simple and cost-effective method in reducing children’s exposure
to toxic air pollutants, especially Particulate Matter (PM).  Anti-idling
campaigns are helping, but these programs rely heavily on driver education, not
the application of anti-idle devices.
RDS
Technologies’ R&D Department have designed a special, retrofit hydraulic
hybrid system for the Clean-Air Am-Can Project.  This new hybrid system
incorporates an autonomous anti-idle system.  As expected, eliminating 100%
of toxic exhaust pollutants while the bus is stationary.
The combination
of a hybrid system fitted with an anti-idle device has a cumulative effect producing an additional and significant reduction in fuel consumption and toxic
exhaust emissions.
The Product
For the
purchase price of one new electric hybrid bus, we can convert six buses from the
existing fleet, into fully functioning hydraulic hybrid vehicles.
The HRDS Am-Can hybrid
system (featuring anti-idle), produces up to a 40% reduction in fuel
consumption, but more importantly it significantly reduces those toxic exhaust
emissions.

A 100% reduction in toxic emissions occurs, while the bus is stationary at traffic lights and bus stops. The anti-idle system automatically shuts down the engine when stationary.  Depressing the gas-pedal instantly restarts the bus engine.
Pictured below is the HRDS hydraulic hybrid system.  See the video at the bottom of this page for explanation and technical details.  No batteries required.   1.  Hydraulic pump/motor:  2. Gearbox:

Alternative Fuels

The adoption of alternative fuels significantly reduces particular matter and other criteria pollutants. The combustion of alternative fuels still creates toxic emissions, but at a reduced level when compared to diesel buses. This includes, CNG, LPG, bio-fuels and ethanol based fuels. The Hydraulic Regenerative Drive System (HRDS) can

be fitted to any vehicle regardless of fuel type. The conversion significantly reduces fuel consumption and exhaust emissions, resulting in an economic benefit of up to a 40% reduction in fuel costs. The fitment of the HRDS hybrid system to alternative fueled vehicles, produces the cleanest and greenest outcome.
New Vehicles

The HRDS hydraulic hybrid system can also be fitted to new vehicles. An electric-hybrid system carries a 100% premium on a new school buses purchase price. The HRDS hybrid system is a more affordable 30% premium. To complement our retrofit hybrid projects we plan to produce a complete turnkey hydraulic hybrid bus, in both a diesel/hybrid and a CNG/hybrid configuration. This is achieved by purchasing a suitable vehicle from one of the 6 recognized bus manufacturers, which is then converted and sold on as a new vehicle. The end product produces the most affordable hybrid bus on the market.The Project With more than 35,000 school buses in service,Texan authorities face a daunting task in cleaning up the tailpipe emissions of their school buses. The Am-Can project  presents an alternative or additional option, which supports clean bus programs.Austin Texas is our base of operation for the North American clean air project. Localized vehicle service centers will be enlisted to install and service the HRDS hybrid systems for the project buses. A small fleet of buses will be purchased and converted into fully functioning hybrid vehicles. On completion of shake down trials, the converted buses will be made available to transport operators for evaluation, at no cost. The Am-Can Project is designed to help promote and fast-track the adoption of hybrid school buses in North America. The outcome of this pilot project is to be used to develop a compelling case, in favor of vehicle hybridization and support the commercialization of the Am-Can project.
What We Need
Without
adequate funding the “Clean Air Am-Can” project will not proceed, which is why
we are seeking contributions. The budget to launch this project is 2
million dollars (USD). Targeted budget will be spent on
·  Purchasing or
hiring suitable buses
·  Installation of
hybrid conversions
·  Monitoring fuel
consumption and exhaust emissions of these buses
·  Maintenance and
servicing of the hybrid buses
·  Purchase fuel, oil,
tyres etc.
·  Staff wages, travel
expenses and associated administrative costs.
If we
fail to reach our funding target, any monies raised will be used to advance the
project in other ways.  This may be achieved using a scaled down hybrid
project.       If this option is not possible, monies will be utilized to raise
additional capital, using more traditional capital raising methods.
The
scale of our project is only limited by the amount of available funds.In the
event of receiving surplus funds, these will be used to expand the Clean Air
projects.  Resulting in a larger number of cities and states participating in the
project.  With additional funds the scope of the project may even spill
over to neighbouring countries in Latin America.
What You Get
The obvious and most important environmental and health  benefit is cleaner air. Contributors
to this project are an integral part of the Clean Air Am-Can campaign. You will
be credited with being a key player, in combating air pollution and improving
the well-being of those affected by air pollution.
The
potential market for our product is enormous.  Once the pilot project is
completed the commercialization of the project will begin.  As expected
this will require additional capital, to ramp up production.
The
best option in raising capital, is to float the company.  As a reward,
crowd funding contributors will be treated as a preferred client, in the
Initial Public Offering (IPO) of company shares.
Risks & Challenges
Risks for the project are negligible. As we are proposing a pilot-project not a commercial venture, there is no
financial risk.  The hybrid system has proven improved fuel economy of up to
40% for urban commercial vehicles and as a result the project will also produce
a significant reduction in toxic exhaust emissions.
The
outcome of the project will be used in supporting feasibility studies to
promote and fast track the adoption of hybrid vehicles.
Challenges for the Am-Can Project will be
the logistics, we are based in Australia. The logistic will be addressed by
setting up a base of operation in the US. We will seek out local partners, to
assist with installation and service of the hybrid system. A manufacturing plant for our product may be required in North
America to meet future demand.  The biggest challenge for the pilot
project is capital raising, which is why we are crowd funding.
About Us
RDS
Technologies Pty Ltd is a green technology company and a world leader in hybrid
propulsion systems for commercial vehicles. Our patented Hydraulic
Regenerative Braking System (HRDS™) is
a device that improves fuel economy whilst reducing emissions and
other toxic pollutants.
Through the significant reduction in toxic exhaust emissions and road side noise pollution, commercial vehicles can
save up to 40% off their fuel bills whilst working towards a cleaner and
greener future for generations to come.                                            For more information about us, click on
the link to our website.

The video above is a short story explaining the operation and application of the Hydraulic Regenerative Drive System (HRDS). This video was original produced for Permo-Drive Technologies Ltd, which was established in the year 2000.

RDS Technologies Pty Ltd purchased the technology, assets (including key personnel) and patents of Permo-Drive Technologies Ltd when it went into voluntary liquidation on 12th September 2012.  RDS Technologies Pty Ltd thought the technology too important and continues developing the hydraulic hybrid drive system and its commercialization.
RDS Technologies Pty Ltd was incorporated on 25th February 2008.
Closing
Actions
to reduce air pollution saves lives and provide co-benefits for the climate,
ecosystems, biodiversity and food security.  We can learn to live with global warming, but we can't live without clean air.
“Let’s Clear the Air”
Your contribution is greatly appreciated. To guarantee the success of our campaign, please spread the word on your favorite social media network.
Trevor Dunn.
CEO of RDS Technologies Pty Ltd
www.rdstechnologies.com.au
PS
Below is additional information on air pollution and the effects it has on agriculture.
Effects of Air Pollution
Its common
knowledge that exhaust emissions from the transport sector contribute
largely to urban air pollution.  In recent times ""air pollution""
has become a global epidemic and responsible for the deaths of millions of
people.
Air pollution creates acid rain that's particularly damaging
to ecosystems which includes, soil, lakes, streams, forests, plants and
animals.  Acid rain is also a serious threat to our drinking water held in
reservoirs and dams.
Not so
well known is the adverse effect on plants and food production.  Air
pollution filters out sunlight, hindering photosynthesises in plants, which
severely effects a plant's ability to absorb carbon dioxide.  No doubt,
this will have a negative impact on the effectiveness of tree planting
initiatives in combating greenhouse gas emissions.
Food Crops
Affected
Symptoms
of damage to plants resulting from exposure to air pollution range from slow
growth to leaf browning, followed by premature leaf drop resulting in the death
of the plant.  Some of the more susceptible crops to air pollution are
listed below:
Tomato,
watermelon, squash, potato, string beans, snap beans, pinto beans, tobacco,
soybeans, cantaloupe, muskmelon, alfalfa, beets, sunflower, carrots, sweet
corn, gourds, green peas, turnips, grapes, peaches and strawberries.
The wine
industry could also be adversely effected in the near future.  Not only in
crop yield but the very essence of its flavours may become tainted.
Air
pollution, in particular ground level ozone, can effect crop yields of wheat
and rice.  One report from India quoted a 50% reduction in crop
production.  This will have a devastating effect on the region as they are
a major grain producer and may destabilise the nation’s food security.
Bees
A recent
study conducted by The University of South Hampton found that diesel
exhaust fumes change the profile of flora odour.  They say these profile
changes may effect honeybees foraging efficiency and ultimately could affect the
pollination of plants.  Without pollination, crops will fail and create
another threat to food security.  No Bees - No Food - No Us.
AIR POLLUTION IS THE WORLD'S LARGEST SINGLE
ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH RISK
List of 6 Criteria Pollutants

Particulate MatterParticulate matter (PM), also known as particle pollution, is a mixture of extremely small particles found in the air, including dust, dirt, soot, smoke, and liquid droplets. Two kinds of particulate matter are identified as being harmful to human health: fine particles (PM2.5), which are 2.5 micrometers in diameter or smaller and typically found in smoke or haze
column2: or inhalable coarse particles (PM10), which are between 2.5 micrometers and 10 micrometers in diameter and can be found near roadways and dusty industries. Particulate matter is derived from many different sources, including residential combustion activities and vehicle exhaust. Particulate matter is regulated as one of the six “criteria” pollutants under the federal CAA. Exposure to particulate matter has been linked to a variety of health problems, particularly within the respiratory and cardiovascular systems.

column1: Nitrogen DioxideNitrogen dioxide (NO2) is part of a group of highly reactive gases known as oxides of nitrogen (NOx) and is harmful to human health and the environment. Nitrogen dioxide is emitted from many sources when fuel is burned at high temperatures, including industrial, commercial and residential combustion, motor vehicles, and electric utilities. For this reason, individuals who spend time on or near major roadways are at higher risk for short-term exposure. Nitrogen dioxide is regulated as one of the six “criteria” pollutants under the federal CAA and is harmful to human health, particularly the respiratory system.
Carbon Monoxide

Carbon monoxide (CO) is a colorless, odorless gas that is regulated under the federal CAA as one of the six “criteria” pollutants. Carbon monoxide is primarily emitted from combustion processes and the majority of emissions come from mobile sources, especially in urban areas. It is considered very dangerous and harmful to human health and the environment because it can reduce the amount of oxygen delivered to the body’s organs, like the heart and the brain. At very high levels, it can lead to death. People with several types of heart disease may be more severely affected by short-term carbon monoxide exposure.
Ozone

Ozone (O3), or “ground-level ozone”, is one of the six major pollutants identified by scientists as being harmful to both humans and the environment. Ground-level ozone, which is regulated by the federal CAA, is emitted by a chemical reaction between oxides of nitrogen (NOx) and volatile organic compounds (VOCs). Major contributors of NOx and VOCs that lead to the creation of ozone include motor vehicle exhaust from cars, trucks, off-road vehicles, agricultural and construction vehicles, industrial emissions, gasoline vapors, and chemical solvents. Ground-level ozone can inflame and damage lungs, increase the frequency of asthma attacks, and make the lungs more susceptible to infection.
Sulfur Dioxide

Sulfur dioxide (SO2) is part of a group of highly reactive gases known as oxides of sulfur (SOx) and is primarily derived from fossil fuel combustion at power plants and other industrial facilities. Other sources of SO2 include industrial processes like extracting metal from ore and the burning of high sulfur fuels. Sulfur dioxide is one of the six “criteria” air pollutants regulated under the federal CAA. Sulfur dioxide is considered to be harmful to human health and has been linked with many adverse health effects, particularly within the respiratory system.
Lead

Lead (Pb) is a metal that is both naturally occurring and found in manufactured products, and is also one of the six “criteria” pollutants regulated under the federal CAA. Sources of lead include smelters, mining operations, waste incinerators, battery recycling, and the production of lead shot and fishing sinkers. Lead is also released by burning coal, oil, or solid waste. Lead-based paint may also be present in older homes. It is toxic to both humans and animals, with small children being at the highest risk for lead poisoning.
Thank
you for your attention.

The idea
One year ago we decided to realize this idea in order to show to the public the house of the 2020. We are all engineers and passive house designers, members of the Hellenic Passive House Institute, the greek affiliate of the International Passive House Association. 

This project is a critical point on the road to the greek NZEB building of the 2020. We want to show to the people, to the engineers, to the market, to the government that consuming much less energy is achievable and cost effective.

column1: Why we ask for funding?

In order to be able to realize the project, we have asked material and equipment companies to sponsor the project. The feedback until now was great and more than expected. There are still some costs to be covered, concerning the general renovation of the building.

Unfortunately we face now the worst period of the financial crisis in Greece and there is no opportunity to get funding from any bank at the moment. Our Banks are closed and we don't know when will they open again and how they will finance the market.

By supporting us and our project you will give us the opportunity to finish our project and to show to the public in Greece that there is a way for development in the building sector, there is a way to fight against energy poverty, the are options for greek engineers and architects to stay in the country and work for better buildings and better quality of life, there are solutions for a new start in our country.
Let us give you some more details about the project:

A team of engineers, all certified passive house designers, with the support of the Hellenic Passive House Institute, will implement the pilot project Passivistas: thehouseproject concerning the Energy Upgrade of a residence in Athens according to the Passivhaus standard  as a tool of continuous and open Education, and Awareness.

The pilot project is the retrofit  of a typical 125m2 one family house of the 60s, in order to minimize (if not eliminate entirely) the need for conventional heating or air conditioning. The selected property is located in the Municipality of Papagou. It consists of ground floor dwelling area E = 98,5M2 and independent semi-basement area space E = 30,5M2. The building is angular projection, with the north-east and south-east facing the road, while being 1.000 meters from the exit of the Attiki Ring road and 1500 meters from the Metro Station of National Defence. Is a full house with garden, structured in a proper spatial planning and the living space of the ground floor has a living room, kitchen, bathroom and two bedrooms.

The way of design and step-by-step implementation, and the subsequent monitoring and metering pilot project Passivistas: thehouseproject will promote collaborative processes among executives of HPHI, certified passive building designers, engineers and technicians from all sectors and commercial and technical department of companies manufacturing and marketing passive house components. It will offer to every citizen through open public data all the information required on how to drastically save energy in his house, while improving quality of life and contributing substantially to the fight against global warming.

During the implementation phases of energy upgrading work, the aim of the pilot project is to act as a  education- hub for technicians and engineers of all disciplines working in the field of energy renovation of buildings, the ongoing project will implement the following lines of action:

· Technical presentations for engineers from all materials which will be applied to the project. (Log engineers with the Greek Industry of Technology in Energy Saving)
· Training workshops  for  technicians and installers during the installation within the building upgrade phases

· Visits  of student groups and in situ presentation of the  project, construction phases, and details of how the design and execution of this (contact and familiarization of students of technology and private institutions with a key aspect of future professional activity).
· Cooperation with the local authorities  and organizing visits and in situ presentation for  citizens on issues in energy upgrading of private property.

After completion of the pilot project Passivistas: thehouseproject the house will  act as media  and collaborative process  hub aimed  to prove in practice the ability to upgrade the energy consumption of  residential buildings in Greece, so they do not need conventional heating or air conditioning, while drastically reducing energy costs and improve the quality of life in them. And all this at an acceptable cost to the community. Specifically the implemented project will implement the following action axes:

. The ground floor of the project will act as an open residence for seven consecutive years . open for guided visits, lectures and presentations to the public and to engineers, etc
· The space of the basement will serve as headquarters of HPHI as well as a venue of seminars, training, materials showroom etc.

· Throughout the period of implementation and management of the pilot project, the communication of the event is important. For this reason HPHI created  the project website and will cover via an interactive blog all steps and aspects of the project. On the website  every citizen can be informed on how to design, stages of implementation, the  specifications of materials and controls, and to see online measurements and actual operation and consumption of the building.
The plans and the calculations for the Enerphit procedure are finalized, the needed building permissions have been taken and the project started on the 1.7.2015

Buffalo may be famous for snow BUT we will create a Blizzard of Blossoms in spring!

Last year we started the First Annual Buffalo Cherry Blossom Festival.  Now we are planning another celebration of early spring starting May 2, 2015.  Buffalo deserves a celebration after snow melt time. The Festival includes Films, Music, Dancers, Parades and Tree Planting events. Our focus is to to build a citywide carpet of blossoming cherry trees which will eventually create blizzards of petals in our glorious May breezes.

Today we are creating a variation on our blizzardy notoriety by planting a vast number of cherry trees which will eventually create a breathtaking storm of warm beauty.  Our Buffalo spring festival will follow Washington DC's National Festival just in time to attract visitors who want to extend their early springtime pleasure with a visit to Niagara Falls, and Buffalo's beautiful Japanese Garden within the Fredrick Law Olmsted parks system, the first of Olmsted's renowned plans. 

This campaign is to raise ""seedling"" funds to buy 100 blossoming Cherry trees  and to invest in community education about the planting and care of the trees until maturity.  Funds raised will buy wholesale trees, support the Buffalo Olmsted Conservancy, pay entertainers and support the beautiful Buffalo Japanese Garden of Buffalo.

This year we aim to sell two varieties of blossoming cherries to all who are willing to plant and care for trees where they can. These cherry trees will be planted by private property owners, in corporate landscapes, by city utilities with overhead wires (cherries are low growing trees which are suitable for cityscapes) and urban gardeners.  The Olmsted Conservancy gardeners will present tree planting and care events.

We will promote events during blossom season.  We will celebrate spring beauty in Buffalo NY.
