**Update**

Hey everyone!  We have FIVE days left!  We have made some changes and it will all work out for the best! 

It looks like we're going to be able to rent a brand new space on a main road to use for our production facility.  We plan to share with one or two other companies so that we can pay less rent.

BUT we will still have to outfit it with everything a commercial kitchen needs and that isn't cheap!!

In these next five days lets see if we can get to 10,000!  Show the world that you are backing this movement to un-change our climate!  Eat bugs! Save the world!

Here's a little something I wrote for you:


That Rob Thomas song always bothered me

We're just sitting here waiting for the world to change

Maybe that's what was happening just before now.

WARRIORS! for the people! and the planet!

I have an announcement to make

This is DRASTIC

NO TIME LEFT to be elastic

Our sea life is dying

Our deserts expanding

Rainforests dwindling
hanging on a tiny branch over the cliff

We are speeding, racing towards a MEGA population

If we are going to keep the life we love
giving thanks for trees, seas, delicious whirled peas

We WILL get smaller, we WIll buy smaller, 
we WILL live smaller
we WILL drive smaller or not at all
we WILL BE SO SMALL that the mark we make here

WILL BE NEXT TO NONE.

We must turn this around so that

Our great grandchildren

will be able to live life as we have, or better

not

in the most extreme weather and natural disaster that has hit this planet EVER

not

with the human race headed for extinction


OVER CONSUMPTION CONSUMPTION CONSUMPTION


What do I need to do for everyone to pay attention?


We already know the most important vote we cast is done everyday by how we spend our money...

So do we want to fund NEW DESERTS, OIL SPILLS, AND RAPE?

Or do we want to invest in love, creation of community, and abolishing FEAR and HATE?

Are you thinking, This girl is crazy?

because I am thinking most of us are LAZY!

Can not we see our own ability?

YOU ARE POWERFUL!
MAKE YOUR LIFE MEANINGFUL!

And I'm sad to bring it down to this, but I feel like we're used to this

treatment

Must I show my tits or say FUCK

for people to WAKE UP?

Maybe if I win a football game
or acquire a lot of fame

I'm sorry I don't have a cute baby animal to do a trick for you

I'm sorry I don't have a fat juicy oiled up ass for you to gawk at

I'm sorry I didn't hit #1 with a psychologically manufactured pop song


What if, instead, I could start a trend just by loving

I have all my limbs and most of my brains, and I'm still young enough
to do a whole bunch... 

Let us make this world move in a wiser direction

My heart is pounding

because I am founding

a business based on love


We are no longer waiting for the world to change

It is changing, you're on board. How will you show it?


Welcome to the age of aquarius

where we begin to CARRY US

Love,

Alyssa

***********************************************************************

Original Story:

Hi, we are the DeRonne Family!  We need a place and the tools to build our Protein/Energy Bar business.  We will give back through personally connecting our community and working towards becoming a B Corp.  Read on to hear the whole story!
column9:
>We have a vision, and we have a lot of determination!  We want to save the world! We want to save the planet from deforestation and we want to save our water from contamination.  It's hard to figure out where to start.  It seems like everyone is confused about finding a solution.  

We feel like some of the problems we face today come from mass production of livestock, and the lack of home edible gardening and farming.  Imagine how our lives would change if we all started producing our own food, and taking part in our communities again.  Instead of fighting the old, we're building the new!

One way we can start making a huge impact is by incorporating insects into our diets.  Insects!  Entomophagy to be exact.  Entomophagy is the practice of eating insects.  Now, hold on.  80% of the world already eats insects.  As a matter of fact, we all used to eat insects.

We have been creating delicious healthy snacks and treats with cricket powder...flavors like Orange Carrot, Ginger Vanilla, and Blueberry Maca! Alyssa has carefully designed each mostly-organic, gluten-free protein bar for exquisite taste and specific health benefits.  For instance, most of the bars contain Himalayan pink sea salt which is said to regulate water content in the body, promote healthy ph balance in cells, maintain blood sugar levels, and reduce the signs of aging.  If you scroll down you can learn about each bar and it's benefits.

column1: Our livestock industry is destroying our world, and if we replaced cattle and swine with insects for consumption (even just a little bit) then we could start rebuilding our forests, and giving land back to the people and animals we've stolen it from.  We need to do this because we owe it to the planet, animals, and people.

As a bonus, crickets are much healthier and easier to digest than cattle or swine.  They pack a ton of B12, Magnesium, Calcium, Iron, and Potassium, not to mention a higher Protein dose per serving than beef or pork with less fat and calories!  They don't even carry the bacteria that cattle, swine, or poultry can.

column5: >Let's work together.  You help us, we help you! These protein bars are made with ingredients like oats, coconut, and dates!

>We need to buy a small building/kitchen to continue with the business.  If we have our own space to work in we will be able to produce the cricket bars on a larger scale and meet the growing demands so that more people can enjoy the products.   The building will be used both for production and for the LaViewEye organization.
>How we plan to help revolutionize business:
>Finally, we want to become a B (Be the change!) Corporation.  It's capitalism with a conscious!  Here are some words from the B Corp website:

column1: <blockquote>
<span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: >B Corp is to business what Fair Trade certification is to coffee or USDA Organic certification is to milk.
column5: >B Corps are certified by the nonprofit B Lab to meet rigorous standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency.

column2: >One big challenge right now is supply!  The bug business is a great one to be in right now... all the farmers are having a hard time keeping up with demand.  We can't find a supplier of whole crickets at the moment, but we do have a cricket powder supplier.  This means we are able to make the bars, but we can't make our signature cricket powder.  As soon as we can get supply, we'll be right back at it making our own powder.

","**Update**Hey everyone!  We have FIVE days left!  We have made some changes and it will all work out for the best! It looks like we're going to be able to rent a brand new space on a main road to use for our production facility.  We plan to share with one or two other companies so that we can pay less rent.BUT we will still have to outfit it with everything a commercial kitchen needs and that isn't cheap!!In these next five days lets see if we can get to 10,000!  Show the world that you are backing this movement to un-change our climate!  Eat bugs! Save the world!Here's a little something I wrote for you:That Rob Thomas song always bothered meWe're just sitting here waiting for the world to changeMaybe that's what was happening just before now.WARRIORS! for the people! and the planet!I have an announcement to makeThis is DRASTICNO TIME LEFT to be elasticOur sea life is dyingOur deserts expandingRainforests dwindlinghanging on a tiny branch over the cliffWe are speeding, racing towards a MEGA populationIf we are going to keep the life we lovegiving thanks for trees, seas, delicious whirled peasWe WILL get smaller, we WIll buy smaller, we WILL live smallerwe WILL drive smaller or not at allwe WILL BE SO SMALL that the mark we make hereWILL BE NEXT TO NONE.We must turn this around so thatOur great grandchildrenwill be able to live life as we have, or betternotin the most extreme weather and natural disaster that has hit this planet EVERnotwith the human race headed for extinctionOVER CONSUMPTION CONSUMPTION CONSUMPTIONWhat do I need to do for everyone to pay attention?We already know the most important vote we cast is done everyday by how we spend our money...So do we want to fund NEW DESERTS, OIL SPILLS, AND RAPE?Or do we want to invest in love, creation of community, and abolishing FEAR and HATE?Are you thinking, This girl is crazy?because I am thinking most of us are LAZY!Can not we see our own ability?YOU ARE POWERFUL!MAKE YOUR LIFE MEANINGFUL!And I'm sad to bring it down to this, but I feel like we're used to thistreatmentMust I show my tits or say FUCKfor people to WAKE UP?Maybe if I win a football gameor acquire a lot of fameI'm sorry I don't have a cute baby animal to do a trick for youI'm sorry I don't have a fat juicy oiled up ass for you to gawk atI'm sorry I didn't hit #1 with a psychologically manufactured pop songWhat if, instead, I could start a trend just by lovingI have all my limbs and most of my brains, and I'm still young enoughto do a whole bunch... Let us make this world move in a wiser directionMy heart is poundingbecause I am foundinga business based on loveWe are no longer waiting for the world to changeIt is changing, you're on board. How will you show it?Welcome to the age of aquariuswhere we begin to CARRY USLove,Alyssa***********************************************************************Original Story:Hi, we are the DeRonne Family!  We need a place and the tools to build our Protein/Energy Bar business.  We will give back through personally connecting our community and working towards becoming a B Corp.  Read on to hear the whole story!We have a vision, and we have a lot of determination!  We want to save the world! We want to save the planet from deforestation and we want to save our water from contamination.  It's hard to figure out where to start.  It seems like everyone is confused about finding a solution.  We feel like some of the problems we face today come from mass production of livestock, and the lack of home edible gardening and farming.  Imagine how our lives would change if we all started producing our own food, and taking part in our communities again.  Instead of fighting the old, we're building the new!One way we can start making a huge impact is by incorporating insects into our diets.  Insects!  Entomophagy to be exact.  Entomophagy is the practice of eating insects.  Now, hold on.  80% of the world already eats insects.  As a matter of fact, we all used to eat insects.We have been creating delicious healthy snacks and treats with cricket powder...flavors like Orange Carrot, Ginger Vanilla, and Blueberry Maca! Alyssa has carefully designed each mostly-organic, gluten-free protein bar for exquisite taste and specific health benefits.  For instance, most of the bars contain Himalayan pink sea salt which is said to regulate water content in the body, promote healthy ph balance in cells, maintain blood sugar levels, and reduce the signs of aging.  If you scroll down you can learn about each bar and it's benefits.

Our livestock industry is destroying our world, and if we replaced cattle and swine with insects for consumption (even just a little bit) then we could start rebuilding our forests, and giving land back to the people and animals we've stolen it from.  We need to do this because we owe it to the planet, animals, and people.

As a bonus, crickets are much healthier and easier to digest than cattle or swine.  They pack a ton of B12, Magnesium, Calcium, Iron, and Potassium, not to mention a higher Protein dose per serving than beef or pork with less fat and calories!  They don't even carry the bacteria that cattle, swine, or poultry can.
Let's work together.  You help us, we help you! These protein bars are made with ingredients like oats, coconut, and dates!

We need to buy a small building/kitchen to continue with the business.  If we have our own space to work in we will be able to produce the cricket bars on a larger scale and meet the growing demands so that more people can enjoy the products.   The building will be used both for production and for the LaViewEye organization.
How we plan to help revolutionize business:
Finally, we want to become a B (Be the change!) Corporation.  It's capitalism with a conscious!  Here are some words from the B Corp website:

B Corp is to business what Fair Trade certification is to coffee or USDA Organic certification is to milk.  B Corps are certified by the nonprofit B Lab to meet rigorous standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency.
http://www.bcorporation.net/what-are-b-corps
We really want to make a difference while we are playing around on this planet.  Will you support us?
You can also contribute by SHARING this with everyone!  The more people we contact, the better chance we will have of being successful.
Thank you!
Oh, and by the way... say LaViewEye three times fast and you'll realize it's cricket latin for I LOVE YOU!!
Dollar Break-Down
Building: $30-50,000
Stretch Goals (Help us create a stronger community & healthier world)
Fix water lines: $5,000
Fix roof, and install solar: $30,000
Miscellaneous building materials/Appliances: $20,000
B Corp membership: $500
Risks and Challenges
We could possibly not get the building we want, and have to try for another, probably more expensive building.
Unforeseen repairs - we have done all due diligence, but with any property there sometimes are surprise fixes that need to be done.

One big challenge right now is supply!  The bug business is a great one to be in right now... all the farmers are having a hard time keeping up with demand.  We can't find a supplier of whole crickets at the moment, but we do have a cricket powder supplier.  This means we are able to make the bars, but we can't make our signature cricket powder.  As soon as we can get supply, we'll be right back at it making our own powder.",5.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Asheville, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/lavieweye-the-future-of-food/pica

","Short Summary

Did you know that in 15 days there were over 10 instances of injured marine wildlife on the Eastern Aegean Islands in Greece? This is not an unusual occurrence. Unfortunately, in the summer months these instances become more frequent. With over 25000 touristic vessels and 30 million tourists travelling through the area, the number of collisions with boats increases, and the larger human presence causes a massive shock for the wildlife.
This poor turtle was found entangled in fishing line and the damage caused resulted in the total loss of her front right flipper.
Currently there is no facility within the Aegean that will care for and rehabilitate marine animals in their natural environment, which would allow a smoother transition back into the wild.
This campaign aims to raise a start-up fund for a new, in sea, rehabilitation centre situated on the west of Lipsi Island in the Bay of Vroulia.

The isolated bay and building have been kindly provided to Archipelagos by the Municipality of Lipsi where the local community has been fully supportive of this pioneering initiative. With your support we can fund the beginnings of a new rehabilitation centre for many endangered animals in need.
This diagram indicates the location of the Bay of Vroulia and proposed location of the enclosure and building on Lipsi Island.

Archipelagos Institute of Marine Conservation is a Greek non-profit, non-governmental organisation founded in 1998. It is committed to researching and defending the biodiversity of the Greek seas and islands as well as the rest of the NE Mediterranean region.
What We Need & What You Get
Even with all the hard voluntary work from over 35
Archipelagos team members, which comprises of young researchers and scientists
from all over the world, it is not possible for us to complete this project
without your help. For the initial start-up fund we need 18000 euros. With this we urgently
need to purchase a special net, this will be 200m wide and have a depth of 25m
to enclose the bay. This will also fund the fencing and the first equipment for first aid
and rehabilitation.
As an incentive for your donations we aim
to give away unique Archipelagos goodies, ranging from tweets and t-shirts to
being able to spend a day with the marine mammal research team!
The Impact
The image above shows the consequences of illegal dynamite fishing and it's impact on the population of endangered monk seals in the area. Unfortunately this is not an isolated event.

This project is important as it will create the only natural marine rehabilitation centre of it's type in the Aegean Sea. With this new facility we would be able to rehabilitate the animals in a natural but controlled environment. The bay will also serve as a fisheries hatchery. It will be able to replenish fish stocks in the area and keep them sustainable for local fishermen, as well as encouraging the marine animals to feed for themselves as part of their transition back into the wild.
Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't afford to donate yourself don't forget to share the cause with family, friends and anyone else with an interest. Further information and details of Archipelagos' work can be found on our website, along with other ways to contribute or even volunteer with us yourself!",3.0,0,"6 Campaigns
|","Lipsi, Greece",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/help-protect-injured-marine-animals-in-the-aegean/pica

My name is Karl Justice I am with KEAB Nano Tech.

I worked in the aircraft manufacturing where I helped develop the C-17 which is one huge project that I can say I made a difference.  I worked as an aircraft mechanic, managed a factory, US army, firefighter paramedic, and construction. Total time in manufacturing 23 years. Management for 22 years! I am involved in the research of nanotechnology.   

CVD

Single Walled Carbon Nanotube


I plan to  perform  self-assembly of Nanotubes, and graphene through Chemical Vapor Deposition. Following with research in functionalizing of various other nano materials for the environment. 

How it works!


I need to Test quality!

SEM Microscopy

I want to contribute to society,  to help our environment through Nanotechnology. In addition, I will have the help of an Electrical Engineer specializing in electronics, and a nanotechnology consultant. I will hire and intern. To follow I will perform more research in  filtration applications.

I need to buy a Chemical Vapor Deposition Unit and a SEM Microscope for testing, also I need to rent a space and build a clean room to prevent contamination during research and development.

If I don't reach my goal the funds will go to research and development. I will buy materials and rent time on other equipment. If I go beyond my goal then I will hire one more intern and perform more research on funtionalizing other nano products. Possibly buy more equipment.
column3:
/>



Nanotechnology will improve the way we live.

column1: The following applications will come out of Nanotubes and Graphene:
Stronger materials
Cheap Electricity With Better Solar Cells
Salt Water Generating Electricity
Cleaner Drinking Water
Fresh Water From The Oceans
Stronger materials
Better Drug Delivery To Fight Cancer and Other Illnesses
Fuel Efficient Cars
Lighter and Stronger Aircraft With Better Fuel Efficiency
Actually Any Material We Use Will Be Changed Through Nanotechnology!

If there is any risk involved it is not to try, otherwise I will have plenty of expert help and fresh new minds for ideas to explore! This is a totally new technology with plenty of doors for KEAB Nano Tech to open!
If you cannot help financially help spread the word, this technology is for everyone. If we reach 500,000 dollars we will have a kickoff party!

Solar Youth Power

Ahead of the Paris climate talks at the UN in December, this is a unique opportunity for children and youth in the Ottawa-Gatineau region to express to the newly elected Canadian government the urgency of fighting climate change by transitioning our country rapidly from fossil fuels to renewable energy. 

Each child/youth will be given a solar light and together they will form the image of the sun. At dusk, aerial photos will be taken of this formation and shared widely with the media and on social media platforms. 

We know that younger generations will be the most impacted by climate change
column2:
this is an opportunity for you to make your voice heard. 

We hope to see you there! 
Cool It for the Kids, together with CHEO's Green Team

","Version Fr
Who we are?
First of all let us tell you a story

My name is David and my wife’s name is Linda, it has been 5 years since we met and now newlyweds. I arrived in the Seychelles in 2010 for tourism but I was far from imagining meeting the woman of my life. We decided to drop everything and settle there.

As having done my studies in agriculture the idea of creating a farm germinated in our head. Our beginnings were difficult because of lack of access to funds so we had to use our savings to start the business. Our first task was to clear the area with a large vegetation on the land.
We then started to plant different kind of crops such as tomatoes sweet potatoes to sell on the local market and in parallel a compost production due to a request for access to organic fertilizers.

During a cleaning expedition we had the pleasure to come across a colony of wild bees, and then it strike us. We have always respected and appreciated this animal but now it all came clear in our mind that it will be our future.
While doing my researches we continued in our path to produce authentic and traditional, so we launched our jam and fresh juice with fruits from our farm, the delights of Rosine.
We also developed innovative growing techniques with a nice record for a local pumpkin of 5Kg.
And the launching of our compost in their little bags.
As you can see it is not ideas that we lack.
What is our project?

Our project starts simply from the alarming decline of bees in the world, I can give you  reference list of misfortunes that bees are facing all over the world and especially in the USA, France , Europe ... The whole world is affected by this disease.

The Seychelles still enjoy unspoiled nature due to its small area and lack of mass industrialization and intensive agriculture. Here everything is still traditional but with a very active economy through tourism and fisheries.
Seychelles is this little piece of paradise still existing on earth with
Its International Carnival of Victoria
The Coco de mer a unique fruit that grows only in Seychelles, this is not a joke
Its musicians playing tunes from a distant era
The Moutia a local dance bringing us back to the Pirates days with lively rhythms
And a so generous and well preserved nature by the country

Here bees are not touched by this great sickness affecting the industrialized countries. Producing honey in this sanctuary is also setting up a king of bee's bank if they were to disappear  from the world. Of course we cannot ensure a global restoration, but it's these small islands like ours that could one day save those little sentinels who every day make certain the pollination of plants and then food on your table.

Contributing towards our project is to give a chance to the Bees, it is also participating in a sustainable program with a strong environmental impact. In addition to that it's a chance to book a quality and crystal clear honey, with no chemicals directly at your home and sustain a dynamic and growing local economy.
Now let's talk business
Here is the list of materials needed to start our Bee Farm:
2 Bee keeper suits 360$
Smoker 60$
Latex Gloves 15$
Rise Frames 15$
Swarm Seize 40$
Bucket 20$
Soaker 150$
Filter 10$
Uncapped Tray 150$
Frame Pliers 25$
Hives Langstroth Frame Hoffman 1000$
2kg
Wax 50$
Packaging
(Stickers + Pots) 300$
Extractor 300$

That makes a total of 2495 $, allowing us to directly start the activity, we shall populate our hives with our bees already present on the farm and other swarms that we have booked with some colleagues. In our 5 years projection we aim a population of a 100 hives.

If we do not reach our goal, every dollar you have given us will serve to finance the basic equipment such as bee keeper suits plus smoker and if ever we exceed our goal, it will used to buy better equipment and / or buy other hives.
After getting the funds, every steps will be posted on our facebook page, letting you the possibility to follow us through the procedure.

We are targeting two types of market. First one the local market with the local people as well as 5 stars hotels and second one the exportation promoted by our geographic location, ""Seychelles Honey"" available on our online store.

We are aware that it is a lot of work, but we are young and have ambition. Even if you think with 5$ you cannot change the world, imagine with 10 000 people, were to take that step? This money will create dynamism on the other side of the earth in a very small island. And if you do not want to fund this project you can always share it to your contacts, who maybe interested in supporting this project. Just give us a chance

I also want to deeply thanks the forum http://www.ruche-apiculture.com/ for their support, knowledge, and patience that they provide me to ensure this project and especially Barbemiel.",25.0,1,"1 Campaign
|","Victoria, Seychelles",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/creation-of-bee-s-farm-in-seychelles/pica

Save Yellow Dog Village

 

Yellow Dog Village should be saved and preserved. This is an important historical site, a miners village with 34 houses that hold within them the histories of hundreds of families over the past 100 years.

After almost a year of clean-up of cutting and grazing weeds and grasses, cutting trees and shrubs back, and picking up trash, tires, etc, the village looks like a village again. We have gone to several banks for money to repair the houses and water system, so the village can be preserved, and they all want income from the village before they loan money to make it possible to bring in income.

Lacking bank funding, the only way to save the village, and all the houses, is to do repairs that are needed immediately. Your donations will all go toward repairs and preservation of the structures and facilities.
What We Need &
column2:
What You Get 

At this time, there are six houses that need immediate roof repair. Overhanging branches have damaged the shingles, and water has rotted some eave boards, and some plaster is falling in third floor rooms in those six houses. This must be addressed immediately, and we can't wait for banks.

column1: The water system has to be replaced entirely. Initial contacts with PA DEP indicate that we can work together to create a safe water system again.

For former residents, we want to be able to restore the village to a place you can be proud to have in your heritage. We want to be able to host reunions, to have you share in our successes as we rebuild this historical site. All of this requires that first step, donations to tighten up the houses, so they can be preserved without further damage, and to make it possible to begin bringing in income by renting shop space and residences.

The Project

 

In keeping with the historical nature of the village, our plan is to make the village a place of education and learning of the traditional, rural way of life. As with any rural village, we desire to have a mix of residences, skilled craftsmen, and retail sales. Our plan may become a model for how other historical villages can be preserved.

   

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and tell everyone with interest in Yellow Dog Village about this campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Apa kabar, all. Iʻm Shaun Campbell, founder and President of an upstart biocultural conservation 501(c)3 nonprofit focusing our efforts on a group of spectacular and important islands called Raja Ampat in Indonesia. Our approach is biocultural, meaning that we attend to that rich but neglected adaptive interweave of people and place, culture and ecology. Our strategy within Raja Ampat focuses on fortifying and renewing local culturally-based economies in the face of growing extractive industries, land conversion, and a steady devaluation of traditional practices. In response to global pressures driving communities into the ‘cash economy’, there are grassroots movements in the other direction, ones that assert the value of indigenous languages and cultures and biodiverse landscapes as ways to make a better life and a solid foundation for biodiversity and ecosystem conservation and national development.

This campaign is specifically to raise money to fund our registration of our international non-governmental organization with the governments of the Raja Ampat Regency in the province of West Papua, Indonesia.  This is critical to our functioning as an international NGO operating in West Papua, as our funding and programs cannot be carried out in Raja Ampat without such registration and clearance by the regional government. These monies will allow us to officially  “set up shop” in Indonesia and provide local communities in Raja Ampat with the kinds of community and environmental services we offer.  Your contribution to our campaign would be transformative, not only for our nonprofit, but for the peoples and biodiversity of these islands.

We ask your help in funding this next phase of our operation, which requires approximately US$2,000.00 for registration fees, with an additional small buffer to ensure against currency fluctuations and to help us with some basic office supplies for our operation in Raja Ampat.  In exchange for every $100 you donate, we will offer you an original “Save Raja Ampat” tee-shirt in the size you specify.  Itʻs a great shirt and design that says to others that you support a unique effort in an important part of the planet.

Should our campaign fall short unnecessarily of our US$3,000.00 goal, you can rest assured that any money that you have given will be set aside strictly for the purposes we have indicated here.  
 
Understand that the impact of your contribution is immense and transformative.  Your donation will allow the fine and able people of our organization to begin their important work of researching and designing services that fit within a biocultural framework that places importance on languages, cultures, and unparalleled biodiversity of ecosystems in the sustainable development of the Raja Ampat archipelago. Youʻll help improve human lives and the biodiverse ecosystems in which these people live and confront change from such things as modernization and climate change.


Your donation helps facilitate these things with virtually no risk involved, as our staff in Raja Ampat have already prepared the registration paperwork and require only your small contribution to see our work on its way locally.  We believe that with giving such as yours we will readily achieve our campaign goal.  We have built a cushion into our ask to accommodate any unforeseen fluctuations in currency exchange, with any monies beyond the registration fee going to support initial office set-up in Raja Ampat with such things as letter head and other office needs.

Canʻt afford $100? Your contribution, whether $5, $10, $15, $25, or $50, will go a long way in helping us meet our goal here.  If you canʻt donate monetarily to this campaign, you can help immensely by sharing this campaign with friends and family by social media, email, and by using the Idiegogo share tools.  You can also “Like” our page on Facebook and find ways to contribute in the future.

What we are doing:

Thank you for taking the time to read about our mission, we hope you find it as interesting and important as we do. We will be conducting research on the Khumbu Glacier in Nepal this autumn and as part of this we want to engage, train, and inspire local students and researchers that would not otherwise have such opportunities. We believe this will help improve preparedness and resilience in Nepal to the environmental changes that the coming decades will bring.

We are a team of glaciologists, remote sensors, and water resource researchers,  based at the University of Leeds studying the response of Himalayan glaciers to climate change. We do this using remote sensing techniques on satellite imagery, and through fieldwork on the Khumbu Glacier over the past decade (the glacier that is home to Everest Base Camp). This allows us to observe how fast the glaciers are moving, how glacial lakes form on and around glaciers, and how glaciers are melting in response to a changing climate.

We know that the surface of glaciers can lower by several meters each year - i.e. the ice is melting, but the processes behind this are not yet fully understood. The thick layer of debris that covers many of the glaciers should insulate the ice beneath and therefore reduce the melt rate. However, this isn't the case on a glacier scale for many glaciers in the region. Our fieldwork with your support will help us to better understand how Everest's glaciers are changing and how this will affect communities in Nepal and across the Himalaya.  This will be published in high-impact peer-reviewed journals.

Our goal is to develop effective ways of communicating our research that will enhance local decision making by engaging with the University of Kathmandu, and to increase public awareness of the importance of shrinking glaciers. Specifically how they will affect local communities and the millions of people that are dependent on melt water for irrigation and sanitation. While melting glaciers may seem like a short-term benefit (more water), glaciers are disappearing, and this changes how much and when the downstream communities receive water. You may have heard of a project to build artificial glaciers to store water and release it gradually to try and mitigate the effects of a changing climate. We urgently need to understand how these high altitude river basins will change to promote sustainable practices and development in Nepal and across the Himalaya.
On the Khumbu Glacier:
We will:
<ul>
• Monitor the thermal properties of lakes that form on the surface of the glacier to understand how they promote melt of the underlying ice.
• Deploy an OpenROV underwater exploration robot to get a unique perspective of the lake environment and help derive lake bathymetry so we can assess volume change over time.

• Derive 3d digital elevation models using Structure-from-Motion technology to assess glacier surface change over time. This technology uses photos from any camera (even a smartphone) taken at different locations, to construct a 3d model. See an example from our pilot study below...
A 3d reconstruction of the Khumbu Glacier made from ground-based photos using a standard digital camera.
Supraglacial ponds visible in the 3d model.
'Sandy' the OpenROV underwater exploration robot.
Public outreach and local involvement in Nepal:

Our public outreach website (www.rockyglaciers.co.uk) is being developed to communicate the outputs of our scientific research in a way that is accessible and understandable by everyone. Within Nepal, we aim to engage and inspire local students about the importance of this research and provide training in the techniques that we use. This will allow sustainable data collection into the future , which will feedback to local stakeholders and improve planning and water-use practices.

During our field campaign we will collect high-definition footage and create a video explaining our research, outreach, and how one fifth of the World's population is dependent upon snow and ice melt for water resources.

With this funding we aim to support at least one local university student/researcher to join our team in the field to help inspire the next generation of researchers both within Nepal and abroad, whilst developing a collaborative partnership with those that live near and rely upon the glaciers for their day-to-day lives.
<a href=""https://sketchfab.com/models/33ce6aba38ae4a049847613a417608a9?utm_source=oembed&amp
<h3 style=""font-size: 13px
column5: >Click here to view a 3d model of the Khumbu Glacier

column1: How your support will help:
<ul>
<li>

Field equipment: we use temperature loggers to monitor how water ponding on the surface of the glacier contributes towards the melt. £25 covers the cost of one sensor....and they have a battery life of several years! We will train local students in their use and leave behind the equipment required to start local data collection.
<li>

Fieldwork: the glacier is around 7 days walk from the nearest airstrip (Lukla), we use a local trekking agency to help with our logistics and transport of equipment up to the glacier. We want to support at least one local student/researcher to join our team who will then be able to disseminate the field training to a wider audience.
<li>

Field photos: if you can't support us financially but have visited the Everest region and have photos of one of the glacier's surface, we may be able to use them to reconstruct a 3d model and help calculate the melt rate of the glacier.
Other ways you can help:

If you can't support our project with a pledge, how about letting us know you support our campaign by sharing this page. Or why not send us a tweet or message if you think you could help in another way.

We are interested in hearing from past visitors to the Everest region (e.g. the Khumbu or Ngozumpa Glaciers) who have photos of the glaciers that we could use in our research. We can use standard digital photos to help assess the melt rate of the glaciers and also construct a 3d model to calculate the change over time. Data from your holiday or expedition snaps may be used in scientific publications, and we will of course keep you updated with all our research and fully acknowledge your support.

Please contact us for further information.

confident that we will deliver all the rewards.

The Tongwe Trust is a small community based organisation in Western Tanzania , close to Lake Tanganyika.

The Trust employs 20 village rangers, who patrol and protect  a vast Village Forest Reserve - over 120,000 acres. 

There are no roads into this area - only elephant trails - so all work is done on foot or by bicycle. 

This is what we call ""narrow-guage conservation"" . No vehicles, no guns, no Expat salaries ....it's a 100% local operation where everything has to be brought in on foot or by Bike. 

Up to now the Tongwe have been using chinese  Phoenix bicycles , sometimes called the ""black mamba"" locally. these bikes are sturdy enough, but only single gear, no suspension  and very heavy to manoeuvre ( see pic on front of Appeal).

Recently we have sourced some excellent , reconditioned Mtn Bikes from a mountaineering buddy in Arusha, northern Tanzania.

He has been importing second hand bikes from Switzerland  - mosty good makes like Giant and KTM - then repairing them in his workshop, adding luggage carriers,etc to make them properly Bush-ready.

Each Mountain Bike - once fully repaired and ready to go - costs £100 ( $150) ""on the trail and ready to go...""

Our aim is to buy up to 25 of these bikes - so that we can replace all the old ""black mambas"" with a fleet of new-ish, fit-for-purpose Mt Bikes.

This will transform how the Rangers get about forest , allowing access to more remote parts of the Reserve.

Any extra Bikes we can buy will be used for the occasional visitors we get coming through the Reserve .... and that could be you !

If you love Bikes and Trees and want to help out some hard-working Tongwe rangers , working at the coal-face of Forest Conservation , then please consider donating a Bike to the Tongwe Trust .

£100 for a good reconditioned Mt Bike - landed and reconditioned in Tanzania - is a great deal.

We only need 25 bikes - so let's get the word out and raise some funds .

column1: ATMO on RADIO-CITY.I
ATMOPC™
ATMOPC produce world unique high technology ecosustainable Computers.
We are Unconventional Green.
ATMO LIGHT WOOD
WE CAN LIVE BETTER!
ATMO can convince you with three valid arguments
<ul>
<li>
Elegance –  eyes nourishment
<li>
Oxygen –  mind nourishment
<li>
Energy saving –  positively impact your wallet and envinronment
<div>
ATMOPC™ Vision

Computer quantity will double within 10 years. It will be therefore a moral and social obligation to minimize the use of raw materials in PC industry. ATMOPC corporate values are already summarized in “Reduce, Reuse and Recycle” It’s now important more then ever before to connect our life to the Nature.
ATMOPC want to provide the basis to actively preserve, protect and improve our wonderful planet.
ATMOPC™ is innovation

ATMO would like to be part of your creative process. Let’s just take a look to ATMO series computers. Put ATMO on your desk and it will immediately relax your eyes with its beautiful wooden case, its elegant plant and zen stones as complement. While you’re working ATMO will gently heat plant on its top. This process plus light will activate photosynthesis. In this good conditions ATMO’s plant start produce Oxygen that will fill your environment.
You can even use stones platform as an essential oil burner to get the scent you like. Now take a deep breath and let ATMO help you.
ATMOPC™ will improve and preserve our environment
ATMOPC Business objectives is to provide to companies and individuals its ecofriendly low power consumption Computers. We want to help our ecosystem mainly in two ways:
• Reduct Carbon Dioxide emissions caused by computers usage

ATMOPC tests and use low energy consumptions components. Some models, such as J1900, do not need even fan systems but just an aluminium thermal module. Computer is cooled by forced natural ventilation.
Computers combined with ATMOPC case and plants consume just ¼ compared to a traditional desktop PC. In the meantime our plants produce Oxygen and grows even thanks to ATMO.
This Process combined with lower consumptions aims to improve climatic conditions and support ATMOPC in the reduction of power plant emissions.
• Deforestation caused by the fall of forests for commercial purposes.
ATMOPC models are provided with a plant. This plant grow better even because ATMO will mantain its perfect grows conditions. After two, three months this plant need to be repotted.

Every ATMO model can host 5-6 plants every year (if you’re not using a succulent plant). We would like to show this technology as a future archetype. We can really produce an “House reforestation” phenomenon. Depending by the plant used we can produce small or large green areas.
At the moment no trees is cutted to produce ATMO series. We will use FSC woods from ecosustainable managed forests.
Our aim is to open new ecosustainable way to intend computer science being apart of our environment needs.
ATMO™ materials

ATMO is made with scraps wood, recycled or just aged wood. There is plenty of this wood for immediate use! This does not mean that it is waste or bad wood, this simply means that this fine wood used to built furniture can’t be used for anything else except to build little things, like ATMO case.
Every ATMOPC Computer is a state of the art handcrafted master piece.
We will even donate 2% of our ATMO net profit for reforestation projects.. We want a GREEN planet!

EVERYONE NEED A PC
IMPROVE OUR ENVIRONMENT, USE ATMOPC™

ATMOPC™
ATMOPC produce world unique high technology ecosustainable Computers.
We are Unconventional Green.
ATMO LIGHT WOOD
WE CAN LIVE BETTER!
ATMO can convince you with three valid arguments
Elegance –  eyes nourishment
Oxygen –  mind nourishment
Energy saving –  positively impact your wallet and envinronment
ATMOPC™ Vision

Computer quantity will double within 10 years. It will be therefore a moral and social obligation to minimize the use of raw materials in PC industry. ATMOPC corporate values are already summarized in “Reduce, Reuse and Recycle” It’s now important more then ever before to connect our life to the Nature.
ATMOPC want to provide the basis to actively preserve, protect and improve our wonderful planet.
ATMOPC™ is innovation

ATMO would like to be part of your creative process. Let’s just take a look to ATMO series computers. Put ATMO on your desk and it will immediately relax your eyes with its beautiful wooden case, its elegant plant and zen stones as complement. While you’re working ATMO will gently heat plant on its top. This process plus light will activate photosynthesis. In this good conditions ATMO’s plant start produce Oxygen that will fill your environment.
You can even use stones platform as an essential oil burner to get the scent you like. Now take a deep breath and let ATMO help you.

About ATMOPC Founder
We're Fabio and Filippo. We create ATMO as a challenge. Can we create a little low power consuption PC that can help improve environment?

Yes we can and we've just made it. Fabio is an informatic science enthusiast working on hardware and software since 1998, he's running a Web Agency visible on www.mondialcloud.net, branded under www.scconsult.it.

Filippo is a master craftsman specialized in tailored wooden works, he's running his own carpentry passed him by his father and grandfather. You can see his realizations on his FB page, www.facebook.com/falegnameriafassera.

column4: >Downtown Hamilton from Sam Lawrence Park.

column1: Bees are under intense pressure from disease, monocrop agriculture and pesticides. Let's give them a helping hand with this urban beehive project in Hamilton, Ontario. With Toronto proclaiming itself as Canada's first Bee City. Hamilton need to step up and show them how it is done. With the colours of the Ticats beeing a perfect match for our honey producing friends it is only fitting that Hamilton becomes host to some residents who are as industrious as the rest of the city.
Campaign Team

My name is Duane Hewitt and I have lived in Hamilton more than fifteen years off and on since I first came here as an undergraduate at McMaster University. I returned to Hamilton in 2005  and have since witnessed the revival of the Ambitious City reborn like a phoenix from the ashes of the steel mills with health care and entrepreneurs leading the way.

I am a scientist and have been concerned for some time about the pressures facing pollinators. I have even put my money where my mouth is for this cause. In 2013 I supported the Indiegogo campaign  by the Ontario Beekeepers Association to Protect the Bees. Last year I purchased a beehive from the AKER urban farming Indiegogo campaign but unfortunately it was too late in the season for me to start the hive. This year I am able to start that hive but I would like to do more and with your help I can!

This year I am able to start that hive but I would like to do more and with your help we can! On June 4th a queen bee and her entourage coming to the AKER top bar hive. This campaign has the goal to support the expansion of this urban beehive project from one to four hives.

column10: '>. I have lived in Hamilton for my whole life, with the exception of while I was attending the University of Waterloo. I am very involved in the rescue community helping save the lives and be a voice for cats, dogs, and wildlife. I was first introduced to the plight of the bees by Duane and it seemed only natural that I should help them survive as well.

column1: The Plight of the Bumble(Honey) Bee

So how can we help save the bees? The two most basic ways are to stop harming bees and start promoting good bee health. In order to do this, we need to move away from monoculture farming and the use of pesticides Ironically urban environments currently offer more hospitable environments than rural locations due to pesticide use and industrial farming.

from local suppliers. These hives will house thousands of honey bees in the Westdale area of Hamilton near a Community Garden, which is surrounded by a
very suitable habitat for bees to forage. If sufficient funds are raised we
will install a pollinator garden to further support our bee colony. These bees
will be monitored by local beekeepers to ensure they are happy and healthy.

","Hamilton Urban Beehive Project.
""If the bees disappear then we'll all be stung."" David Suzuki*
Downtown Hamilton from Sam Lawrence Park. By Aronmolina - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=43205616

Bees are under intense pressure from disease, monocrop agriculture and pesticides. Let's give them a helping hand with this urban beehive project in Hamilton, Ontario. With Toronto proclaiming itself as Canada's first Bee City. Hamilton need to step up and show them how it is done. With the colours of the Ticats beeing a perfect match for our honey producing friends it is only fitting that Hamilton becomes host to some residents who are as industrious as the rest of the city.
Campaign Team

My name is Duane Hewitt and I have lived in Hamilton more than fifteen years off and on since I first came here as an undergraduate at McMaster University. I returned to Hamilton in 2005  and have since witnessed the revival of the Ambitious City reborn like a phoenix from the ashes of the steel mills with health care and entrepreneurs leading the way.

I am a scientist and have been concerned for some time about the pressures facing pollinators. I have even put my money where my mouth is for this cause. In 2013 I supported the Indiegogo campaign  by the Ontario Beekeepers Association to Protect the Bees. Last year I purchased a beehive from the AKER urban farming Indiegogo campaign but unfortunately it was too late in the season for me to start the hive. This year I am able to start that hive but I would like to do more and with your help I can!

This year I am able to start that hive but I would like to do more and with your help we can! On June 4th a queen bee and her entourage coming to the AKER top bar hive. This campaign has the goal to support the expansion of this urban beehive project from one to four hives.

My name is Ashley Cooney. I have lived in Hamilton for my whole life, with the exception of while I was attending the University of Waterloo. I am very involved in the rescue community helping save the lives and be a voice for cats, dogs, and wildlife. I was first introduced to the plight of the bees by Duane and it seemed only natural that I should help them survive as well. Every life, no matter how big or small, long or short, matters.
The Plight of the Bumble(Honey) Bee

So how can we help save the bees? The two most basic ways are to stop harming bees and start promoting good bee health. In order to do this, we need to move away from monoculture farming and the use of pesticides Ironically urban environments currently offer more hospitable environments than rural locations due to pesticide use and industrial farming.
Your contribution to our campaign will allow us to
procure, set up, and maintain up to four (depending on your support!) bee hives
from local suppliers. These hives will house thousands of honey bees in the Westdale area of Hamilton near a Community Garden, which is surrounded by a
very suitable habitat for bees to forage. If sufficient funds are raised we
will install a pollinator garden to further support our bee colony. These bees
will be monitored by local beekeepers to ensure they are happy and healthy.
Stretch Goals
1) Bee Cam

If we achieve sufficient support we would like to participate in the Eyes on Hives project which has a camera which monitors the health of the hive by tracking activity. Backers will have an opportunity to watch the bees.
2) Custom Pollinator Garden
3) TBD
For more information about the plight of the bees:
(*)http://www.davidsuzuki.org/blogs/science-matter...

Monoculture: Nothing to Dance About. Retrieved May 18, 2016, from
http://blogs.scientificamerican.com/guest-blog/honey-bees-and-monoculture-nothing-to-dance-about/
(2) GreenPeace Research Laboratories. (2013, January). Bees
In Decline. Retrieved May 18, 2016, from
http://sos-bees.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/BeesInDecline.pdf
(3) Lindsey, R. (2007, September 7). Will Plants and
Pollinators Get Out of Sync? Retrieved May 18, 2016, from
http://earthobservatory.nasa.gov/Features/Bees/bees3.php
(4) Ontario Ministry of Environment and Climate Change.
(2016, April 22). Pollinator Health. Retrieved May 18, 2016, from https://www.ontario.ca/page/pollinator-health
(5) US Environmental Protection Agency. (2016,
April 27). Pollinator Protection: Colony Collapse Disorder. Retrieved May 18,
2016, from https://www.epa.gov/pollinator-protection/colony-collapse-disorder

Thank you for your contributions thus far!
column2: >Update: We have broken ground on the ethnobotanic garden!

column1: We still need more help to finish the garden. If you have contributed already, thank you! If you haven't contributed, continue reading below for the scope of the project! Thanks to all past and future contributors.
The
Hidden Treasure of Laos
Most people
have no idea that the jewel-green jungle-clad mountains of the landlocked
country of Laos are home to an astonishing level of natural biodiversity, a
treasure trove of beautiful, useful and mysterious plants.
In fact,
Laos has one of the highest levels of biodiversity in the world, but much
of this rich natural bounty hasn’t been identified, catalogued, or studied
yet.  Many species have yet to be even discovered.
The Danger

Now, with development, people are moving and building towns, planting crops and developing the country. This is wonderful for the people who will have a better life - but also a powerful threat to these plants and the traditions that surround them.
<h4><b>The
Knowledge
The mosaic
of ethnic groups that inhabit this rugged landscape have developed a deep understanding
of the uses - medicinal, culinary and spiritual - of these plants, but the
elders are the only keepers of this knowledge and little is written down.  All could be lost within one generation !
<h4><b>Time for
Action
Now is the time
to make sure that this precious natural heritage is not lost. Preservation and
education are the answers.
The good
news is that an extraordinary project is already under way to find, catalogue,
propagate and study this wealth of plants and to understand their
ethno-botanical history and future uses.
Pha Tad Ke
Botanical Garden, the first ever in Laos, will open to the public soon after
many years of research and hard work, and we need all the help we can get to
make sure it happens.
Soon
visitors will be able to stroll the paths among the medicinal gardens and walk along the spectacular limestone habitat.  The sheer beauty of hundreds and
hundreds of plants will be revealed in a stunning setting on the Mekong River in Luang Prabang,
the World-Heritage-listed former capital.
There will
be beautiful food and handicrafts, but, even more important to the future of
Laos and the planet, are the extensive educational and cultural programs, the
future research facility, the herbarium and many more features to come.
You can help
make sure that the careless development that has
ruined so many places does not happen here in this tiny natural paradise.
People need to understand the need for saving biodiversity by preserving
species, and for stopping climate change through education.
How are we protecting traditional knowledge?
Scientific

Research - Pha Tad Ke is actively collecting and cataloguing plant species in Lao. We study plant identification, domestic and wild propagation, and preserve plant resources for future reference. Hopefully with proper funding we can expand our research projects.

Cataloguing - Working alongside village elders traditional knowledge can be documented. Recording the species and their uses saves the knowledge from disappearing. Classifying new species lets the world know of their existence!

column2: >Education - Spreading the knowledge is one of the fastest ways to protect it!  The knowledge of PTK Botanical is spread through our ethno-botanic garden, children's

>Publications - Making the information available and protecting knowledge through the written word is an education tactic for long term conservation. Pha Tad Ke publishes its findings in children's books, manuals, and teacher manuals.  These books are available for download in Laos or English for free from our website,

column3: >To protect bio-diversity is to protect the knowledge of plants. For the last seven years we have worked on protecting bio-diversity with a mix of scientific research, cataloguing, education, publications, and ex-situ conservation.  As we generate more income we will expand our conservation efforts on a larger scale.

column1: WHAT WE ARE FUNDING
We will be funding the building of our ethno-botanic garden.  Ethno-botany is the scientific term for the study of the relationships that exist between people and plants.
Our Garden will have ten sub-themed gardens:
<ul>
• Medicinal plants for skin problems
• Medicinal plants for digestive health
• Medicinal plants for women's health
• Medicinal plants to treat fractures
• Plants for the spirits and their numerous ceremonies and festivals
• Plants for dying used in traditional cotton and silk weaving
• Fiber plants used for weaving and basketry or to make paper
• Plants used in everyday life by the Hmong ethnic group
• Medicinal plants for elephants
• Poisonous plants
<div>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<ul>
• Plantings and plant conservation
• Educational signage
• Research on unknown plants from the wild
This garden is an essential part of preserving traditional knowledge for two reasons:
<ol>
• It keeps traditional knowledge alive by sharing it with the people that visit the garden.
<li>

We open to the public in November.  This garden will be the center piece to our garden.  Creating a sustainable revenue stream by opening our garden to the public is crucial in funding all of our projects including scientific research, cataloguing, education, and publications to keep traditional knowledge alive.
Globally
<ul>
<li>
The knowledge of medicinal plants is priceless for health (not just in Laos but all over the world) - a
column2: >dvancements in biotech, pharmaceuticals, and human healthcare industries are based off the medicinal properties of plants.

column1: <li>
Lessons on fighting climate change and sustainability can be learned from traditional knowledge
<li>

Minimizes risk for a community instead of maximizing profits - By keeping traditional knowledge alive it keeps rural communities strong.  It creates a strong foundation to withstand development that could threaten a community's culture.
Locally
<ul>
<li>
Traditional knowledge is tried and tested over long periods of time and well adapted to a specific location - what works in one area of the world doesn't always work in another.  Diversity is key!
<li>
Directing Luang Prabang tourism in a sustainable direction - with tourism rapidly increasing it's important to create visitor attractions that nurture local customs and ecosystems.
<li>
If traditional knowledge is lost, the information on how to live off the land is lost.
<li>
Protecting knowledge for future generations.
<li>

Conserving plants that are threatened - by keeping the knowledge alive we are keeping the plant behind the knowledge alive, literally, in our garden. We would also eventually like to extend conservation efforts outside of our garden.
<li>
Benefit the national economy - all of our proceeds go directly back into the company and company projects.  This means all money coming in stays directly in Laos.
OUR PERKS

We would LOVE to send you goody bags through the mail.  Unfortunately the mail system is very expensive from Laos.  We are instead pre-selling excursion tickets at a discounted price.  We really want you to come join us in our journey. If you can't, you will still receive an online picture portfolio and you can support our good cause! Pha Tad Ke is affiliated with the Luang Prabang Fund for Culture and Conservation, an American 501(c)3 non-profit organisation. All Contributions made to Pha Tad Ke through the crowdfunding campaign are through the LPFCC and are tax deductible in the US.
Plants are all around us...
<div>
A boy using a bamboo rod to cross the river in he wooden boat with his hand woven baskets full of vegetables from his family garden.

Monks holding a bouquet full of french marigolds, flower of love, and the bird of paradise flowers. According to the monk's book of discipline, robes are naturally dyed and woven.  Different sect around the world have different colors dependent on the natural dyes available to them.  Here in Laos we have a beautiful orange.
A basket of offerings to the spirits including dragon fruit, sticky rice, banana, tobacco, betel, papaya and string.
Plants are one of the main inspirations behind traditional art.
A beautiful flower in the Fabaceae family.
<div>
IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO LEARN MORE…

Thank You! From the Pha Tad Ke Botanical Garden Staff!

Cataloguing - Working alongside village elders traditional knowledge can be documented. Recording the species and their uses saves the knowledge from disappearing. Classifying new species lets the world know of their existence!

Education - Spreading the knowledge is one of the fastest ways to protect it!  The knowledge of PTK Botanical is spread through our ethno-botanic garden, children's garden, community workshops, and publications.

Publications - Making the information available and protecting knowledge through the written word is an education tactic for long term conservation. Pha Tad Ke publishes its findings in children's books, manuals, and teacher manuals.  These books are available for download in Laos or English for free from our website, pha-tad-ke.com

Conservation - To protect bio-diversity is to protect the knowledge of plants. For the last seven years we have worked on protecting bio-diversity with a mix of scientific research, cataloguing, education, publications, and ex-situ conservation.  As we generate more income we will expand our conservation efforts on a larger scale.
WHAT WE ARE FUNDING
We will be funding the building of our ethno-botanic garden.  Ethno-botany is the scientific term for the study of the relationships that exist between people and plants.
Our Garden will have ten sub-themed gardens:
Medicinal plants for skin problems
Medicinal plants for digestive health
Medicinal plants for women's health
Medicinal plants to treat fractures
Plants for the spirits and their numerous ceremonies and festivals
Plants for dying used in traditional cotton and silk weaving
Fiber plants used for weaving and basketry or to make paper
Plants used in everyday life by the Hmong ethnic group
Medicinal plants for elephants
Poisonous plants
This will include money for:
Plantings and plant conservation
Educational signage
Research on unknown plants from the wild
This garden is an essential part of preserving traditional knowledge for two reasons:
It keeps traditional knowledge alive by sharing it with the people that visit the garden.

We open to the public in November.  This garden will be the center piece to our garden.  Creating a sustainable revenue stream by opening our garden to the public is crucial in funding all of our projects including scientific research, cataloguing, education, and publications to keep traditional knowledge alive.
THIS MATTERS!
Globally

The knowledge of medicinal plants is priceless for health (not just in Laos but all over the world) - advancements in biotech, pharmaceuticals, and human healthcare industries are based off the medicinal properties of plants.
Lessons on fighting climate change and sustainability can be learned from traditional knowledge

Minimizes risk for a community instead of maximizing profits - By keeping traditional knowledge alive it keeps rural communities strong.  It creates a strong foundation to withstand development that could threaten a community's culture.
Locally
Traditional knowledge is tried and tested over long periods of time and well adapted to a specific location - what works in one area of the world doesn't always work in another.  Diversity is key!
Directing Luang Prabang tourism in a sustainable direction - with tourism rapidly increasing it's important to create visitor attractions that nurture local customs and ecosystems.
If traditional knowledge is lost, the information on how to live off the land is lost.
Protecting knowledge for future generations.

Conserving plants that are threatened - by keeping the knowledge alive we are keeping the plant behind the knowledge alive, literally, in our garden. We would also eventually like to extend conservation efforts outside of our garden.
Benefit the national economy - all of our proceeds go directly back into the company and company projects.  This means all money coming in stays directly in Laos.
OUR PERKS

We would LOVE to send you goody bags through the mail.  Unfortunately the mail system is very expensive from Laos.  We are instead pre-selling excursion tickets at a discounted price.  We really want you to come join us in our journey. If you can't, you will still receive an online picture portfolio and you can support our good cause! Pha Tad Ke is affiliated with the Luang Prabang Fund for Culture and Conservation, an American 501(c)3 non-profit organisation. All Contributions made to Pha Tad Ke through the crowdfunding campaign are through the LPFCC and are tax deductible in the US.
Plants are all around us...
A boy using a bamboo rod to cross the river in he wooden boat with his hand woven baskets full of vegetables from his family garden.

Monks holding a bouquet full of french marigolds, flower of love, and the bird of paradise flowers. According to the monk's book of discipline, robes are naturally dyed and woven.  Different sect around the world have different colors dependent on the natural dyes available to them.  Here in Laos we have a beautiful orange.
A basket of offerings to the spirits including dragon fruit, sticky rice, banana, tobacco, betel, papaya and string.
Plants are one of the main inspirations behind traditional art.
A beautiful flower in the Fabaceae family.
IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO LEARN MORE…
Newsletter #16
Newsletter #15
Jakarta Now Magazine April 2016
Asian Review
Garden Wise vol. 39
Our Website
Thank You! From the Pha Tad Ke Botanical Garden Staff!",13.0,0,"3 Campaigns

Hi there! My name is Sam Markwith, I am the head visionary behind Markwith Farms. My passion for this Earth knows no bounds and it was sparked from the moment I realized the concept of love can expand beyond humanity. I fell head over heels for the natural world and the plant kingdom and have since dedicated my life to both of them. After high school, I wanted to expand my knowledge for the things that I loved so I enrolled at Virginia Tech and received my B.S. in Environmental Horticulture.

Markwith Farms will grow a greener future, rooted in sustainability. We will provide food to every walk of life by offering fresh produce in every market possible (CSA, school lunches, restaurants, food banks, markets, etc.). Access to fresh local food for all citizens is the cornerstone of our mission. We will prove it is possible to grow and distribute the majority of a counties produce needs – and then begin helping other green entrepreneurs get their feet of the ground by offering courses and grant-style investments.

As stated before, profit is not the fundamental goal of our farm. We want our patrons to feel as though their purchase is truly meaningful and beneficial to more than just themselves. This is why we have pledged that the majority of all profits will be reinvested into the green world. In the first years, these proceeds will be reinvested into Markwith Farms
column2:
however, once we are completely up and running at an acceptable capacity, the proceeds will be allocated to other sustainable minded individuals who exhibit an extreme passion for our Earth.

Funding milestones

We have several different tiers as far as how much money we can raise along with what we can do this year. We intend to take out a small loan this year to help us boost production slightly passed where you all put us.

Our starting goal is $10,000

column1: • This will be used for field preparation and getting the plants going.
• We will not be tilling our fields, and will instead be suffocating the weeds with a thick layer of compost which will be our main expense until we can make our own on site.
• We will lay drip irrigation throughout our fields in order to use water conservatively and have less worry about foliar diseases.
• We will plant a cover crop of Hairy Vetch to help further suffocate the weeds when it is reaped and left as a surface mulch in the Spring.
• We will purchase all our seeds and plant them in our homemade newspaper pots
• We will build a temporary rudimentary greenhouse to get us through a few seasons

If we make it to $25,000

  • We will be able to fully fund the creation of Markwith Farms walk-through produce stand
column2:
it will really be a sight to see. (All donors names will be painted or put on a plaque inside the stand)

If we make it to $35,000

  • We will be able to start a free-range pastured chicken eggs sector of the farm.

If we make it to $45,000

  • We will start some perennial fruit trees (wont produce for 7+ years however)

If we make $60,000

  • Everything will be able to be done without a loan for this year and we will host a beautiful gala for all of our donors, big and small!

column1:
Perks

Donating to our cause today is your first and most assured way to receive a Community Supported Agriculture (CSA) share for the 2016 growing season. Our shares will be $500 and will include roughly 25 weeks’ worth of produce (±$20 a week). If you want a half-share, send us an email and we can get you set up! If you are out of range to be a member of the CSA program, but still want to support our cause, contact us, and we will work out a comparable reward for your much appreciated donation.

In addition to the CSA shares, you also have the opportunity to receive exclusive and creative Markwith Farms stickers, magnets, T-shirts, and reusable bags. All donors will also receive 10% of their donation back in market credit.

The impact of your donation will ripple infinitely through the future. We can change the world, if we work together.

Risks &
column2:
Challenges

There are inherently a lot of challenges associated with farming, but our passion for our mission and our work ethic and communication skills will help us hurdle anything that stands in our way. We will not stop
column3:
we will give our all to make a difference in the world. If an unforeseen event poses to much of a challenge for the family, we will be able to draw on community support and understanding from the folks who believe in our mission and have faith in our cause. We will approach every challenge with a well thought out plan, with environmental protection and sustainability as the top priority. We will harness the power of Mother Nature to help us when we can.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to support us financially, give us your verbal support! Spread the word of us and our mission and follow our progress on Facebook! We truly and greatly appreciate any and all words of encouragement. We cannot do it without your hearts.

My name is Cinthia Pattigno, I'm a lawyer specializing in environmental law, and I'm tired of seeing big business in Cartagena promote the separation of garbage from the house and then the garbage truck absolutely mix all the material leaving virtually useless plastics and metals.

Cartagena de Indias do not have separation of garbage, everyone discarded their mixed wastes, thus being only 6% of the garbage that is thrown into the trash is recycled, meaning that more than 760 tons of daily garbage is practically as food for carrion birds and soil as a contaminant.

In addition to all, the local government has no intention to implement a policy of recycling, is more interested in profiting follow the great collectors paying them per kilo of garbage dumped at the dump regardless of the change that must occur from home.

So I ask for help, because I want to see a change in my city, because there is a high amount of materials that can be reused and government neglect is not being tapped.
What I need?
•   Rent or buy a small truck that day by day collect waste in specific areas of the city. It will cost  $ 2000 usd  if i buy  a small truck or  500 if i rent it per 3 months.
•  Buy large containers for large waste generators. $500 usd for 80 containers
• Rent a warehouse to store and intervene recyclable goods. 600 usd for 3 months
•  Buy a compactor machine $3000 usd
• Buy sacks of rice to give to the houses and inform them that there must deposit their recyclables. $ 200 usd for 200 sacks.

column2:
/>

My companie will survive after this investment by selling this materials to big companies that will create chairs, tables, and another pet bottles all recyclable. 
 
 
However i will improve my companie to create new products with the recycled Polyethilene, but to do that, first i need to start collecting plastic, i mean, first i need to know the process of collecting and change the mentallity of the persons around me before i transform those materials  into something new.

 

 

THE IMPACT

column1:
WHAT WILL I DO?

I will collect  all plastics and metals directly from the houses, thereby decreasing the tonnage of garbage daily gathered over large companies that have no interest in recycling.
<ol>
• I will increase the percentage of recycled material in the city.
• I will give local recyclers formal jobs.
• I will plant in the new generations the culture of recycling through campaigns winery tour recycling.

In the city I will mark a huge difference as there are no campaigns that encourage recycling from home, it will be the first time a private company of the great leap that this city needs to be environmentally sustainable.
RISKS

What problems will I have?

Big business will see me as their competition, also will want to collect plastic from the houses, to further increase in their garbage collected tons, but will bond of affection to people and families who give me their materials. I gather their early plastics, it will be a real commitment to my city.
<ol>
• If you Donate 10 Usd  your name will be carved in to the entrance of our office so we can honor you and your commitment to helping the planet.
• if you donate 20 usd i will invite you to have some beers when you come to Cartagena- Colombia
.
3. If you Donate 100 usd i will send to your house a t- shirt  with a recycling message and i will invite you a beer ejem you come to Cartagena.
4. if you donate 200 usd i will send a pack of 6  recyclable bags and a t shirt!!

WE NEED BEES!

Honey bees help pollinate 1/3 of the global food supply and directly impact $18 billion in American agriculture. Over the last 9 winters, honey bee winter loss rate has averaged around 30%. This kind of pollinator loss threatens food production in the US. 

 

WHAT HAPPENS IF WE DO NOTHING?

If something isn’t done and done soon, many more bee colonies will die and many beekeepers will go out of business, negatively impacting the ability of the American farmer to produce food crops such as apples, almonds, and a whole range of other vegetable, fruit, and nut crops. 

 

HOW WILL BEE TECH TEAMS HELP?

The best beekeepers keep the best bees. Declining honey bee health does not have a single cause or a single solution, but putting the best tools in the hands of the people on the front lines – the beekeepers – has made a huge impact. 

Our Tech Teams give near real-time data to beekeepers and provide actionable solutions. Information like this helps beekeepers decide if they need to treat hives for diseases or pests. With the help of Tech Teams, beekeepers use the best methods out there to support bee health.

 

 

YOUR SUPPORT HAS AN IMPACT:

Based on our results to date, every dollar invested in Tech Teams saves an estimated $6.25 for beekeepers. With our goal of raising $50,000 through this crowdfunding campaign, our impact can bring real and immediate value to beekeepers across the country and improve hone bee health. We'll let you do the math.

 

WANT TO GIVE AS A GIFT?

The best gifts are meaningful. We've created a variety of perks for different donation levels in this campaign, and are happy to help you give one as a gift. Show someone how much you care -- about them AND about honey bees. Simply choose one of our perks from the list to the right and proceed through the payment as usual. You'll receive an email from us the next day asking if you'd like to give your perk as a gift, and if you do we'll collect the info needed to make that happen.

THANKS TO ALL OF OUR GENEROUS DONORS

Members of The Queens Guard include:

Valent U.S.A. Corporation
