Bears Ears National Monument: Monument under Threat

On December 28, 2016, President Obama, using the Antiquities Act, created Bears Ears National Monument in Southeastern Utah, which is already under threat of disappearing. In an unprecedented move, the legislature of Utah is asking to have the monument overturned (articles here, here, and here). Bears Ears National Monument: Monument under Threat will document the Bears Ears National Monument and what we the American people potentially stand to lose. This is no small undertaking as the monument covers 1.35-million acres, which is broken into a number of distinct areas, and time limited. The map below provides a glimpse into the enormity of this new monument.

Embarking April 2017, I will dedicate the remainder of 2017 to the creation of Bears Ears National Monument: Monument under Threat. Even with the amount of time dedicated to this project, the fieldwork schedule is going to be extremely hectic
column2: large portions of the monument are only accessible by foot. As an accomplished backpacker, hauling 15+ pounds of camera gear into the backcountry is not an issue, but it does make for very long days. While the book’s shot list and shooting schedule are still under development, with new items added every few days, you can see the most up to date shot-list and shooting plans here: Shot List for Bears Ears National Monument Project.

column1: There is a strong sense of urgency in documenting this national monument because on February 3, 2017, the governor of Utah signed a state law calling on President Trump to undo Bears Ears National Monument (see, Governor signs resolution to rescind Bears Ears National Monument). No national monument of this size has ever been undone and there currently is not any law President Trump can use to revoke a national monument, but that doesn’t mean they won’t try. It will take an act of Congress to undo Bears Ears National Monument, but given that one of the stated goals of the GOP platform is getting rid of public lands, it is only a matter of time before it happens
column2: hence the urgency of this project. (See the GOP Platform section America's Natural Resources: Agriculture, Energy, and the Environment, subsection Environmental Progress, paragraph seven)

column1: The Goal
The goals of Bears Ears National Monument: Monument under Threat project is multifold and goes far beyond this crowdfunding campaign:
<ul>
• To employ photography to document the beauty to be found in Bears Ears National Monument
• Creating a photographic collection and making these images publicly accessible online.
• Building an online community through use of digital platforms where interested parties can follow the project and participate.
• Producing a photo-book documenting Bears Ears National Monument, through both photography and the written word.
• Producing a 2018 calendar highlighting the best images from the project
• A gallery showing. Sometime in the first half of 2018, Bears Ears National Monument: Monument under Threat will host a gallery showing, highlighting the best pieces from the project.
Why am I doing this?

Having always been a supporter of our public lands, a nature photographer and writer, and given the current political environment, I feel it is extremely important we stand up for our public lands right now more than ever. This photobook is about more than just preserving what may be the fleeting life of a new national monument
column2: Bears Ears National Monument is simply the latest battleground of the war on our public lands and I want to document what we stand to lose. I want to be able to show those in power, “this is what we stand to lose and this is what we are protecting.”

column1: I am also doing this because I love photography, writing, nature, and documenting the beauty of the world around us. More importantly, I enjoy sharing the beauty I find in the world with others, through both my photography and my writing. What better way to do all the things I love than to put together a project that calls on all these things! Hence, that is how the idea for Bears Ears National Monument: Monument under Threat was born.
What you will help create

Blog: A minimum of twice a week I will post on the website on the project. Blog post topics will touch on a variety of subjects: adventures in backpacking, camping, off-roading, adventures, or creative collaborations.
Social Media: I want to create enriching content on all forms of social media so fans can keep in touch with me throughout the entire project. Find and follow me on: Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter.

Photo Book: the ultimate goal of this project is publishing an 80-page, 10 x 8 inches (25x20 cm) full-color softcover photography book with a mixture of full-page and smaller collections of the landscapes found in Bears Ears National Monument. The estimated delivery date for the book is the first to second week of December 2017, making it a great holiday gift idea!
Calendar: a full-color calendar for 2018 highlighting the 13 best images from the project and it will be available the first to second week of December 2017.
Budget

Undertaking a project of this depth and magnitude and dedicating 2017 to this project requires serious investment. Putting in my time, energy, expertise, and personal financial resources, I have committed myself to this project's success. I am, however, in need of some assistance. To achieve the project's outcomes, Bears Ears National Monument: Monument under Threat project needs to raise $6,000 to fund this project. The funds will be dedicated to the following categories:

The biggest portion of the budget is going towards travel at 77%, which should not be surprising given the 1.35 million acres the monument covers (for comparison, the state of Delaware is 1.25 million acres). As they say, nothing is free and 8% of monies raised will go to crowdfunding and associated fees (5% to Indiegogo and 3% to credit card processing fees). The remaining 15% will be used for the production of the goodies you picked when backing this project.
Project Risks

All projects entail a certain amount of risk, but the key is identifying those risks and having contingency plans for those risks. Bears Ears National Monument: Monument under Threat has a number of risks associated with it, as any major project does.
Mechanical problems could interrupt the project

Any project that is dependent upon a vehicle of any kind could potentially have to deal with a mechanical breakdown, fire, theft, or simply getting stuck. Many areas of Bears Ears National Monument only have dirt roads, limited services, and some require a high-clearance vehicle, so getting stuck can be a real issue.
To help mitigate these potential risks, the project has roadside assistance and other necessities are carried to help get out of most of the situations which may arise.
Equipment issues could interrupt the expedition

Any number pieces of equipment could fail or be stolen, either of which would cause an interruption to the project. To help mitigate these possible problems, the projects cameras and computer equipment are insured for both breakage and theft.
A plethora of things could happen

There are tons of little things that could happen which could have an impact on the project. Heck, I could lock the keys in the van in the middle of nowhere, with no cell phone service, and the closest service being 60-miles away. Yes, I like hiking and do it frequently, but a 60-mile hike to get someone to unlock the van is not something I would want to do.
The key is to not let the little problems mushroom into bigger ones, keeping a clear head, and meeting each challenge as they come. It helps to look at these things as just part of the journey
column2: it is our reaction to adversity that matters most.

column1: Failing to reach the funding goal
Not reaching my funding goal is a real possibility, however not reaching the funding goal does not mean the end of the project
column2: it simply means scaling it back. This could mean shortening the length of time in the field, skipping some of the lesser-known locations, and other areas that can be trimmed.

#BearsEars #StandWithBearsEars #PublicLands #KeepItPublic #PublicLandsPublicHands
","Bears Ears National Monument: Monument under Threat

On December 28, 2016, President Obama, using the Antiquities Act, created Bears Ears National Monument in Southeastern Utah, which is already under threat of disappearing. In an unprecedented move, the legislature of Utah is asking to have the monument overturned (articles here, here, and here). Bears Ears National Monument: Monument under Threat will document the Bears Ears National Monument and what we the American people potentially stand to lose. This is no small undertaking as the monument covers 1.35-million acres, which is broken into a number of distinct areas, and time limited. The map below provides a glimpse into the enormity of this new monument.

Embarking April 2017, I will dedicate the remainder of 2017 to the creation of Bears Ears National Monument: Monument under Threat. Even with the amount of time dedicated to this project, the fieldwork schedule is going to be extremely hectic
column2: large portions of the monument are only accessible by foot. As an accomplished backpacker, hauling 15+ pounds of camera gear into the backcountry is not an issue, but it does make for very long days. While the book’s shot list and shooting schedule are still under development, with new items added every few days, you can see the most up to date shot-list and shooting plans here: Shot List for Bears Ears National Monument Project.

column1: There is a strong sense of urgency in documenting this national monument because on February 3, 2017, the governor of Utah signed a state law calling on President Trump to undo Bears Ears National Monument (see, Governor signs resolution to rescind Bears Ears National Monument). No national monument of this size has ever been undone and there currently is not any law President Trump can use to revoke a national monument, but that doesn’t mean they won’t try. It will take an act of Congress to undo Bears Ears National Monument, but given that one of the stated goals of the GOP platform is getting rid of public lands, it is only a matter of time before it happens
column2: hence the urgency of this project. (See the GOP Platform section America's Natural Resources: Agriculture, Energy, and the Environment, subsection Environmental Progress, paragraph seven)

column1: The Goal
The goals of Bears Ears National Monument: Monument under Threat project is multifold and goes far beyond this crowdfunding campaign:
To employ photography to document the beauty to be found in Bears Ears National Monument
Creating a photographic collection and making these images publicly accessible online.
Building an online community through use of digital platforms where interested parties can follow the project and participate.
Producing a photo-book documenting Bears Ears National Monument, through both photography and the written word.
Producing a 2018 calendar highlighting the best images from the project
A gallery showing. Sometime in the first half of 2018, Bears Ears National Monument: Monument under Threat will host a gallery showing, highlighting the best pieces from the project.
Why am I doing this?

Having always been a supporter of our public lands, a nature photographer and writer, and given the current political environment, I feel it is extremely important we stand up for our public lands right now more than ever. This photobook is about more than just preserving what may be the fleeting life of a new national monument
column2: Bears Ears National Monument is simply the latest battleground of the war on our public lands and I want to document what we stand to lose. I want to be able to show those in power, “this is what we stand to lose and this is what we are protecting.”

column1: I am also doing this because I love photography, writing, nature, and documenting the beauty of the world around us. More importantly, I enjoy sharing the beauty I find in the world with others, through both my photography and my writing. What better way to do all the things I love than to put together a project that calls on all these things! Hence, that is how the idea for Bears Ears National Monument: Monument under Threat was born.
What you will help create

Blog: A minimum of twice a week I will post on the website on the project. Blog post topics will touch on a variety of subjects: adventures in backpacking, camping, off-roading, adventures, or creative collaborations.
Social Media: I want to create enriching content on all forms of social media so fans can keep in touch with me throughout the entire project. Find and follow me on: Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter.

Photo Book: the ultimate goal of this project is publishing an 80-page, 10 x 8 inches (25x20 cm) full-color softcover photography book with a mixture of full-page and smaller collections of the landscapes found in Bears Ears National Monument. The estimated delivery date for the book is the first to second week of December 2017, making it a great holiday gift idea!
Calendar: a full-color calendar for 2018 highlighting the 13 best images from the project and it will be available the first to second week of December 2017.
Budget

Undertaking a project of this depth and magnitude and dedicating 2017 to this project requires serious investment. Putting in my time, energy, expertise, and personal financial resources, I have committed myself to this project's success. I am, however, in need of some assistance. To achieve the project's outcomes, Bears Ears National Monument: Monument under Threat project needs to raise $6,000 to fund this project. The funds will be dedicated to the following categories:

The biggest portion of the budget is going towards travel at 77%, which should not be surprising given the 1.35 million acres the monument covers (for comparison, the state of Delaware is 1.25 million acres). As they say, nothing is free and 8% of monies raised will go to crowdfunding and associated fees (5% to Indiegogo and 3% to credit card processing fees). The remaining 15% will be used for the production of the goodies you picked when backing this project.
Project Risks

All projects entail a certain amount of risk, but the key is identifying those risks and having contingency plans for those risks. Bears Ears National Monument: Monument under Threat has a number of risks associated with it, as any major project does.
Mechanical problems could interrupt the project

Any project that is dependent upon a vehicle of any kind could potentially have to deal with a mechanical breakdown, fire, theft, or simply getting stuck. Many areas of Bears Ears National Monument only have dirt roads, limited services, and some require a high-clearance vehicle, so getting stuck can be a real issue.
To help mitigate these potential risks, the project has roadside assistance and other necessities are carried to help get out of most of the situations which may arise.
Equipment issues could interrupt the expedition

Any number pieces of equipment could fail or be stolen, either of which would cause an interruption to the project. To help mitigate these possible problems, the projects cameras and computer equipment are insured for both breakage and theft.
A plethora of things could happen

There are tons of little things that could happen which could have an impact on the project. Heck, I could lock the keys in the van in the middle of nowhere, with no cell phone service, and the closest service being 60-miles away. Yes, I like hiking and do it frequently, but a 60-mile hike to get someone to unlock the van is not something I would want to do.
The key is to not let the little problems mushroom into bigger ones, keeping a clear head, and meeting each challenge as they come. It helps to look at these things as just part of the journey
column2: it is our reaction to adversity that matters most.

The urban nature map of Amsterdam – a beautiful tool to help adults and children explore nature in the city.

To help us fund the first urban nature map of Amsterdam we are selling advance copies and some unique screen prints made specially to support this campaign. Have a look below.

It will be a big and beautiful cartographic paper map, paying tribute to the city we love. It is also the start of a dialogue about the importance of nature in the urban environment. Visualising the green - and the blue - you can use the map to explore the many ways in which the urban green can be used: imagine an outdoor classroom, a working space or an allotment. 

The Green Map of Amsterdam will be something that any person who cares about urban nature would like to have: a map every school in Amsterdam can use to make kids more interested in the urban green, a map which can inspire companies and every person working and living here to lead a healthier lifestyle, a map any visitor or expat can use to literally draw his or her own journey into the urban green. 

Just like the map of London, the map of Amsterdam will be a large-format, folded paper map – printed by the best cartographic press in Europe. The green map of Amsterdam will be a beautiful, unique and custom drawn map to highlight places to explore: i.e. parks, green roofs, the canals, places to work, relax and sport outdoors, city farms for children and much more. The reverse side of the map will be used to provide more information and key facts about the city. In order to do this we will reach out to the other initiatives which are involved in making Amsterdam a healthier and greener city. We will also ask the citizens of Amsterdam for their input – what would YOU like to see on the map?

#groenekaartvanAmsterdam

You can buy a copy of the green map in advance, or even buy an extra copy for a friend! We will post them to you in the autumn of 2018. If you really want something special, you can buy one of our limited editions screen-prints. You will receive a unique product for your home or office, and we will credit your name on the green map as a super generous crowdfunder. It will support the non-profit campaign to give away many more green maps in Amsterdam.

If you are a business and would like to discuss a more substantial contribution, please get in touch. We can make you a unique screen-print in a bespoke colour of your choice with your logo and/ or name printed on it!

FREE POSTAGE to Netherlands and UK. Individual charges for EU and Rest of World, applied at checkout.

Basic 

€15 - One copy of the green map of Amsterdam

Help us meet all the production and print costs in advance and have the map posted to you for free. 

Double 

€25 - Two copies of the Green Map of Amsterdam.

Why not also buy an extra copy for a friend or colleague? When you see the final map you will want to to share it with a friend, or possibly want to attach the reverse side on a wall alongside the frontside of the map. You will be the owner of a unique map which you can use to explore all the amazing green and blue spaces and undertake activities in the urban green.

Traveler 

€25 - One copy of the Green Map of Amsterdam + one copy of the London National Park City map.

Collect all the Urban Good green city maps with the first two editions. In the future possibly every major European city will get one. The green map of London was published in 2017 to wide acclaim. Be inspired with a different view of London next time you visit: a unique map packed with green and blue that will tempt you to start explore the outdoors.

Blue 

€95 - One copy of a Blue screen print map + 2 copies of the Green Map of Amsterdam, incl. postage 

A hand printed map of the city with deep blue pigment visualising all the waterways. The map shows open spaces and cycle routes, and the water is screen printed by hand. This map is designed especially for this crowdfunding campaign. Buying this print supports the production of more copies of the Green Map of Amsterdam. Nature Desks also wants to be able to hand out free copies at schools in order to raise awareness. Printed on Cyclus Offset 250gsm, beautiful off-white 100% natural recycled paper, 500mm x 700mm (B1). And we will send you 2 copies of the giant, folded green map when it is ready. 

Copper 

€260 - One copy of the copper screen print map + 5 copies of the Green Map of Amsterdam

Buying a print of this limited edition supports the production of the Green Map of Amsterdam. Hand printed with a metallic copper ink, a special printing technique you cannot create with digital printing. This is a numbered, limited run of 75 prints, designed by Urban Good and printed by the amazing Daniel Heath Studio. Printed on Cyclus Offset 250gsm, beautiful off-white 100% natural recycled paper, 500mm x 700mm (B1). Your name will be listed as crowdfunder on the back of the giant, folded Green Map of Amsterdam of which you will receive 5 copies. 

Gold 

€500 - One copy of the Gold Leaf map + 9 copies of the Green Map of Amsterdam

The ultimate generous reward to support the production of the Green Map of Amsterdam. A beautiful, hand crafted, gold-foiled map of your city that will shine on any wall and will remind you of the generous contribution you made to the campaign to map the open blue and green spaces, and help people explore the city. This is a limited run of 14 prints, designed by Urban Good specially for this campaign. They will be numbered and signed. Printed on Cyclus Offset 250gsm beautiful off-white 100% natural recycled paper, 500mm x 700mm (B1). Your name (or business name) will be listed as a top-level crowdfunder on the back of the map. And we will send you 9 copies of the giant, folded Map of Amsterdam as soon as it is ready. Get your copy before this reward runs out!

Making your screen prints:

Introduction
My name is Tshepo Mampholo and I'm a chemical engineer by profession. I currently reside in City of Tshwane in South Africa.

My startup company, Kgopolo Solutions (Pty) Ltd is a process engineering company based in Tshwane providing process design, modelling and data analytics to a number of chemical processing sectors such as the mining sector, water sector and petroleum industries. I strongly believe in offering services that not only add engineering value but are also economically feasible and sustainable for the environment.
Problem Statement

A significant amount of water is wasted when waiting for the shower to reach the right temperature. When opening the hot water tap, cold water is initially discharged from the conduit until hot water from the geyser reaches the tap. The cool water runs down the drain and is wasted. Small-scale studies performed by my company indicate that households waste between 4-6 litres of clean water per shower.

Ten experiments were conducted, at different households, by fully opening the hot water tap and collecting the water discharged from the shower head. The volume of the water collected was then measured to complete the experiment. Depending on how many individuals in the household shower per day, the amount of clean water that can be saved is significant.

There are approximately 4.7 million households in South Africa with geysers. If the average household size of 3.3 individuals per household is assumed, it is estimate that approximately 23 billion litres of clean water can be saved per year.
Proposed Solution

The proposed solution is a patented, easy to install, efficient shower system which consists of a mounted reservoir, shower hose and head, and a switch mechanism. The workings of the product are summarised below:
<ul>
• When the tap is turned on, cold water is diverted into a mounted 5 liters reservoir.
• A small amount of water is then allowed to trickle through the showerhead, which the shower user will use to monitor the temperature of the water.
• When the water trickling water from the showerhead is at the right temperature, the user pushes a switch to commence with the showering.
• The user showers with the water from the reservoir as it is drawn by a venturi effect out through the shower head.
Funding Requirement

I am looking to raise $80 000 to be able to successfully execute my project and help South Africa recover from this water shortage crisis. Not only will this project conserve water, It will also increase employment in the country as the unemployment rate is quite high.

There will be 2 phases to the project. The first is the piloting and business development phase which will last for 7 months, ending May 2017. The second phase will involve ramping up the production volumes and optimising the assembly line.
<h3><strong>Risks &amp
<ul>
• Copying of invention by competitors: IP, the distribution and manufacturing rights of the product are owned by Kgopolo Solutions for the whole of Africa.

• Delay to project timeline: Raising of funding to have the largest impact on the project timeline. A number of institutions will be approached to increase the likelihood that the funds will be raised on time. Good communication between all stakeholders on project deliverables will be maintained

The Barefoot Project
Bare- Not covered, lacking clothing, to be open and to be exposed.
Foot – Part of the leg that we stand on and move. What we use to take the journey.
·When was the last time you took 5 minutes for yourself to be quiet, be still and reconnect with your inner voice?
·When was the last time you took off your shoes and felt the grass between your toes and the earth beneath your feet?

·When was the last time you ate a meal with other people that did not involve some kind of electronics?  No smart phones, no TV, no music.  A meal where you actually had meaningful conversations with your family and friends?
·When was the last time you stopped to consider how your life, your choices, your actions impact the world around?  Not just for now, but for generations to come.
It was about 8 years ago that I stopped to consider the amount of TV I was watching, the lifestyle I was living  and the various type of noise that was around me.
How much of an impact it had on my relationships, my environment and me?  I began to feel a lot of it was not real and manipulated or it was unhealthy for my mind, body and spirit.
Only by connecting to my inner being and others around me that I have been able to change and grow.
To be aware and open on the Journey of life is very important. That’s how we accumulate knowledge, learn new things and discover new things that we would normally not find
column2: if it were closed or ignored.  We live in a vibrant and dynamic world, full of life and color. Full of wonder and things to explore. lots of people to meet and opportunities to grow.

column1: Today, with our busy environment and the vast amounts of distraction around us such as toys, electronics and other type noise in our environment. It can be difficult to connect to ourselves. It can be difficult to connect to others, to connect with them, to get to know them and cultivate relationships that we all need.
It is so important to be aware of who we are, to connect to ourselves and learn to grow and change. Important to connect to a community and be part of a family
column2: to share our experiences, our knowledge and belong to something. And it’s important that we  connect to our environment. We are as much a part of the environment as it is a part of us, it works interdependently, it is sacred and lots of gifts to offer.

column1: These documentaries helped me to see my interactions and connections in a different light.  They showed me opportunities to nurture myself, my relationships and the planet.
I want to share these with you and others to encourage thoughtful discussions on how we can be the catalyst for change in our lives, our communities and our world.
Please help me bring these three documentaries to your community, support The Barefoot Project.
Connected -An Autoblogogaphry about love, death &
column2: technology.  - Tiffany Shlain  talks about how we connect in the 21st century and the impact it has on our relationships and our brains.
column9: > - Meet  activists who are campaigning against the biggest ecological challenge we face today. And an inventor who believes
column10: > he holds the key at saving our planet from global warming.

column2: to share our experiences, our knowledge and belong to something. And it’s important that we  connect to our environment. We are as much a part of the environment as it is a part of us, it works interdependently, it is sacred and lots of gifts to offer.

column1: These documentaries helped me to see my interactions and connections in a different light.  They showed me opportunities to nurture myself, my relationships and the planet.
I want to share these with you and others to encourage thoughtful discussions on how we can be the catalyst for change in our lives, our communities and our world.
Please help me bring these three documentaries to your community, support The Barefoot Project.

Connected -An Autoblogogaphry about love, death & technology.  - Tiffany Shlain  talks about how we connect in the 21st century and the impact it has on our relationships and our brains. Elemental, The Film - Meet  activists who are campaigning against the biggest ecological challenge we face today. And an inventor who believes he holds the key at saving our planet from global warming. http://www.elementalthefilm.com/the-film/The Cove - Every year, in a small town of Taiji, Japan. One of the most beautiful and intelligent mammals is hunted down or sold for profit. Follow Ric O'Barry and his team, going undercover to uncover the truth about this massive hunt. https://dolphinproject.net The money raised will help in the following ways:
- Individual licenses for each documentary. ( three separate evenings)- Venue ( Able to hold 60 people on average or more)- Brochures and Pamphlets- Marketing the event
Non financial needs - a few volunteers.
Thank you",0.0,3,"1 Campaign
|","Moncton, Canada",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-barefoot-project-doc-series/pica

Breve reseña
apoyo para conmemorar el Día Mundial de los Océanos 2016, Tejiendo Mares de Solidaridad.
La Fundación Biodiversidad del Ministerio de Agricultura, Alimentación y Medio
Ambiente, nos ha otorgado una ayuda que recibiremos si logramos ejecutar con
éxito la totalidad del proyecto.
los centros y residencias de mayores y personas con enfermedad mental donde
actuamos queremos tejer dos grandes mantas azules que representarán dos océanos
gigantes con sus amenazas y sus beneficios. Cubriremos dos edificios
emblemáticos de las ciudades de Madrid y Valencia. Asimismo, jóvenes de centros
educativos investigarán sobre las amenazas y beneficios que nos reportan los
océanos para representarlos en las mantas tejidas, además aprenderán a tejer y
a confeccionar las mantas uniendo cuadrados. Una vez pase el evento, el <b>8 de
junio, el gran océano tejido se desmantelará y se convertirá en mantas para
familias sin recursos.
Asociación sin ánimo de lucro que se dedica a tejer mantas en residencias y
centros de mayores y/o de personas con enfermedad mental destinadas a familias
sin recursos y centros de refugiados. Nuestro objetivo es que las personas mayores
y personas con enfermedad mental participen en proyectos de la comunidad y dar
abrigo a personas necesitadas. Nuestra causa va a ser la protección de los

océanos.

El impacto
donde se implica la actividad de personas mayores y de personas con enfermedad
mental en acciones de la Comunidad, se produce además un intercambio
generacional.
Es un proyecto ambiental, donde todos estos colectivos (mayores,
personas con enfermedad mental y jóvenes) se unen para sensibilizar sobre la
protección de los océanos.
Es un proyecto solidario, donde se espera dar abrigo
a más de 2.000 familias sin recursos.
<ul>
• Se trata de apoyar la protección de los océanos.
• Se trata de aportar nuestro ""punto"" de solidaridad
• Se trata de ser creativo e intentar hacer cosas positivas para proteger
• Se trata de tomar conciencia de los problemas que hay a nuestro alrededor
por un océano saludable para un planeta saludable. Unimos los esfuerzos de
personas mayores, personas con enfermedad mental, jóvenes, distintos organismos
e instituciones para concienciar sobre la protección de los océanos, de una
manera creativa y solidaria.

del proyecto

","Breve reseña
Pedimos
apoyo para conmemorar el Día Mundial de los Océanos 2016, Tejiendo Mares de Solidaridad.
La Fundación Biodiversidad del Ministerio de Agricultura, Alimentación y Medio
Ambiente, nos ha otorgado una ayuda que recibiremos si logramos ejecutar con
éxito la totalidad del proyecto.
Desde
los centros y residencias de mayores y personas con enfermedad mental donde
actuamos queremos tejer dos grandes mantas azules que representarán dos océanos
gigantes con sus amenazas y sus beneficios. Cubriremos dos edificios
emblemáticos de las ciudades de Madrid y Valencia. Asimismo, jóvenes de centros
educativos investigarán sobre las amenazas y beneficios que nos reportan los
océanos para representarlos en las mantas tejidas, además aprenderán a tejer y
a confeccionar las mantas uniendo cuadrados. Una vez pase el evento, el 8 de
junio, el gran océano tejido se desmantelará y se convertirá en mantas para
familias sin recursos.
¿Quiénes somos?
Somos una
Asociación sin ánimo de lucro que se dedica a tejer mantas en residencias y
centros de mayores y/o de personas con enfermedad mental destinadas a familias
sin recursos y centros de refugiados. Nuestro objetivo es que las personas mayores
y personas con enfermedad mental participen en proyectos de la comunidad y dar
abrigo a personas necesitadas. Nuestra causa va a ser la protección de los
océanos.  El impacto
Se trata de un proyecto social,
donde se implica la actividad de personas mayores y de personas con enfermedad
mental en acciones de la Comunidad, se produce además un intercambio
generacional.
Es un proyecto ambiental, donde todos estos colectivos (mayores,
personas con enfermedad mental y jóvenes) se unen para sensibilizar sobre la
protección de los océanos.
Es un proyecto solidario, donde se espera dar abrigo
a más de 2.000 familias sin recursos.
Se trata de apoyar la protección de los océanos.
Se trata de aportar nuestro ""punto"" de solidaridad
Se trata de ser creativo e intentar hacer cosas positivas para proteger
Se trata de tomar conciencia de los problemas que hay a nuestro alrededor
Riesgos y desafíos
Tejemos
por un océano saludable para un planeta saludable. Unimos los esfuerzos de
personas mayores, personas con enfermedad mental, jóvenes, distintos organismos
e instituciones para concienciar sobre la protección de los océanos, de una
manera creativa y solidaria.
Objetivos
del proyecto
Involucrar a personas mayores y personas con enfermedad mental
Ejecutar talleres inter-generacionales  para proteger los océanos
Involucrar a centros educativos en programas de sensibilización ambiental
Tejer para conmemorar el Día Mundial de los Océanos
Mejorar las
condiciones de abrigo de familias necesitadas.
¿A
dónde van dirigidos los fondos?
Estamos recaudando fondos para financiar una campaña de
Sensibilización ambiental en Conmemoración del Día Mundial de los océanos. Los
fondos recaudados se repartirán de la siguiente manera:
Material
para realizar talleres inter-generacionales (lanas, agujas...). 2.000 €
Material
promocional (pegatinas, chapas, trípticos, camisetas…). 2.000 €
Etiquetas
identificativas para poner en cada manta. 500 €
Montaje y
desmontaje de la intervención en Madrid y Valencia. 3.000 €
Gastos de
envío de mantas terminadas a nivel nacional. 2.000 €
Gastos de
envío de mantas terminadas a nivel internacional. 4.000 €
Grabación
de un vídeo que recoja todo el proceso. 3.000 €
¿Qué necesitamos y qué obtienes?
Necesitamos recaudar 16.500 euros para cubrir gastos
relacionados con la campaña de sensibilización ambiental y la entrega de mantas
a familias necesitadas. Desearíamos llegar al mayor número de personas posible
y para ello debemos afrontar una serie de gastos relacionados con el proyecto.
Buscamos generar interés público y apoyo. Cualquiera
puede además unirse a nosotros si tiene interés en tejer o aprender a hacerlo,
puede enviarnos cuadrados azules de tamaño 20x20 cm, o simplemente donándonos
un ovillo azul.
Obtienes la satisfacción formar parte de un proyecto colectivo,
demostrando que entre todos sí podemos cambiar el mundo. Trabajando juntos… Usando
nuestras manos para crear un mundo mejor…
¡Porque tejer sí es un super-poder!
Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar
Somos
conscientes de que no todo el mundo puede realizar una contribución económica,
pero si crees en nuestra iniciativa y te gustaría ayudarnos también puedes
hacerlo:
Dona un ovillo azul, o difunde la campaña “Dona
tu ovillo AZUL”
Dándonos a conocer a través de redes sociales
(Facebook, twitter, linkedin…)
Contándole nuestra iniciativa a amigos,
conocidos… Y que también la difundan o se hagan “Amigos de IAIA”.
Siendo voluntario de la Asociación, contacta con
nosotros a través de la página web www.Laiaia.org (info@Laiaia.org)

Hi: I'm Dr. Richard Bailey, interim director of the Climate Museum Institute. I have a doctorate in Forest Resources, and 25 years of working in government, consulting and private industry. Twenty years ago I founded the nonprofit Lake Merritt Institute, but today our problems are much larger.  We CAN slow climate disruption.  We CAN change our energy sources. We CAN create a better earth.  But to  do so, climate education will be essential.

A new nonprofit corporation, the Climate Museum Institute,
 http://theclimatemuseum.org/index.html is being established.  An attorney is preparing our 501(C)(3) nonprofit application, and initial boards of directors and advisers, including eminent scientist Dr. Michael Mann, have been established.  http://theclimatemuseum.org/directors.html

Why a climate museum?  Museums are free to choose and act creatively.

“Museums,
unencumbered with the public policy responsibilities of government and the
compulsive bottom lines of corporations, are agenda free” (Robert
Janes).  Museum
experiences can be designed to not only educate, but also to inspire and
motivate. Through
the use of stories told by people we believe in, we can create messages that
are interesting, startling, and which generate emotion and productive response.
Is current education on this topic in our schools adequate?  Recent research at Stanford University shows that some California science textbooks by major
publishers portray climate change as a debate over different opinions rather
than as scientific fact.
column3:
/>

The false climate denial campaign is real, and has been effective. It is

column1: time to provide education that is based on reality, and a climate

museum /educational center can do so.

The Solution?  A permanent climate education center that will include video stories, avatars, interactive exhibits, live Earth cameras, monthly events, conferences, field trips, member newsletters, public relations activities, story pulpits

and more. Such an institution can also create tourism, and promote local economic development, as has happened with the Klimahaus museum in Germany.  Our center will be located in the nine county San Francisco Bay Area, and will serve K-12 students as well as adults. 

Will our children's future be dominated by climate change? 


Or will we create educated citizens who are climate engineers, climate voters, climate medical specialists, and politicians, soldiers, voters and farmers who are able to propel our world into a better future?
Overall Philosophy: Museum exhibits would be permanent, and include a
big picture, planet wide approach to climate issues.  A strong emphasis
would be placed on topics that affect all of civilization, such as
agriculture, disruption of water supplies, disease, sea level rise, and
climate refugees.  The museums would not house collections or conduct
research, focusing instead on education.

How much money is needed now? We are asking for $10,000 to establish our legal, nonprofit status, research existing exhibits and school programs, and promote the concept among local educators, community leaders and philanthropists.  If our goal is not reached, we will continue to promote the concept and seek additional funds.

I have directed a nonprofit and managed its finances for twenty years without going over budget while forging a positive relationship between government and other stakeholders. The dedication and principles that enabled this success will be continued and utilized for the Climate Museum Institute. 

You can help.  Donate today and use the indiegogo share tools, and join us in creating the intersection of climate science and action.  Generations of future world citizens will thank you.

Sincerely,
Dr. Richard Bailey

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks &
column3:
Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
<ul>
• What we need

<li>We want this project to change lives, not just record one album and then move on...….it’s activist in its ambition, offering portals for new ways of seeing, being, and creating that doesn't cost the earth. The first half of the funding is for the building of the studio and the recording of the Kuki and the Bard album.
column2: ... the second half is for a bursary to enable other young musicians that couldn't otherwise afford it to come and record using the power of nature....

column1: • We’ll be using… For the build. straw bales, earthbags, pallets, trees from our woodland, recycled windows and doors, hempcrete, gravel for foundations, roofing beams, telegraph poles, sheeps wool insulation, For the sound, monitors, headphones, mixing desk, interface with converters and pre-amps, microphones, headphone splitters, cables, audio computer and software, solar panels, wind turbine, sine wave inverter, batteries and of course a fusebox to keep it safe !!!....With food and accomodation for volunteers the whole build has been budgeted at £20,000
•

• We will be making this studio available for use by youth organisations and individuals working with young people from different backgrounds and of different needs. For this we need to raise a bursary for young musicians to come and use the recording studio, including transport, accomodation and food . This we’ve budgeted at a further £20,000
• There's also of course the cost of the perks for this campaign and the indiegogo commission.
•
• Perks !!

• All of our perks are either hand crafted by ourselves or experiences we can offer here on the land. If you would like any of the perks as gifts for Christmas, please make sure to make your purchase by December 12th. If your gift perk is an experience we will send you a Christmas gift token explaining the gift perk in full.
• Below are some images of our wonderful perks, full descriptions are in the right hand column..
• Enjoy !
<ol><li>
<ol><li><h2 style=""text-align: center
<div>
<ul>

• This is an educational project as well as a musical one. Young people will be involved throughout the build and then involved in the recording when the build is complete. Listed below is the core team.
• Simeon Warburton

• Has co-created 40 episodes of hip hop animation for BBC1, ran a recording studio in London for over 10 years, wrote a film score with Oscar nominated composer Michael Nyman, and now lives off grid with his family at Landmatters Permaculture Community.
• Simeon also writes books and teaches about trees. He shares his love of the arboreal realm by making Touchwoods, beautiful wooden tree talismans that are available as one of our perks.
• Paul Bradbury

• Music producer and performer with over 20 years experience of playing and recording, His band Pink'n'Ruby created 2 hugely influential albums for Internationally renowned french arthouse record label ""Prikosnovenie"" . Paul is also an salad grower par excellence and a qualified Permaculture teacher,
• Owen Shiers

• Engineer for Peter Gabriels' Globally renowned Real World Studios..will be advising on equipment and acoustics..As a composer, songwriter, performer, and specialist in world music, he has many years of wisdom to share from his tours of the world stages.
• Alexander Hodgson
• Has been building natural structures for over 20 years and has a wealth of knowledge ranging from straw bale building to off grid energy that is beyond compare.
• Miranda Warburton.
• Artist, photographer, film maker and sharer of journeys with horses, will be documenting the project and sharing images and films as we go.
• Kuki and the Bard

• A brother and sister, worldschooled, off grid living, singer songwriting duo.. have recorded in some of the biggest and most influential studios in London and India and have played at Glastonbury, Boomtown, Smallworld, Buddhafield and Beautiful Days festivals, They have recorded a vinyl single for the RAK records classic singles collection and are currently writing songs for next years festival season.
Other Ways You Can Help

We believe this is a way we can make a contribution in helping young people transition towards a brighter, gentler future - but we can't do it alone…to make this dream a reality, we need to create a community of backers to help. And really, every single penny counts..! Your consideration and contribution could change a young persons life forever...giving them a fresh perspective on what happiness is or what success is all about..and enable them to see how creativity doesn’t have to cost the earth… If you can't contribute financially at this time, it would also be wonderful if you could please, please, please share this campaign and tell your friends....maybe together we can work a miracle....peace out, love and light from all involved here at the Off Grid Recording Studio Project.
Here's a Pony '0m' short film by Miranda Warburton.....music by Simeon Warburton....enjoy :)

column2: ... the second half is for a bursary to enable other young musicians that couldn't otherwise afford it to come and record using the power of nature....

column1: We’ll be using… For the build. straw bales, earthbags, pallets, trees from our woodland, recycled windows and doors, hempcrete, gravel for foundations, roofing beams, telegraph poles, sheeps wool insulation, For the sound, monitors, headphones, mixing desk, interface with converters and pre-amps, microphones, headphone splitters, cables, audio computer and software, solar panels, wind turbine, sine wave inverter, batteries and of course a fusebox to keep it safe !!!....With food and accomodation for volunteers the whole build has been budgeted at £20,000

We will be making this studio available for use by youth organisations and individuals working with young people from different backgrounds and of different needs. For this we need to raise a bursary for young musicians to come and use the recording studio, including transport, accomodation and food . This we’ve budgeted at a further £20,000
There's also of course the cost of the perks for this campaign and the indiegogo commission.
Perks !!

All of our perks are either hand crafted by ourselves or experiences we can offer here on the land. If you would like any of the perks as gifts for Christmas, please make sure to make your purchase by December 12th. If your gift perk is an experience we will send you a Christmas gift token explaining the gift perk in full.
Below are some images of our wonderful perks, full descriptions are in the right hand column..
Enjoy !

This is an educational project as well as a musical one. Young people will be involved throughout the build and then involved in the recording when the build is complete. Listed below is the core team.
Simeon Warburton

Has co-created 40 episodes of hip hop animation for BBC1, ran a recording studio in London for over 10 years, wrote a film score with Oscar nominated composer Michael Nyman, and now lives off grid with his family at Landmatters Permaculture Community.
Simeon also writes books and teaches about trees. He shares his love of the arboreal realm by making Touchwoods, beautiful wooden tree talismans that are available as one of our perks.
Paul Bradbury

Music producer and performer with over 20 years experience of playing and recording, His band Pink'n'Ruby created 2 hugely influential albums for Internationally renowned french arthouse record label ""Prikosnovenie"" . Paul is also an salad grower par excellence and a qualified Permaculture teacher,
Owen Shiers

Engineer for Peter Gabriels' Globally renowned Real World Studios..will be advising on equipment and acoustics..As a composer, songwriter, performer, and specialist in world music, he has many years of wisdom to share from his tours of the world stages.
Alexander Hodgson
Has been building natural structures for over 20 years and has a wealth of knowledge ranging from straw bale building to off grid energy that is beyond compare.
Miranda Warburton.
Artist, photographer, film maker and sharer of journeys with horses, will be documenting the project and sharing images and films as we go.
Kuki and the Bard

A brother and sister, worldschooled, off grid living, singer songwriting duo.. have recorded in some of the biggest and most influential studios in London and India and have played at Glastonbury, Boomtown, Smallworld, Buddhafield and Beautiful Days festivals, They have recorded a vinyl single for the RAK records classic singles collection and are currently writing songs for next years festival season.
Other Ways You Can Help

We believe this is a way we can make a contribution in helping young people transition towards a brighter, gentler future - but we can't do it alone…to make this dream a reality, we need to create a community of backers to help. And really, every single penny counts..! Your consideration and contribution could change a young persons life forever...giving them a fresh perspective on what happiness is or what success is all about..and enable them to see how creativity doesn’t have to cost the earth… If you can't contribute financially at this time, it would also be wonderful if you could please, please, please share this campaign and tell your friends....maybe together we can work a miracle....peace out, love and light from all involved here at the Off Grid Recording Studio Project.
Here's a Pony '0m' short film by Miranda Warburton.....music by Simeon Warburton....enjoy :)",3.0,2,"1 Campaign
|","Totnes, United Kingdom",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/kuki-and-the-bard-off-grid-recording-studio/pica

column5: >

column1: to a new survey more than 50% of kids in Europe today play outside less than
once a week.<b>Twenty
eight percent of them haven't been on a country walk in the last year, 21% have
never been to a farm and 20% have never climbed a tree. Another one states that “just five
minutes' ""green exercise"" can produce rapid improvements in mental
well-being and self-esteem, with the greatest benefits experienced by the
young” (references). Even though these
figures may be a little lower for Bulgarian kids, the lack of outdoor time is a
worldwide problem.
We, the Large Carnivore Education Centre
team, have a solution to this problem for children living in or visiting
Bulgaria. <b>We offer you a connection with wildlife and farm life through the
interaction with wolves, bears, horses and farm animals in their natural
environment. Each visitor can also enjoy our interactive educational exhibit in
the building of the centre itself or take an inspiring hike in the area of
southern Pirin Mountain.
How does our centre make a difference for
your children you may ask?The difference is that we are not a zoo. We are out in the
mountain. The animals have been saved from certain situations to come to us and
live in a semi-wild environment taken care by us. We have a profound knowledge
about large carnivores, wild, and farm life. And we have the right people to
share this knowledge with your children.

column11:
>

Imagine the warm touch of the Mediterranean

column1: climate combined with the beautiful steep and majestic slopes of the Pirin
Mountain. Now try to imagine how it would feel to stand only a meter away from
a real wolf or bear in the mountain without being afraid while listening to the
intriguing story of their life. <b>This is how our place in Vlahi feels
– exciting with sensations and inspiring with knowledge.
The Large Carnivore Education Centre
(LCEC)is located in the village of Vlahi, only 10
km from the town of Kresna and the main highway to Greece, E79. There you will find detailed,
straightforward and attractively presented information concerning wild nature,
large carnivores in Bulgaria and their related species around the world. The
interactive exhibition materials will urge you to press buttons, open doors and
look into boxes in order to take a look into a bear’s stomach or a wolf’s den.
Without noticing you will learn a lot by playing. The atmosphere in the centre
will give you the impression that you have entered the world of forest animals
– wolves, bears, lynx and jackals. You will learn about their live, the
environment they live in, human attitudes towards these species and what needs
to be done for their preservation.
The LCEC has a room with 40 seats suitable
for meetings, presentations, workshops with children and movie screenings. The
café in the central part of the building provides a cosy place to relax and
enjoy a cup of coffee.
At the souvenir store you will find pretty
handmade merchandise that make for great presents.
The LCEC is a joint initiative of BALKANI
Wildlife Society (as part of the Large Carnivore Programme of the organization)
and BBPS – SEMPERVIVA.
Vlahi is
the place we chose for us because of the many nature conservation activities
concentrated in the area that turn the village into a “place to meet with
nature”.
Know the animals
the Large Carnivore Education Centre (LCEC) we take care of two wolves –Bayto (7-8 years old) and Vachka (2 years old). Bayto comes from a zoo
in the town of Pavlikeni. He was born there. Vachka was born in another zoo in
the town of Stara Zagora. In Vlahi both of them have much better living
conditions than in any zoo.
Vlahi you can also meet Buya and Medo – our bears. Buya is 12.years old. Her story is sad. She was
born in the wild, in the Bulgarian Rhodope Mountains. As a very  young
cub, she lost her mother, which had been killed by poachers. Some people took
Buya to captivity, as otherwise she would have not survived. She spent the
first 10 years of her life in a beton cage. With us she can run, dig in the
soil, turn stones searching for larvae and enjoy the vegetation surrounding
her. Medo is 13 years old and he came to Vlahi when he was three. Born in the
zoo of Stara Zagora, as a very young cub, he was trained to be  as circus
bear. Fortunately, Medo did not become a circus bear, because the trainer could
not take care of him for a long time. He is very friendly with people and
enjoys visitors, especially if they have an apple for him.
column4: >
column7:
>

Both wolves and bears live in the open surrounded

column1: by an electric fence to protect them from running away. Having in mind these
animals cannot go back to the wild, because they have been either kept or
brought up away from it for too long, living in Vlahi is as close as they can
be to their natural environment.
Except for the wild animals, in the village there
are herds of sheep, goats and horses. The interesting fact about them is that
these  sheep and horses belong to the old native to Bulgaria Karakachan
breed, as the guarding  dogs do.
We can tell many stories, but no tale can replace
the real experience. So we offer some pictures and expect you to visit.
Know what we do
<ul>
• We take good care of the bears and wolves – feed
them, build and clean their living area and provide for their good medical
health
• We sustain the building of the LCEC in good shape
and complete the educational exhibition on the second floor
• We provide for a guide for visiting groups by
giving them a tour around the centre and the areas where the wild and farm
animals live
What we need your help for
column4:
>

The Large Carnivore Education Center has been

column1: constructed and developed with the help of individual and project funding. We
believe that once we complete the construction works needed for the animals,
the centre will be able to function smoothly. <b>It will become the place
we dream of – the meeting point of nature and education for children outdoors.
<ul>
<li>
An additional fence for wolves –
it will be used to divide the wolves’ enclosure in two parts, so that we
can separate them from one another when medication is given or other
treatment is needed. During the rest of the time the wolves are using the
whole space together.
<li>
A tunnel for the bears –
we believe that this will be a natural connection for the two bears and
they will use it to go from one living area to the other. At the moment
there is a door connecting the two neighboring bear enclosures, which they
refuse to use for almost two years. After careful observations, we concluded
that the door was constructed improperly for a bear to cross it.
<li>
A den for our bear Medo –bears
need a den to sleep in and rest in bad weather conditions
<li>
An independent fenced area within
the living area of the bear Buya – this area is needed in order to isolate
the bear while cleaning and repairing its living area and enlarging her
living space.
<li>
Building a hide for
observing and photography
<li>
Food for the bears and wolves
- The basic non-luxury food for a bear for a year amounts to 1500 BGN
(nearly 750 Euros) and consists of fruit, vegetables, honey, cereals, etc.
- The basic food for a wolf for a year amounts to 800 BGN (nearly 400
Euros) and consists of mostly meat.
The total: 12 000 BGN
If we don’t reach our goal in total during this
campaign you must be sure that the funds will be used for one of the activities
described above.
And of course it is not all about the money. If you
cannot, or you decide not to, contribute financially to the centre, there is a
lot you can do to support us. Share the campaign link with others, inform
yourself about the problems with illegal hunting of wolves and bears and share
the information. Join us on Facebook. Become a volunteer.
column4:
>

Perks

Our nature cards are our best-seller. We have images of wolves, bears, birds, chamois and different plants that you can chose from.

The sticker of a wolf's step is our kids' favourite.
column6:
/>

Most of our colleagues are not only biologists, but also great wildlife photographers. So we have stunning photographs for your desktop.

We also

column1: support handmade artists, so you have the chance to get something from our
friends: Niuffa and Ivo Domozetov.
<a href=""http://balkani.org/"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" style=""font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif
Balkani
Wildlife Society has been an active environmental non-governmental
organization that works in Bulgaria for more than 25 years. We do research and
work for the conservation and reintroduction of the flora and fauna in natural
ecosystems. We aim at preserving nature for future generations and raising
awareness about the problems of nature conservation. Every day we put science
into practice and pass our knowledge on to the young ones.
Our team is highly qualified and competent, enthusiastic and brave,
hard-working and always looking for new opportunities. Some of us are part of
Balkani from the beginning, while others became doctors of science, professors and public figures.
We have worked hard to create lasting professional relationships with
institutions, Nature Park Directorates, other NGOs, civil groups and
universities.
Our organization runs two information education centres that give
visitors the chance to get one step closer to nature. As its name suggests the Wetlands Conservation Centre “Dragoman Marsh” is
located near the Dragoman marsh and the Chepan hill – one of the most valuable
nature territories near Sofia and a unique combination of wetlands and karst
hills with impressive plant and animal species. The second one is the Large
Carnivore Education Centre that we are currently gathering funds for. (For more
information, please read the information above.)
You can learn more about Balkani Wildlife Society on our website and Facebook page.

<h3><u style='font-family: ""Benton Sans"", Helvetica, sans-serif
column3: '>With your help, we can fix the Opioid Crisis and reduce overdose deaths while at the same time clean your "" Polluted-Tainted"" Drinking Water.

column1: <ul>

• This is not just about the Opioid Crisis, it's about individual communities placing the bottles in the bathroom which immediately neutralizes Pharmaceuticals-OTC Medications-Vitamins. Removes them from abuse!
• No need to hold on to them until you find a drop off location which makes them available for abuse
• No longer do you need to flush them down the toilet or sink or throw these Pharmaceuticals-OTC Medications-Vitamins in the trash.
• A community can now take control of their ""Polluted-Tainted"" drinking water and reduce this pollution and at the same time address the opioid crisis.
• You can protect the health of your children and grandchildren from them drinking,  bathing,  washing in ""Polluted-Tainted"" water and have access to opioids.
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/tCnNZFQ4vfo?autohide=1&amp
• Become a community that cares.
Truth and Fact-
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/GnscNzPXzkc?autohide=1&amp
There is no known process other than distillation to remove Pharmaceuticals-OTC Medications-Vitamins from your drinking water.  Even bottled water does not remove them.
THE SOLUTION
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/JtVTknWD-fA?autohide=1&amp
<ol>
• Using a bottle that has been developed that holds 60 pills or liquids.
• Fits conveniently in your bathroom medicine cabinet
• Safely, immediately neutralizes Pharmaceuticals-OTC Medications-Vitamins
• Once the bottle is returned it is burned safely to generate electricity
• Your City can provide these bottles to every home at no cost
• Bottle filling is accomplished through a contract with the ""Special Needs"" community in Magnolia Arkansas and Russellville Arkansas
Is the bottle safe?
Yes, the bottle contains a patented liquid and the only active ingredient is ""activated charcoal""
LONG-TERM IMPACT
<ul>
• Reduces overdose deaths
• Reduces abuse of leftover medications
• Lowers the amount of Pharmaceuticals-OTC Medications-Vitamins from your drinking water
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/mEoW0uezgC8?autohide=1&amp
<ul>
• Protects the environment
• Educates families about the impact of Pharmaceuticals-OTC Medications-Vitamins on the environment
• Provides independence, jobs, income for the Special Needs community.
What We Need
Our goal is $47,900.00 which is enough to launch the bottle filling operations. Here is the breakdown where the funds will be used:
<ul>
• Husky 515 Pneumatic Pump for filling of the bottles
• Cycleflo Pneumatic Pump Controller which controls the amount of liquid per bottle
• Graco 205612 Automatic Dispense Valve
• Airpwr 200 psi 14 bar valve
• Kinex Bench Top Capping Machine
• 500 Gallon Liquid Holding tank
• Overhead exhaust fan
• Label Printer Primera LX900
• Labels
• Computer Database (MicroDesert)
• Basecamp Management System
• Wastewater Testing in Cities
• State Licenses
• Activated Charcoal
• Patented Liquid
• Bottles Caps
• Ship Station Mailing System
• Website
• Printing Handouts for Schools Education Program
• Phone System
<li><div style=""clear:both
<li><div style=""clear:both
column2: >Payment to special Needs for bottle filling

column1: We are providing unique perks!  This is the ONLY opportunity for individuals to purchase a bottle!  Review our offered PERKS.
This Program is supported by our Mentors at SCORE and Arkansas Small Business and Technology and Development Center Arkansas Tech University
Challenges
Our challenge will be to gear up fast enough to provide the bottles to the 12 cities we have already targeted, from whom we are getting contracts from.
Other Ways you can help!
​​Contact us with information about YOUR Community such as:
<ol>
• List of Community organizations with names and or email addresses
• Contact information as to your Mayor and council members
• Your contact information so that you can help us implement in your Community
• Friend us on facebook-like us on twitter-friend us on LinkedIn
• Share our posts using the Indiegogo tools
You can make a difference in the lives of people in your community.  Together We have a great opportunity to solve this looming health problem, ONE COMMUNITY AT A TIME!
If you have made it this far down the page, you're awesome and I thank you!
Additional Info.
Visit our website:  https://statmeddisposal.net  and see our video of the bottle in actual use.

T-shirts Are Sold Out, BUT... 

You can still support our barn raiser and get pins, stickers, hive tours, beekeeping consults and farm stays!

 

Why support us? 

Her name is Cleo the Big Red Barn, sibling to everyone's favorite Big Red Van, Clifford!

Everyone knows a barn is the heartbeat of any farm operation.  Ours, while sturdy with good bones, needs some structural improvements to continue to support our work... 

Cleo the Big Red Barn was constructed in 1990, with poured concrete footings and sturdy posts and beams.   She is central to our operation.  She houses machinery, tools and all of the bee equipment we need to keep the farm running smoothly.   This Fall Cleo got clobbered with a strange ""microburst"" storm, and her strucutural weaknesses became quite apparent.  


Cleo's entry door which had been very limiting for productive access, has now become stubbornly stuck.  The metal roofing, while structurally sound, leaked heavily, and appears to be getting worse.  We would really like to fix this before we run into any wood rot in the rafters.   

We anticipate barn repairs (including door, roof and storage stalls) will total to roughly ~$10k.  
This face lift would move us one step closer to installing SOLAR and reach our goal of generating 100% of our electricity on site!

Plus... we recently secured a grant through the Food Security Infrastructure Grant Program (thanks y'all!) to fund the creation of a mobile honey kitchen.  The grant covers the cost of materials, BUT cannot be applied to labor or building costs.  If we can raise funds to cover the cost of the labor of this project, we could make some real magic happen here y'all!  

Our friend &
column2: local contractor has agreed to help, and we estimate the build-out will cost $10k.  While our friend is here he's going to help us raise a small pole barn &amp
column3: outdoor learning space  (imagine it- kitchen + gathering space y'all!!!).  We anticipate this will cost roughly $3-4k.  In order to provide a hygienic outdoor experience, we plan to install two composting toilet stalls &amp
column4:
pump water sinks, which we're anticipating will cost $1-2k.  

We can’t get there without help from you, our community. 

When running a young farm, infrastructure improvements are difficult to fund.  They are often overlooked for systemic or enterprise driven investment, and overlooked even more when funds are tight.  However, they negatively impact operational efficiency.  This limits our capacity to set affordable prices and be a community food resource as well as an operating apiary.

column1: How are we using this fundraiser to support Mutual Aid?
We’ll be sharing 5% of donations with emerging mutual aid efforts for Black trans folks &
column2:
Indigenous 2-spirit people.  Donations will be made to both organizations and individuals.  Recipients will be emergent as the campaign moves forward.  Donation receipts will be posted after t-shirts are printed!   

 

Wanna support us MORE? 

You can support us by shopping at our online store to purchase online &
column3:
in person classes, honey, zines, and more, check it out here!

Don’t have funds? You can still support us by sharing our fundraiser with your community, friends and family.  Amplify our fundraiser by posting it across social media platforms.  Host your own fundraiser in your network to normalize community giving and support.

The Send Summary

The Valdez Ice Climbing Festival is an annual event supported by the American Alpine Club and Access Fund. It helps us support our mission which is to care for and build trails as well as provide outdoor rec education through clinics and workshops! Come Send it with us in 2022!!!
<h3>What We Need &amp
Break it down for folks in more detail:
<ul>
• We need love from the community which also shows our grantors that the clinics, workshops, and trail work we provide are valuable to residents and visitors!
• In exchange for your show of support, we want to give you the best experience ever! Let us help you plan your trip - whether you're full on dirt bag or diva, we got you covered.

• Your funds go to supporting humans and the wild lands around us. We definitely are into supporting people's dreams - so to all the outside explorers, adventurers, those who are taking and took the time to learn ice climbing and safety proficiency, We Support You!
The Impact
<ul>

• Furthermore, some of our instructors and event participants come from outside Valdez. That Means it is Up To Us to maintain the trails which makes routes available not only for climbers, but fat bikers, hikers, and other outdoor enthusiasts. This takes fuel, tools, manpower, and sometimes large equipment. But this is just what we love to do!

• Winter Maintenance: we have community members that go out and pack snow and test routes. Of course, sometimes volunteers are unavailable. Either way we supply fuel or reimburse for time or other supplies that might be required. Often the winter will create some damage (and sometimes we have to respond to vandals), which will require additional repairs and maintenance. Also, to access some of our trails and camping areas we have to hire people to plow snow. All in all, it can be a lot!

• Spring Maintenance: When the green starts growing back, we've got to send people out to trim branches, work the dirt, and make sure there are no hazards as well as clean up from the thaw (that said, we love our dog owners!). Also, since spring still means snow, sometimes we still need to plow snow. We also have port-a-potties, garbage and cabin/ campground areas that need cleaning and revitalizing. We support a campground host to help us out during the summer months as well.

• Your support goes a long way, let me tell you. And we are grateful! We want visitors and residents alike to fully enjoy and respect this incredible wild land. Reach out anytime for questions, comments, feedback, or to plan your next visit.
<h3>Risks &amp
<ul>

• 2020 certainly provided some challenges for us. We created a COVID mitigation plan and stuck with it. Part of that plan was getting feedback from the participants of our near sold out event - and we are more than pleased to report no incidents.

• Traditionally we have received support from the city and other grantors. This is never a guarantee. Fees alone will not prove a sustainable event which is why we reach out, hold fund raisers, and find other sponsors! We can only hope Black Diamond, HyperLite, Petzl, The Prospector, The Fat Mermaid, The North Face and other businesses will continue to be a part of this fantastic event.
Other Ways You Can Help
<ul>
<li>If you can't contribute or join us this year:<ul>
• Share on social media - You can use the Indigogo share tools
• Share with your friends, family and other adventure enthusiasts
• Print a flyer for your local climbing gym (Reach out - We can personalize one for you!)
• Business owners - Donate a fund raising item
• Thank you so much! We love our global community!

Li’s vision stretches beyond permaculture designs and sustainable living. We aim at reestablishing the connection between the culture and habitats we currently live in and the ones we previously cherished before we moved into an excessive and demanding lifestyle.

The more we observe that fact, the more we realize that nature does not tolerate excess. Our nature as beings reached a point where it has traded abundance for excess. Infinite growth is destructive, sustainability is balance.

We receive by giving, first the luxury of a retreat to raw nature, to learning different concepts (in local communities, schools, researchers. summer campers, practitioners, nature lovers, and curious observers) from organic planting, to harvesting, to eco building, to social responsibility
column2: A space for workshops/talks, hands-on experience where people can shape ideas, knowledge &amp

column1: Workshops raise curiosity, results create initiative in others, and more results create a trend and then a momentum.
We are neither a venture nor a venue, we are somehow collaborators of change, and we are learning that along the way, all channels tend to have an impact directly or indirectly.

The project started with a series of workshops hosted by local and international people, starting with vermin-compost toilets to a cob oven, wood working and finally the building of an earth bag dome hobbit house

The idea was to teach others the process of building one’s own house with minimum cost from limited resources they can acquire from their own land. Smart and simple systems can be installed (passive solar, gray water, rocket mass heater  ...) that would allow them to benefit more from nature's abundance as an alternative to investing money and thus time to pay unnecessary bills.
Our vision aims at making a difference while interacting with nature, by substituting nature’s exploitation with nature’s appreciation.
<h3>What We Need &amp
<ul>

<li>The funding will be going to mostly buying the material and finishing our second phase of our earth bag hobbit house which consists of plastering, insulating, burying and planting the roof. From the inside, the funding will help us close the house with windows , doors &amp
• The rest of the house will be built through workshops to teach people and further propagate the knowledge. Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited
<li>With each donation, you will get a free access to our workshops, a 3 day stay &amp
column2: a free organic basket that consists of fruits, veggies, eggs &amp

column1: • No matter how much we raise, you will still be contributing in finishing our hobbit house.
The Impact
From strong believers to trendy followers, our service to the greater good has been planned to reach the knowledge and mutual contribution part way before the commodification aspect.

We are heading there, and we will get where we are going faster with the help of any contribution. Those who see it growing will start it on their own, and it’s a responsible start and a chance for change.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute this doesn't mean you can not help!
You can share the post and make some noise about our campaign or join us on ground  and get your hands dirty and tickle your brain  !

What We Need & What You Get

The funding will be going to mostly buying the material and finishing our second phase of our earth bag hobbit house which consists of plastering, insulating, burying and planting the roof. From the inside, the funding will help us close the house with windows , doors & skylights
The rest of the house will be built through workshops to teach people and further propagate the knowledge. Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited
With each donation, you will get a free access to our workshops, a 3 day stay &  a free organic basket that consists of fruits, veggies, eggs & organic products such as deodorant.
No matter how much we raise, you will still be contributing in finishing our hobbit house.
The Impact
From strong believers to trendy followers, our service to the greater good has been planned to reach the knowledge and mutual contribution part way before the commodification aspect.

We are heading there, and we will get where we are going faster with the help of any contribution. Those who see it growing will start it on their own, and it’s a responsible start and a chance for change.
