column5: >A Plan to Modernize LIHI's Application Process...

column3: >The Low Impact Hydropower Institute (LIHI) is a non-profit 501(c)(3) public benefit corporation established in 1999 to operate the Low Impact Hydropower Certification program.  The core of

column1: the Certification program focuses on eight objective environmental criteria, including:
<ul>
• Ecological Flow Regimes
• Water Quality Protection
• Upstream Fish Passage
• Downstream Fish Passage and Protection
• Watershed and Shoreline Protection
• Threatened and Endangered Species Protection
• Cultural and Historic Resource Protection
• Recreational Resources
Since the
program began, LIHI certification has become the most widely accepted,
independent standard for electricity consumers to use in evaluating “green” and
sustainable hydropower in the U.S.   <span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column6: > years LIHI has issued more than 130 low impact certificates, affecting projects in 23 states, with a combined installed capacity of more than 4.8 GW of clean, environmentally sound renewable energy.  That's a lot of benefit to rivers, healthy fish, protected watersheds, investments in recreation and cultural resources!  T
column7: >here has also a significant amount of growth to our workload, and our information management systems and databases have grown outdated and inefficient.

column2: >This Indiegogo campaign is designed to raise funds for the construction and implementation of a new online application portal (LIHI Online) to manage the Low Impact Hydropower Certification application process as well as a more sophisticated data base and workflow management system for all LIHI program information.  LIHI Online will provide varying levels of access to a range of stakeholders:

column1: <ul>
<li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >Project applicants and owners would have secure log in to access to their own accounts, to complete the LIHI application materials, upload supporting documentation, update changes to contact information and access all stored files pertaining to their certification(s) at all phases of the certificate process.

column1: <li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >Staff will be able to access all project accounts to perform a range of duties, including processing new applications, billing and account updates, annual compliance review and more.

column1: <li>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >Independent Reviewers will be provided with access to individual accounts as they are assigned application review tasks.

column1: <li>
Environmental NGOs and Resource Agency Staff will be offered access to valuable aggregate information about river ecosystems that LIHI collects through our certification program.
LIHI Online will also interface with LIHI's website, www.lowimpacthydro.org, to ensure that the information displayed on the website is accurate and current.
The Details...
<div>

The target fundraising amount for this campaign is $40,000.  This amount will underwrite the anticipated cost of hiring a professional IT firm to construct the system, migrate all of LIHI's current data into LIHI Online and train LIHI staff and all online users (including certificate holders, applicants and contractors) for a seamless transition.

As a non-profit organization, LIHI can accept donated funds even if we do not reach our $40,000 goal by the end of our campaign.  Any amount we receive will help LIHI in completing this important task sooner rather than later!
The Impact...

LIHI continues to see new applications for low impact hydropower certification, and the markets that rely on the LIHI certificate to inform consumers about green hydropower are growing.  Despite the growth of the program, LIHI's internal processing methods to manage the program have not significantly improved since the program began.  Applicants submit materials using Microsoft Word via disc or printed via US mail. LIHI staff manually processes the applications.  Basic steps, like updating owner contact information, submitting documentation for annual compliance and sharing information with independent project reviewers continues to be inefficient and is prone to delay.

Funding LIHI Online will insure the capability of LIHI to meet growth demands and better serve all stakeholder communities, including certificate holders, state energy offices, federal and state resource agency staff, REC market participants, energy consumers and the public at large!
Risks &

LIHI sits at the nexus of a very complicated policy arena.  The hydropower licensing process in the US involves upwards of six years of permitting and stakeholder input from state resource agencies, environmental NGOs, Indian Tribes and many other stakeholders.
column2: >Further, the US clean energy market consists of a patchwork of differing policies, with each jurisdiction defining eligible sources of renewable energy in different ways.

>LIHI's program provides an exceptional value to states which rely on the LIHI certification program to identify eligible green hydropower. Most state energy offices have funding resources to boost and incentivize the development of green renewable energy, however LIHI has found it challenging to garner financial support from any one state because the LIHI program serves so many different state programs.

column1: This campaign is designed to appeal to a broad range of potential contributors, widening the ability to support this effort to a greater audience.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate to the campaign, please help us spread the word and encourage others to donate!

program began, LIHI certification has become the most widely accepted,
independent standard for electricity consumers to use in evaluating “green” and

sustainable hydropower in the U.S.   In the past fifteen+ years LIHI has issued more than 130 low impact certificates, affecting projects in 23 states, with a combined installed capacity of more than 4.8 GW of clean, environmentally sound renewable energy.  That's a lot of benefit to rivers, healthy fish, protected watersheds, investments in recreation and cultural resources!  There has also a significant amount of growth to our workload, and our information management systems and databases have grown outdated and inefficient.

This Indiegogo campaign is designed to raise funds for the construction and implementation of a new online application portal (LIHI Online) to manage the Low Impact Hydropower Certification application process as well as a more sophisticated data base and workflow management system for all LIHI program information.  LIHI Online will provide varying levels of access to a range of stakeholders:

Project applicants and owners would have secure log in to access to their own accounts, to complete the LIHI application materials, upload supporting documentation, update changes to contact information and access all stored files pertaining to their certification(s) at all phases of the certificate process.
Staff will be able to access all project accounts to perform a range of duties, including processing new applications, billing and account updates, annual compliance review and more.
Independent Reviewers will be provided with access to individual accounts as they are assigned application review tasks.
Environmental NGOs and Resource Agency Staff will be offered access to valuable aggregate information about river ecosystems that LIHI collects through our certification program.
LIHI Online will also interface with LIHI's website, www.lowimpacthydro.org, to ensure that the information displayed on the website is accurate and current.
The Details...

The target fundraising amount for this campaign is $40,000.  This amount will underwrite the anticipated cost of hiring a professional IT firm to construct the system, migrate all of LIHI's current data into LIHI Online and train LIHI staff and all online users (including certificate holders, applicants and contractors) for a seamless transition.

As a non-profit organization, LIHI can accept donated funds even if we do not reach our $40,000 goal by the end of our campaign.  Any amount we receive will help LIHI in completing this important task sooner rather than later!
The Impact...

LIHI continues to see new applications for low impact hydropower certification, and the markets that rely on the LIHI certificate to inform consumers about green hydropower are growing.  Despite the growth of the program, LIHI's internal processing methods to manage the program have not significantly improved since the program began.  Applicants submit materials using Microsoft Word via disc or printed via US mail. LIHI staff manually processes the applications.  Basic steps, like updating owner contact information, submitting documentation for annual compliance and sharing information with independent project reviewers continues to be inefficient and is prone to delay.

Funding LIHI Online will insure the capability of LIHI to meet growth demands and better serve all stakeholder communities, including certificate holders, state energy offices, federal and state resource agency staff, REC market participants, energy consumers and the public at large!
Risks & Challenges...

LIHI sits at the nexus of a very complicated policy arena.  The hydropower licensing process in the US involves upwards of six years of permitting and stakeholder input from state resource agencies, environmental NGOs, Indian Tribes and many other stakeholders.  Further, the US clean energy market consists of a patchwork of differing policies, with each jurisdiction defining eligible sources of renewable energy in different ways.

LIHI's program provides an exceptional value to states which rely on the LIHI certification program to identify eligible green hydropower. Most state energy offices have funding resources to boost and incentivize the development of green renewable energy, however LIHI has found it challenging to garner financial support from any one state because the LIHI program serves so many different state programs.
This campaign is designed to appeal to a broad range of potential contributors, widening the ability to support this effort to a greater audience.
Other Ways You Can Help If you cannot donate to the campaign, please help us spread the word and encourage others to donate!",3.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1: ","Mapping our Power The team at the Australian PV Institute have created some truly amazing maps and tools around solar energy installations in Australia. These maps are used by enthusiasts, media, developers and installers to communicate the message that Solar Works!
There are 6 different types of maps and tools that show where solar is installed and how much energy in each state is coming from solar, for example
You can see how South Australia typically gets >20% of its energy from solar day after day after day...

You can see how much solar is installed in your area and compare it to others, by state or by postcode. There are entire suburbs where 50% of the homes are powered by the sun! There are electorates in Queensland where over 40% of the homes are solar powered!
There's an animation showing how solar in Australia has increased by over 300 times since 2007
There is even the first release of a tool that you can use to estimate the output of a PV system on your roof - not all locations yet as we are building this up
and we have plans for more....
To see for yourself, follow the website link provided later, or search for APVI solar map.

This work received seed-funding from the Australian Renewable Energy Agency (ARENA), for which we are very grateful, but there's so much more we can do and, with your help, we'd like to take it further.
We are mapping solar in Australia to communicate its success and to inform the discussion and policy debate around the significance of solar.
We've mapped Queensland by electorate, now we'd like to do that for each state, starting with NSW.
What We Need

We need just $2,500 to map by electorate for each state.  With an election coming up, we want to start with NSW, but the more support we get, the further we will take it. We aim to bring enough money in the first few days to have the solar map used to inform the conversation in the lead up to the NSW election.

Our target of $15,000 will allow us to map all of Australia by electorate and make a big contribution to the conversation around solar and the people's support. We'd recruit a communications person to create content around the facts and figures and get the message out about the successful deployment of solar in Australia. We lead the world in residential rooftop installations and we want to let everyone know about it.
With more than $15,000, we'll be able to build extra features on the maps (listed below), including more sites, better branding and communications around the Solar Map.
If you've got this far and are ready to support us, a big thanks - go for it. If you want more information on the benefits of support or our plans for the map, then read on.

You can contribute by way of donation as little as $1 or by selecting a perk from $22 up. If you support us with over $100, we'll offer you the opportunity to join the APVI then you can access all the members benefits including recognition on the APVI website, news and event invitations and discounts.
The Impact

We aim to increase the deployment of solar energy through sharing good data and through communication. The Australian Solar Map is already a great resource for sharing information about the uptake of solar in Australia and is widely referenced in industry news. With your help we can do more...
We've got big plans for more from the Australian Solar Map including....
Mapping by electorate will help inform discussion and policy debate around support for solar.

For most capital city CBD's it is already possible to map your rooftop for how much energy you can generate from solar panels using the Solar Potential Tool. We want to extend this to much greater areas.
We want to work with the Solar Schools program to include their data in the Australian Solar Map.
We're interested in integrating weather data so that we can start to forecast future PV generation
and we are working with our members to develop new applications
This is only the beginning. We'd love to hear your ideas too. Join us in developing this amazing tool.
Who are we...?

The Australian PV Institute (APVI) is a not-for-profit, member-based association of companies, agencies, individuals and academics who are passionate about solar energy research, technology, manufacturing, systems, policies, programs and projects.
Our objective is to: Support the increased development and use of PV via research, analysis and information.

Participation in APVI activities is on the basis of subscriptions or sponsorship of research and events, like this one.  Benefits of membership include regular events and newsletters, networking, and the opportunity to meet and work with local and international PV experts on submissions, reports and research projects.
The Australian Solar Map was developed by the very clever Dr Anna Bruce, with the support of ARENA and a number of other APVI members.
And we're very excited that the Australian Solar Map was nominated and has now been shortlisted for the Energy Globe Awards.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","NSW, Australia",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/australian-solar-map/pica

Dear Community
I’m asking for your help to
build a life-changing project that I’ve been designing for more than five
years: a 32 foot, non-toxic, sustainable house on wheels. My tiny home will
dramatically change my own life for the better, but it also has the potential
to help millions of others who suffer from the environmental illness called
multiple chemical sensitivity.
Between 50 and 100 million
people suffer from MCS in the US alone.<span>
And yet, safe, non-toxic housing is extremely rare, and 60% of people

with MCS have had to live in cars, tents and other makeshift homes as a result. 

[To learn more about MCS homelessness, see the documentary Home Sick by Susan Abod.]

This tiny home represents a housing breakthrough for environmentally ill
people.  Designed as a showcase for safe
and sustainable materials and technologies, the Vehicle for Change will inspire
builders, designers and manufacturers by showing both the need for non-toxic
housing, and what’s possible. *

Many of you already know me as a writer, educator, and organizer, a radical Puerto Rican Jewish, disabled, feminist elder and an artist of social change.  My words and ideas have touched hundreds of thousands of people around the world through my activism, my books and my thirty-four years of teaching, speaking and reading. I've talked about the importance of healing trauma, studying history and using art in the work of social justice
column2:
about ending sex trafficking and building peace and justice in the Middle East, about the politics of disability and how climate change is caused by greed. 

You may have read Medicine Stories, Remedios, or my new book, Kindling.  But chances are, you

column1: didn’t know that I live with environmental illness, epilepsy and the aftermath
of multiple head injuries and a stroke. Chances are, you didn’t
know that common construction materials, household chemicals, laundry and
personal products make me dangerously ill, that many of the day to day
activities other people take for granted put me at risk—things like riding
buses, going to a party, stepping into a drugstore, staying at a hotel.<span>  I can’t go on book tours or work in offices. I was even homeless for months because I

couldn’t find non-toxic housing.

I’ve continued to write, often
from my bed, living in houses that make me sick.<span>  I face exhaustion, chronic pain, and one medical
emergency after another.  Without a
chemically clean, healthy home, my body is always fighting, running to catch
up.  I spend myself just trying not to
lose ground, and do only a fraction of the creative work I could be doing.  One of the things I dread most is dying with
my gifts un-given.
do for others, it will transform my ability to do what I was born to do.<span>  It will give me a safe place to live, a
sanctuary free from daily chemical assaults. It will let me heal and rest, travel and
write, and will give me a level of housing security I’ve never known.  The vehicle is a home, a research vessel, an
arts incubator, a road show and a teaching tool.  It will let me bring both my creative process
and the works I create to new communities, collaborate with more people, expand
the reach of my activism, and stay well while I do it.
You can read about all the
wonderful details of my Vehicle below. It’s full of ancient and 21<sup>st</sup>
century materials, high tech and low tech solutions, is a model of a new kind
of inclusive design, and is ridiculouDsly cool.
If my work has meant
something to you, if you’re excited by my ideas, or my situation moves you,
then help me create the conditions for a long, productive life, working for a
society that sustains and includes everyone.
Please contribute
generously and help me live in, and be

a Vehicle for Change.

*  I have drawn heavily from the inspiring work Leslie Lawrence and Justin Taylor, both of whom have designed other kinds of non-toxic, mobile houses.

*****************************************************************************

PHASES OF THE PROJECT

The Vehicle will be funded in three phases: the shell, the interior and the truck that will pull it.

Phase I costs $60,000 and covers construction of the trailer and outer shell, including the plumbing system, built-in storage lockers, a battery bank compartment, windows and doors, and external lighting, as well as a project manager.   I have raised $30,000 for Phase I.

Phase II will cost approximately $50,000. It includes super-insulation with foil-sealed rigid foam, construction of the interior walls, floor and ceiling, installation of solar panels, EMF shielded electrical wiring, the plumbing hookups, construction of counters, shelving, cabinets and drawers, LED lighting fixtures, and a Solatube daylighting system, a composting toilet, wood stove, DC powered fridge and other appliances , and a replacement organic latex, wool and cotton mattress to replace my current one, which was contaminated by leaks from ice dams during Boston's heavy 2014-15 winter.  I have raised

Phase III includes buying a used, gasoline powered, long bed, dually one ton pickup truck.  Diesel is far dirtier and more dangerous to human health than gasoline.  As soon as an affordable renewable energy heavy duty pickup is available, I will switch.  Phase III also includes a Rand McNally RV GPS to help me navegate safely, and a system for nomadic internet and cell access. 

Read more about the phases of construction on my website.

FEATURES OF THE VEHICLE DESIGN
column3:
/>             

Designing the Vehicle shell at Advantage Trailers in Illinois

 Here are some of the features of the Vehicle for Change

column1: • Aluminum tube frame and aluminum decking sub-floor, to avoid VOCs and potential mold from plywood and wood beams, and solvents in anti-rust treatments for steel.
• A solar electrical system.
• Oak and rubber flooring to cushion my joints, and avoid the chemicals in conventional flooring and adhesives, as well as the weight and hardness of ceramic tile.
• Hardwood shelving, cabinets and furniture, because conifer woods like fir and pine outgas terpines, and particle boards and veneers outgas formaldehyde and other toxicants.
• Countertops of Nuovo recycled bottle glass, which doesn't absorb odors or outgas anything, and Richlite, made of compressed paper and non-toxic resins, which is lightweight and strong.
• Interior walls of Ecor, made from cellulose fibers treated with heat and pressure, and covered with 100% wool felt for acoustic insulation.
• Heating and cooling with a solar powered mini-split heat exchanger, to avoid propane fumes and fossil fuel use.
• Additional heating and cooking with a virtually smokeless, super-efficient Kimberly gassification wood stove, which captures and burn wood gasses.
• A solar oven for outdoor cooking.
• Mpowerd solar lanterns.
• Entrance through a shower, with lockers for street clothing, so visitors can remove fragrance and other contaminants, and change into clean, scent-free house clothing.
• Air and water filtration to limit chemical infiltration.
• A small hydroponic garden, soil free to limit mold growth.
• External access storage lockers isolated from the interior, to store books, which outgas fumes from ink, paper and glues, and may have mold spores, and to allow new products to outgas.

You can look at more innovative design and materials ideas on my Pinterest page, or at my Vehicle for Change web site. 

             CONSULTANTS WHO HELPED ME DESIGN THE VEHICLE

Short Summary

Fins Attached believes that everything it does helps to protect the marine environment:

  • Fins Attached is a 501(c)(3) non-profit founded in 2010.
  • Protection of the ocean's apex predators in critical for marine ecosystem balance.
  • Your help will help to ensure the survival of this newly discovered Pacific sharpnose shark nursery.

The survival of the oceans means the survival of all living things on earth.

Project Needs

The ability to track these juvenile sharks to maturity and consequently track them once they leave the nursery will be vital to their survival:

  • Phase one of the project will tag the sharks with internal acoustic transmitters. In order to monitor the sharks, underwater listening stations will be deployed to pick up the transmissions from the tags. Each tag costs approximately $400 and each listening station $1500.
  • Discovering new shark nursery areas is a rare event. Now that it has been found, the key is to preserve it. Your funding will help create a no-take zone while these juvenile sharks are still around. Know the season will be important.
  • Once the funding goal is reached the tags and listening stations will be purchased for deployment.

The Impact

column2: >Conducting research, promote conservation, and providing education for the protection of the marine ecosystem is one of the most important things are generation can do. That is the mission of Fins Attached.

>We believe in the preservation of our world's precious resources and that through the protection of the oceans apex predators, marine ecosystem balance can be maintained for the benefit of all living things on earth

column1: • Nothing is more valuable to the health of our environment than the health of our oceans. Become a part of the solution!

• If these baby sharks are not protected, the fishermen will make them dissappear very quickly!
  • Fins Attached and it's scientist and collaborators have a long history of over 20 years of conducting research and affecting change for the benefit of all humankind.
  • Fins Attached is a 100% volunteer organization and as such all funds raised, 100% will be used to fund this project.

    • Risks &
column2:
Challenges

When dealing with nature there are always challenges. However, our experience allows us to overcome many of these challenges. Dealing with governments to affect change is also challenging.

  • Fins Attached has a track record of convincing government to protect shark species, including at the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora (CITES).
  • Fins Attached is working with their field scientist, a Mexican native, on this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Spread the word and make some noise about our campaign to save these cute little sharks.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Project Needs The ability to track these juvenile sharks to maturity and consequently track them once they leave the nursery will be vital to their survival: Phase one of the project will tag the sharks with internal acoustic transmitters. In order to monitor the sharks, underwater listening stations will be deployed to pick up the transmissions from the tags. Each tag costs approximately $400 and each listening station $1500. Discovering new shark nursery areas is a rare event. Now that it has been found, the key is to preserve it. Your funding will help create a no-take zone while these juvenile sharks are still around. Know the season will be important. Once the funding goal is reached the tags and listening stations will be purchased for deployment. The Impact

Conducting research, promote conservation, and providing education for the protection of the marine ecosystem is one of the most important things are generation can do. That is the mission of Fins Attached.

We believe in the preservation of our world's precious resources and that through the protection of the oceans apex predators, marine ecosystem balance can be maintained for the benefit of all living things on earth:
Nothing is more valuable to the health of our environment than the health of our oceans. Become a part of the solution!

If these baby sharks are not protected, the fishermen will make them dissappear very quickly! Fins Attached and it's scientist and collaborators have a long history of over 20 years of conducting research and affecting change for the benefit of all humankind. Fins Attached is a 100% volunteer organization and as such all funds raised, 100% will be used to fund this project.    Risks & Challenges  When dealing with nature there are always challenges. However, our experience allows us to overcome many of these challenges. Dealing with governments to affect change is also challenging.  Fins Attached has a track record of convincing government to protect shark species, including at the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora (CITES). Fins Attached is working with their field scientist, a Mexican native, on this project.    Other Ways You Can Help If you cannot contribute, that doesn't mean they can't help:  Spread the word and make some noise about our campaign to save these cute little sharks. Please use the Indiegogo share tools!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Colorado Springs, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/protect-the-pacific-sharpnose-shark-nursery/pica
0,"
The Love Lions Alive Project took on the task of keeping a whole reserve of lions alive and protecting them from sale for hunting or for body parts.
We have subsequently taken in orphaned lions or lions seeking sanctuary from other parks, zoos or private owners.
Our mission is to create an awareness that a living lion should be more valuable to people than a dead lion. Lions are not stock, not objects, not produce, not replaceable.

LOVE LIONS ALIVE is in dire need for funds that go directly to the care of these incredibly beautiful animals. From Cubs to full grown adults, our sanctuary has over 50 lions who on a daily basis need food, repairs to their habitat, supplies and enrichment objects to keep the lions happy and healthy.
We desperately need your help to survive and any amount would be of great help in our quest to save these majestic animals.
To see more about our sanctuary and what we do, please look at our facebook Glen Gariff Lions (Love Lions Alive Project) or www.lovelionsaliveproject.com

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks &
column3:
Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

TATTLE TAILS INC
Mission Statement:
Our wildlife and natural
resources are depleting every day as we speak.
Due to the pollution, arson, illegal dumping, hunting, and logging.  We are losing the battle even faster by these
human transgressions.
Due to budget cuts these acts
have been ongoing and unchecked.
There are simply not enough game
wardens to patrol the vast amount of wild life and natural resources.  We need to stand guard to watch over our
forests, deserts, mountains, and waterways.
To help, TATTLE TAILS INC (the whistle blowers) will be the eyes and
ears.
We will go out day and night,
working with land owners and wildlife officials.
We will put up trail cameras.
We will report GPS locations of
illegal dumping, poaching, and any other illegal acts against nature to the
proper authorities.
We will be out there to observe,
report, and document anything suspicious.
We will get the photographic proof to help local
authorities solve the case quickly. We will be watching…
“We are here to
observe, report, and document all illegal acts against Mother Nature and her

critters. We are the ""TATTLE TAILS”

Why Help?

When you read the words poaching, do you
think of faraway places? Well, it's happening here, in California. And
that's not all. Up and down our state people are illegally dumping waste
material into our waterways and onto our forest lands.
Due to budget cuts, California’s game
wardens are down to approximately 200, which is the lowest count in all of the
United States. This is a major concern for California because there
are 193 million acres of national forests and grasslands, 1,000 miles of ocean
coastline, and 30,000 miles of rivers and streams. That averages out to 965,000
acres per game warden, slightly smaller than the state of Rhode Island. Also,
California’s Department of Fish and Wildlife issues over 3 million license and
permits a year. With your support, Tattle Tails Inc. will stand guard to
protect our forests, deserts, mountains, and waterways.
The need and how of Tattle Tails Inc.
will effect real assistance: Tattle Tails will use trail cameras and GPS to
report locations of illegal dumping and poaching to the proper authorities. We
are prepared to organize volunteers to clean up illegal dumping sites. Inner
city children will have the availability of field trips designed to teach them
about the importance of a sustainable environment.

Recycling Fuel
We are a
waste oil recycling company, specialising in the collection and treatment of
waste oil products. We are set on changing the way people think about recycling
and waste products. People are becoming increasingly aware of the need to
recycle glass and paper products, but there is little known about the proper
treatment of waste oil. The shocking truth is that 1 gallon of waste oil can
contaminate 1 million gallons of water. Waste oil can be successfully recycled
and reused
column2: by recycling waste oils we are able to drastically reduce the

column1: carbon emissions and energy consumed to originally distil fuel.
South
Africa generates 120 million litres of used motor oil each year. This used
motor oil is incredibly hazardous
column2: it contains many toxic chemicals, including

column1: cancer causing carcinogens. When disposed of incorrectly, this waste oil can
find its way into our water sources, polluting the natural environment and
leading to potentially lethal consequences for both human and animal life.
We
collect waste motor oil to recycle because waste oil isn’t worn out, it’s just
filthy. This used oil can be recycled and reused as fuel oil. By recycling and
reusing waste oil we are reducing the need for crude oil extraction
and the environmental ramifications associated with it. It takes
42 gallons of crude oil, but only 2 gallons of used oil to produce 1 gallon
of new, high quality lubricating oil.  By recycling just 2 gallons of used
oil, it is possible to generate enough electricity to run the average household
for almost 24 hours!
Another big collection source is waste oil from Marine
vessels. All big marine vessels run on a fuel called HFO which, in the
consumption process, results in a waste oil product called ‘sludge’. ‘Sludge’
is a dirty blend of emulsified oil and water. Marpol (the Maritime Pollution
Protocol) banned the discharge of sludge into the sea in 1983, which kept the
oceans cleaner, but resulted in landfills filling up quicker. Since sludge consists
of 50% oil, we realized that there was massive potential energy contained in
the product and began to acquire sludge from vessels. Once the oil is separated
from the water and cleaned of impurities, we are able to sell the resulting
product on as industrial heating fuel.
What We Need &
We have obtained all necessary
licenses and accreditation to operate our waste oil collection business and
have already seen ourselves making an impact within our community.
We reward our customers for
bringing in their waste oil for collection. By paying people for their waste
oil, we like to think we are helping people help themselves (financially) and
their communities (by having a cleaner community) as well as the greater
environment (by encouraging the concept of recycling and reusing, less harmful
waste oil is able to pollute our natural environment and find its way into our
water systems, preventing harm to humans and animals alike).
We need funding to aid in the
expansion of our business. This money will go towards building effluent plants
to treat the waste oil, social upliftment and educating communities.

Reaching our funding goal will enable us to boost our corporate social responsibility program so we can keep on giving back to society and the environment. The nature of our business is based on recycling, the more successful our business is, the more we are aiding in environmental conservation. 
Reaching our funding goal has the potential for incredible things, such as
column2:
-Creating jobs and reducing the unemployment rate in South Africa
-Sending 1000 underprivileged children to school for a year
-Planting 5000 trees
-Cleaning up our beaches
-Supplying much needed grass lawns to underprivileged areas
-Putting a smile on the faces of thousands of children

column1: Let's talk about Perks

We are very happy to share that external auditors KPMG has agreed to verify quarterly that all perks taken up in the project have been delivered. The reports will be shared on our Indiegogo campaign and Facebook pages.
$5- Adopt a smile.
We will send you a digital photo of one
of the school children, that you are  helping with a big smile that you helped put on
their face. The photo will have a location and the name of the child as well as

your name on it. Our aim is to make a wall of smiles, every 2500 strong smile-wall will be compiled and shared on our project Facebook page. Once each wall is done a digital copy will also be sent to the donor.  All smile walls will be kept on the Facebook page to track overall progress. For every Six smile walls, we will create one Smile Hall of Fame. The Hall of Fame would be randomly named after one of its contributors.
$10- Get involved at grass roots.
Help the children play. For every 100 Grass Roots perks taken up, we will

plant grass at a school or a park in a low income community in your honor . A plaque with all donor names and the location of the initiative will be put up at the site where it happens. A digital copy of the plaque will be sent to the donor.
$50- Happy seas
Help keep our world beautiful. We
will contribute reward packs to be given to volunteers in the national coastal
cleanups. For every 100 Happy Seas perks we will organise a Beach Cleanup.  Details of the cleanup and a breakdown of what was achieved during the cleanup will be sent to every donor.
$100- Take a breath of fresh air
Trees give life. You have planted

a tree in a much needed area. A digital photo of your tree will be sent to you, along with its location and its name. (We will supply you with the biological name, you can choose its nickname!) We will keep a digital forest on our project Facebook page. Once a forest is a thousand trees strong we will send an image thereof to each donor. Every donor will also be legible to put forward a name for the forest, which will get drawn randomly from the 50 best submissions.
$500- Back to School Basics
Give the gift of education. We
will pay school fees for 1 child attending school in a low income community in
your honour. You will get a thank you note from the child, as well as a picture of the pupil and the name of the School he/she is attending.
$1000- Back to School Plus
Give the gift of education and
more. We will pay school fees for 1 child attending school as well as supply

stationery and school clothes. You will get a thank you note from the child, as well as a picture of the pupil and the name of the School he/she is attending. You will also get a progress report 3 times in the 12 months you sponsor him/her for.
$10 000 - The ""Insert Your Name"" Library
Reading is the Root of Knowledge, and because we are all into growing things, we will set up a container type library at a school that doesn't have the facility and name the library after you.

What happens if the funding goals aren't reached?

There is no downside for the donor, every contribution will still go towards the social/economic perk it was allocated to. Not reaching the funding goal won't affect our corporate social responsibility vision, we will still
column2: >assist in community and environmental projects where we can- we will just not be able to do it on the same scale should we achieve our target funding. We will also endeavor to complete the Ground Roots and Happy Seas perks regardless of how short of a complete tally of the specific perk we are at the end of the funding period.

column1: The Impact
South
Africa is a country that is forging through the adversity of its past and has
immeasurable potential for social and economic growth. The growth of our
business will see us contributing towards job and wealth creation within our
beautifully diverse country. We foresee a bright future for our company,
empowering people with jobs and education and contributing to environmental
conservation and the preservation of our uniquely expansive biodiversity.
We are
looking to expand the reach of our business and create a greater awareness,
within schools and low income communities as well as within industries relating
to waste oils, of the need to recycle and reuse.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone is in a position to donate money, but if you still want to contribute to our campaign please forward our link to all your friends and family, and ask them to do the same. If you are in South Africa, or planning a visit to South Africa and you would like to donate your time to any of the perks available it would be greatly appreciated. As the old adage goes - many hands make light work.

      Fibonacci Farm is a fifteen acre piece of Maine Farmland Trust conservation land. We are a permaculture farm which is the philosophy of working with, rather than against nature
column2: of protracted and thoughtful observation rather than protracted and thoughtless labor
column3:
and of looking at plants and animals in all their functions, rather than treating any area as a single product system.

     Our industrialized farming techniques are destroying the little land we have left to sustain ourselves. And we are not willing to take part in these practices. This world does not need anymore huge, unsustainable farms creating dust bowls. It needs smaller, grassroots farms created for the future. We want to do our part to help supply our local community with fresh, non-GMO, organically grown vegetables, herbs, grains, mushrooms, eggs and meat. And we want to do all of this with one of the oldest and lowest impact farming techniques, horse-power! In order to accomplish this however there are a few financial boosts we are seeking.

     Step one, we've got to house our horses! Winter is coming and in order to be able to keep our two Haflinger horses on our farm we've got to build stalls. Step two, we are in need of electric fencing to provide our team of horses with adequate paddock space. Step three, we need new equipment. It's not a $500,000 tractor like the largest corn producing farms use. It's much simpler, horse drawn tools like cultivators and plows. Which by the way require no gasoline to run, just a lot of positive reinforcement, patience and the occasional fresh carrot right out of the field! Any and all contributions whether they be big or small are greatly appreciated and will be put towards creating a better future for generations to come.


Thank you!

Grand Isle has been through a lot in the last 10 years, from Hurricanes Katrina, Rita, Gustav and Ike to the BP oil disaster, Tropical Storm Lee and Hurricane Isaac. Yet the people and spirit of the town have come back stronger than ever.  As Louisiana's only inhabited barrier island, Grand Isle is a vital first line of defense for the state against hurricanes and a unique wildlife habitat for many species of marine life and birds. It is also an important hub for seafood and the oil industry.  As a living testament to the strength and resilience of the people of south Louisiana, the Garden Club of Grand Isle is raising funds to plant palm trees along the main road running through the town, LA Highway 1.
With the help of Louisiana State University Agriculture, we have concluded that the Cabbage (sabal) palm is the best palm for our island.
column2: > This hearty palm is both drought and wind resistant and will live for decades to come. The project proposes to plant palm trees along both sides of Highway 1, as well as some additional trees at the island's entrance. The placement of the cabbage palms along Grand Isle's main thoroughfare will replace lost vegetation, create habitat for wildlife
column3: > and make the island a more attractive place to live and visit. It will be a new signature feature of the island, serving as a visible sign of its recovery and rebirth for years to come.

column1: What We Need to Succeed
Our fundraising goal is $15,000, which covers the cost of purchasing 75 cabbage palm trees, 10- to 12-foot tall, as well as delivery and planting of the trees.

The trees will be planted this Spring so you will soon be able to see what a difference you have made in Grand Isle.

The Impact

The palm trees will replace lost vegetation, create habitat for wildlife and beautify the landscape. Their resistance to wind and drought means that these trees will stand for years to come.

You can still give to this campaign:

Please donate what you can - every bit helps - and help us spread the word by sharing and telling your friends and employers.
Visit www.grand-isle.com and click on the link to the Grand Isle Palm Tree Project page.  There you can donate online.  You can also make a check out to The Grand Isle Garden
Club and mail it to our address (P.O. Box 817 Grand Isle, LA 70358) or drop it off to the Visitor Center on Highway 1 in Grand Isle (2757 Highway 1, Grand
Isle, LA)
For more information call 985-787-2997 or e-mail us at treesforgrandisle@gmail.com.
","Short Summary

Grand Isle has been through a lot in the last 10 years, from Hurricanes Katrina, Rita, Gustav and Ike to the BP oil disaster, Tropical Storm Lee and Hurricane Isaac. Yet the people and spirit of the town have come back stronger than ever.  As Louisiana's only inhabited barrier island, Grand Isle is a vital first line of defense for the state against hurricanes and a unique wildlife habitat for many species of marine life and birds. It is also an important hub for seafood and the oil industry.  As a living testament to the strength and resilience of the people of south Louisiana, the Garden Club of Grand Isle is raising funds to plant palm trees along the main road running through the town, LA Highway 1.

With the help of Louisiana State University Agriculture, we have concluded that the Cabbage (sabal) palm is the best palm for our island. This hearty palm is both drought and wind resistant and will live for decades to come. The project proposes to plant palm trees along both sides of Highway 1, as well as some additional trees at the island's entrance. The placement of the cabbage palms along Grand Isle's main thoroughfare will replace lost vegetation, create habitat for wildlife and make the island a more attractive place to live and visit. It will be a new signature feature of the island, serving as a visible sign of its recovery and rebirth for years to come.
What We Need to Succeed
Our fundraising goal is $15,000, which covers the cost of purchasing 75 cabbage palm trees, 10- to 12-foot tall, as well as delivery and planting of the trees.

The trees will be planted this Spring so you will soon be able to see what a difference you have made in Grand Isle.   The Impact The palm trees will replace lost vegetation, create habitat for wildlife and beautify the landscape. Their resistance to wind and drought means that these trees will stand for years to come.
You can still give to this campaign: Please donate what you can - every bit helps - and help us spread the word by sharing and telling your friends and employers.
Visit www.grand-isle.com and click on the link to the Grand Isle Palm Tree Project page.  There you can donate online.  You can also make a check out to The Grand Isle Garden
Club and mail it to our address (P.O. Box 817 Grand Isle, LA 70358) or drop it off to the Visitor Center on Highway 1 in Grand Isle (2757 Highway 1, Grand
Isle, LA)
For more information call 985-787-2997 or e-mail us at treesforgrandisle@gmail.com.",2.0,0,"1 Campaign

column4:
>

Our ""TIER eSUN-TRIKES"" have the aim of helping the poorest people in this world help themselves, by creating the world`s first self-propelled solar rickshaw taxi. We will achieve this in three phases within two (2) years and help many people out poverty, while also making good profit for our company.

column1:
So, what exactly is the ""TIER"" company about?
TIER is a Branding and Distribution company based in Berlin, Germany. We have a fast growing network of partner companies, each of which produces a certain product in a certain country. In most cases, we come up with innovative ideas, then search for manufacturers to supply us with branded products of our own design.
The goal of the eSUN-TRIKE Campaign  is to create a fully functioning self-propelled solar three wheeler rickshaw vehicle, that charges independently and does not have to be expensively charged or filled with fossil fuels. To achieve this goal with a minimum of funding, we have created the following business plan:

We will create a solar driven ""eSUN-TRIKE"" in 3 phases.
• The first phase is to get our “feet on the ground“. This will be the simplest of all the steps as we have no current competition in Nicaragua at this time.

The main brand in circulation in Central America and Nicaragua, was banned in Nicaragua. It is said that this was for technical reasons, due to vehicles catching fire. Since the ban, the vehicles in circulation are truly the ""last ones"" and as new ones of the banned brand are prohibited from entry, the used rickshaws are gaining heavily in value instead of losing value. 
This is making taxi rides for the country`s poorest ever more expensive. The competitor branded vehicles are few and far between, as they frequently overheat and have a bad reputation among buyers. 
The price of three wheel rickshaws in Nicaragua has shot up into unimaginable heights. 6-12 K (thousand) U.S. dollars is now a frequently asked price range for a USED Rickshaw in Nicaragua.   With prices rising, this situation is putting a lot of rickshaw drivers in the country out of work. It's a sellers market and this presents us with a good time to enter the market.
It is a sellers market and therefore an opportune moment to enter.We have managed to obtain the import licence for our TRIKES  and believe that by using  a market penetrating strategy of significantly lower prices than the current ones, coupled with the fact that there is no competition, we are certain that our market entrance will succeed. Once having doing so, even in this first simple step, we calculate that we will have made profit margin of 500 USD per vehicle before taxes, while costing the buyers around one third of current prices. We plan to import one 40 foot container of normal gasoline- propelled semi-assembled three wheelers that will be delivered to the Chorintho port of Nicaragua.

Once in Nicaragua, the vehicles will be assembled completely, (attachment of tyres, soft top, headlights as well as the unique paint job or “TIER DESIGN“ giving them their unmistakable look. 
A guarded company-owned strip of land (Approx. 500 square metres in Nindiri, near the Capital Managua, will be used as assembly and storage location of the then fully assembled vehicles.
The sales personnel will receive (for Nicaraguan standards) extremely high commission payments for sales, motivating them to move swiftly and with iron determination. The sales of the vehicles should go quite fast and we forecast the import, assembly and sale of all 40-50 units to be completed in a total of three (3) months by focusing on B2B sales to established retailers. We will continue the import and sale of gasoline driven TRIKES until the mass production of the solar ""eSUN TRIKES"" is ready in Nicaragua.

•  The second phase- is to use our now established “TIER - eSUN TRIKES“ brand in order to begin construction of an assembly plant directly in Nicaragua.
This will enable us to apply for subsidies with the German “GIZ“(Gesellschaft fuer internationale Zusammenarbeit) or Society for international cooperation).  Germany and Nicaragua have excellent relations and Nicaragua is a main focus of their international development work. As long as the German mother (TIER KONZEPZ UG) holds the Nicaraguan subsidiary ( VM INVERSIONES Limitada ), we have excellent chances to receive the necessary machinery for full assembly from Germany, paid, or partly paid for by subsidies by the European Union and/or Germany. With the construction of the ""Nicaraguan Canal"" now already being under way and labour costs being the lowest on the continent, we believe that Nicaragua is the by far best place for construction and exportation of the ""eSUN-TRIKES.  This then completes the second phase.

• The third phase brings us to the actual aim of this crowd- funding campaign. In this third phase, we begin the construction of our solar-propelled fully independently running three wheelers that will change the lives of many.

As it is not yet technologically possible for the vehicle to be powered entirely by the energy produced by on board solar panels, we will solve the issue by selling ""HOME POWER STATIONS"" that are made up of large panels that come with five batteries and are delivered to the buyers home and set up by are staff. 
The user simply has to exchange the battery in the morning before using his taxi for work. The battery we shall be using for this, is patented (patent pending) and partly owned by our Director, Mr. John Maschewsky. With this battery in one hand and ever improving solar panel technology and our own engineers in the other, we aim to create the fully operational autonomous self-charging solar taxi in under two (2) years. That is a realistic time scale. Anyone who claims that it can be done faster, is either misinformed or just plain dishonest. The same can be said about those who claim the whole idea is just a ""dream"" and cannot be done.
FACT: According to ""SolarCity"", the newest panels were measured as having a 22.04% module-level efficiency by ""Renewable Energy Test Center"", a third-party certification provider.
The new panels produce 30% to 40% more power over the current models, but they cost the same to manufacture -about .55 cents per watt, according to Bass. The panels, which are 1.61 meters or 1.81 meters in size, depending on the model, will have a capacity of 355 watts each.

Back to the project. The German company ""TIER"" holds the trademark rights to date and will grant ""TIER NICARAGUA"" the licence to produce the TRIKES. The construction of the vehicles will then be handled by the subsiduary while the parts will be delivered by ""Motori Visconti  Ltd."" of Hong Kong. 
The gasoline version of our three wheelers has been tested extensively in the tropical climate of Bangladesh under the brand`s previous name of „Aurago“. After initial problems with overheating, we managed to solve all mechanical issues after our Team successfully redesigned the engine. It has been a huge effort and we have needed to set up a global network that we have been busy building over the past few years.
-We are now set up to start, but we need your help.-

Should our campaign succeed, we will deliver a new tool to the poorest people in the world. A three wheel rickshaw Mototaxi that can be put into charging mode while the driver waits for passengers and never needs to be charged or filled up with environmentally damaging fossil fuels. We will create jobs in Germany and Nicaragua, while enabling many others all across the third world to help themselves and get out of poverty by using our innovative product.
The risk is that we fail to generate enough money through the sales of our gasoline driven three wheelers and therefore cannot set up the R&
column2:
D in the U.S. in time to meet our target of completing the Solar Taxi. It all depends. It depends on you.
Please help us if you can and help make the TIER  ""eSUN-TRIKE"" available to people soon.

DEUTSCHE VERSION:
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
WILLKOMMEN ZUR - Esun-TRIKES - Kampagne!!
Unsere ""TIER eSUN-TRIKES"" haben das Ziel, die ärmsten Menschen dieser Welt dabei zu unterstützen sich selbst zu helfen, indem sie die weltweit ersten selbstaufladbaren Solar- Rikschas nutzen.

Wir sind bestrebt dieses Ziel, aufgeteilt in drei Phasen, innerhalb von zwei (2) Jahren zu erreichen und damit einen wichtigen Beitrag dazu zu leisten,  viele Menschen aus der Armut zu holen und zwar auf der Grundlage einer gewinnorientierten Unternehmung.
Aber was genau steckt hinter der Firma ""TIER""?
Unsere Firma ist ein Branding/ Marketing- und Vertriebsunternehmen mit Sitz in Berlin, Deutschland.
Wir haben bereits ein schnell wachsendes Netzwerk von Partnerunternehmen geschaffen, von denen jeder ein bestimmtes Produkt der Marke ""TIER"" in einem bestimmten Land vertreibt.
In den meisten Fällen konzipieren wir ein Projekt oder ein bestimmtes Produkt und suchen uns für die Herstellung einen Produzenten, der uns bzw. unseren Kunden beliefert.
Das Ziel dieser ""eSUN-TRIKES"" Kampagne ist es, ein voll funktionsfähiges, selbstladendes Solar-Dreirad Rikscha Fahrzeug zu fertigen.
Um dieses Ziel zu erreichen, haben wir den folgenden Business-Plan unter folgendem Aspekt erstellt:
Wie können wir ein solarbetriebenes Fahrzeug ""eSUN-TRIKES"" erbauen und für unsere Kunden nutzbar und gewinnbringend herstellen ?
Zu Beginn ist Folgendes zu sagen:

Deutschland und Nicaragua haben ausgezeichnete Beziehungen und Nicaragua ist ein Schwerpunkt ihrer internationalen Entwicklungsarbeit. Solange die deutsche Muttergesellschaft die nicaraguanische Tochtergesellschaft hält, haben wir gute Chancen, die für den Zusammenbau notwendigen Maschinen mittels Kredite durch genannte Gesellschaften zu finanzieren. Ein Beispiel dafür ist die „GIZ“ (Gesellschaft für internationale Zusammenarbeit). Soweit notwendig,  ist es uns möglich Beihilfen über die „GIZ“ anzu-wenden.
1. Phase:

In der ersten Phase geht es darum, in den Markt einzutreten und unsere ""Füße auf dem Boden"" zu bekommen. Eine Marktanalyse haben wir bereits getätigt und dabei festgetellt, dass wir mittelfristig der einzig operierende Anbieter auf dem  nicarguanischen Markt sein werden. Der Vorteil hierbei ist, dass das System der Bevölkerung dort bereits bekannt und vertraut ist. Mit dem Bau des ""Nicaraguakanals"", der jetzt bereits in Gange ist und den niedrigsten Personalkosten auf dem Kontinent, glauben wir, dass Nicaragua der mit Abstand beste Ort für den Bau und den Export der""eSUN-TRIKES""ist.
Die Marke, welche derzeit in Mittelamerika überhaupt und in Nicaragua speziell am weitesten verbreitet ist, wurde in Nicaragua vor etwa einem halben Jahr verboten.
Es wurde angegeben, dass dies aufgrund vermehrter technischer Defekte geschah, da die Batterien der Fahrzeuge auffällig oft in Brand gerieten.

Seit dem Verbot, sind die Fahrzeuge, die sich noch im Umlauf befinden, wirklich die ""letzten ihrer Art"" die verfügbar sind. Da neue Modelle der verbotenen Marke von dem Import und der weiteren Marktteilnahme ausgeschlossen sind, werden die verwendeten Rikschas „symbolisch“ stark an Wert gewinnen. Letztenendes wird es aber zu einem Problem kommen, da z. B.  für erforderliche Reparaturen Ersatzteile nur schwer zu beschaffen sein werden. Dieses, auf Dauer durch den Ausfall der Fahrzeuge entstehende Vakuum werden wir durch unseren Markteintritt verändern.

Bis dahin aber werden  Taxifahrten für die Ärmsten im Land immer teurer. Die noch verbleibenden Anbieter anderer Marken Dreiradfahrzeuge sind dünn gesät und da diese Modelle anfällig sind, bsp. die Motoren häufig überhitzen, haben Sie bei den Fahrern derer einen schlechten Ruf.

Die Preise für dreirädrige Rikschas in Nicaragua sind mittlerweile in ungeahnte Höhen geschossen. 6.000 - 12.000 US-Dollar ist die häufig zu findene Preisspanne für ein gebrauchtes Rikscha in Nicaragua. Mit weiterhin steigenden Preisen wird diese Situation immer schwieriger. Es drückt die Rikscha-Fahrer in dem betreffenden Land aus der Arbeit, da es sich mit mehr lohnt, die Unternehmung profitabel zu führen, wenn die Anschaffungs-kosten für ein Fahrzeug immer höher werden. Es bringt die Leute zurück in die Armut, wenn ihnen dadurch die Lebensgrundlage zum Geldverdienen genommen wird. Dem wollen wir, unter Mithilfe dieser Kampagne, entgegenwirken.
Es ist ein Verkäufermarkt und daher ein günstiger Zeitpunkt um einzutreten. Folgende Kriterien ermutigen uns dazu:
Gültiger Besitz einer Einfuhrlizenz für die ""eSUN-TRIKES"" in Nicaragua
Durchdringen des Marktes mit der Strategie, hier durch deutlich niedrige Anschaffungskosten der Fahrzeuge
Ausschalten des Wettbewerbs mittels niedriger Preise, Innovation und Technologie
Nach unseren Berechnungen werden wir eine Gewinnmarge i. H. v. 500,00 US-Dollar pro Fahrzeug vor Steuern erzielen.

In Nicaragua eintreffend, werden die Fahrzeuge komplett montiert, d. h. Befestigung der Reifen, Softtop, Scheinwerfer, u.s.w.. Abgeschlossen wird der Prozess mit der einzigartigen Lackierung und dem Logo""TIER DESIGN"", mit dem sie ihnen ihren unverwechselbaren Look bekommen und im Strassenbild des Landes sofort auffallen.
Ein bewachtes, firmeneigenes Gelände (500 qm) in Nindiri, nahe der Hauptstadt Managua, wird vorerst als Montage- und Lagerungsort dienen, so dass dort die Endmontage vollzogen werden kann.

Parallel dazu werden wir mit Aufbau eines Vertriebssystems beginnen. Die Vertriebsmitarbeiter werden (für nicaraguanische Verhältnisse) sehr ansprechende Provisionszahlungen für den Verkauf erhalten, nicht zuletzt um sie zu motivieren, schnell und mit Entschlossenheit an den Verkauf der Fahrzeuge zu gehen. Der Verkauf der Fahrzeuge sollte in Anbetracht der geschilderten Marktsituation recht schnell vonstatten gehen und wir prognostizieren, dass die Einfuhr, die Montage und der Vertrieb aller 40-50-Einheiten in insgesamt drei (3) Monaten durch die Konzentration auf den B2B-Vertrieb mit Händlern abgeschlossen werden kann. Wir werden die Einfuhr und den Verkauf von benzin- angetriebenen Trikes, bis die Massenproduktion der solarbetriebenen ""eSUN-TRIKES"" bereit steht, weiterhin in Nicaragua, parallel dazu, betreiben.
2. Phase:

In der zweiten Phase werden unsere inzwischen etablierten Dreiräder mit der Solartechnologie ausgestattet. Dazu werden die Fahreuge mit den Solarpanels versehen und die Käufer der Fahrzeuge erhalten die notwendigen Batterien, unsere „HOME POWER-STATIONS“.

Da es technisch noch nicht möglich ist, Fahrzeuge vollständig durch die von Onboard-Solarzellen erzeugten Energie zu betreiben, werden wir das Problem durch die Verbindung von ""HOME POWERSTATIONS"" umgehen, die aus großen Panelen und 8 Batterien bestehen und mit dem Fahrzeugverkauf dem Kunden geliefert werden. Diese Speicher können problemlos im Hause unserer Kunden eingerichtet werden.
Der Benutzer muss lediglich die Batterie zu Beginn der Arbeit tauschen.

Die Batterie welche wir hierfuer verwenden, ist patentiertierte Technologie (Patent angemeldet), welche sich teilweise im Besitz von unserem Direktor, John Maschewsky befindet. Im Zusammenspiel mit diesem Akku in einer Hand und immer besserer Solar-Panel-Technologie in der anderen, unseren eigenen Ingenieuren und Architekten wollen wir das volle betriebsautonome Selbstladesolartaxi in weniger als zwei (2) Jahren erstellen. Das ist ein realistisches umsetzbares Zeitfenster.

Laut ""Solarcity"" schnitten die neuesten Solarpanele bei Tests hinsichtlich der Effizienz durch das anerkannte ""Renewable Energy Test Center"" 22,04% besser ab, als die zum Vergleich getesteten Vorgängermodelle.

Die neuen Platten erbringen 30% bis 40% mehr Leistung als die aktuellen Modelle, bei gleichen Anschaffungskosten. Die Platten sind 1,61 m oder 1,81 m groß und je nach Modell erbringen sie eine Leistung von bis zu 355 Watt.
3. Phase:
In der 3. Phase ist es das Ziel, die selbstladenden Solar-Dreirad Taxis oder""eSUN-TRIKES“ in Nicaragua zu produzieren und weltweit zu exportieren.

Das deutsche Unternehmen ""TIER“ hält die Markenrechte und gestattet der Tochterfirma ""TIER NICARAGUA"" die Dreiräder unter Lizenz herzustellen. Die Konstruktion der Fahrzeuge wird dann durch das Tochterunternehmen gehandhabt, während die Teile für den Zusammenbau von der ""Motori Visconti Ltd."" in Hongkong geliefert werden.

Die Benzin-Version unserer Dreiräder wurde ausgiebig im tropischen Klima von Bangladesch unter dem früheren Namen ""Aurago"" getestet. Nach anfänglichen Problemen mit Überhitzung der Motoren, gelang es uns, alle technischen Probleme zu lösen, indem unser damaliges Team den Motor erfolgreich überarbeitete. Es war ein großer Aufwand, doch es ist allen Beteiligten gelungen.
Sollte unsere Kampagne erfolgreich sein, werden wir den ärmsten Menschen der Welt ein neues Werkzeug liefern und zwar ohne die Umwelt zu belasten:
Das erste voll betriebsautonome Selbstladesolartaxi weltweit.
Bitte helfen Sie uns, wenn Sie helfen können, das TIER ""eSUN-TRIKE"" zu verwirklichen.
Vielen Dank !
HIER EINIGE PERKS, WELCHE WIR BELOHNEND FUER SIE ANBIETEN:

Should our campaign succeed, we will deliver a new tool to the poorest people in the world. A three wheel rickshaw Mototaxi that can be put into charging mode while the driver waits for passengers and never needs to be charged or filled up with environmentally damaging fossil fuels. We will create jobs in Germany and Nicaragua, while enabling many others all across the third world to help themselves and get out of poverty by using our innovative product.The risk is that we fail to generate enough money through the sales of our gasoline driven three wheelers and therefore cannot set up the R&D in the U.S. in time to meet our target of completing the Solar Taxi. It all depends. It depends on you.Please help us if you can and help make the TIER  ""eSUN-TRIKE"" available to people soon.
Here a small selection of our Perks:
Thank you so much! - YOUR TIER TEAM!
DEUTSCHE VERSION:
WILLKOMMEN ZUR - Esun-TRIKES - Kampagne!!
Unsere ""TIER eSUN-TRIKES"" haben das Ziel, die ärmsten Menschen dieser Welt dabei zu unterstützen sich selbst zu helfen, indem sie die weltweit ersten selbstaufladbaren Solar- Rikschas nutzen.

Wir sind bestrebt dieses Ziel, aufgeteilt in drei Phasen, innerhalb von zwei (2) Jahren zu erreichen und damit einen wichtigen Beitrag dazu zu leisten,  viele Menschen aus der Armut zu holen und zwar auf der Grundlage einer gewinnorientierten Unternehmung.
Aber was genau steckt hinter der Firma ""TIER""?
Unsere Firma ist ein Branding/ Marketing- und Vertriebsunternehmen mit Sitz in Berlin, Deutschland.
Wir haben bereits ein schnell wachsendes Netzwerk von Partnerunternehmen geschaffen, von denen jeder ein bestimmtes Produkt der Marke ""TIER"" in einem bestimmten Land vertreibt.
In den meisten Fällen konzipieren wir ein Projekt oder ein bestimmtes Produkt und suchen uns für die Herstellung einen Produzenten, der uns bzw. unseren Kunden beliefert.
Das Ziel dieser ""eSUN-TRIKES"" Kampagne ist es, ein voll funktionsfähiges, selbstladendes Solar-Dreirad Rikscha Fahrzeug zu fertigen.
Um dieses Ziel zu erreichen, haben wir den folgenden Business-Plan unter folgendem Aspekt erstellt:
Wie können wir ein solarbetriebenes Fahrzeug ""eSUN-TRIKES"" erbauen und für unsere Kunden nutzbar und gewinnbringend herstellen ?
Zu Beginn ist Folgendes zu sagen:

Deutschland und Nicaragua haben ausgezeichnete Beziehungen und Nicaragua ist ein Schwerpunkt ihrer internationalen Entwicklungsarbeit. Solange die deutsche Muttergesellschaft die nicaraguanische Tochtergesellschaft hält, haben wir gute Chancen, die für den Zusammenbau notwendigen Maschinen mittels Kredite durch genannte Gesellschaften zu finanzieren. Ein Beispiel dafür ist die „GIZ“ (Gesellschaft für internationale Zusammenarbeit). Soweit notwendig,  ist es uns möglich Beihilfen über die „GIZ“ anzu-wenden.
1. Phase:

In der ersten Phase geht es darum, in den Markt einzutreten und unsere ""Füße auf dem Boden"" zu bekommen. Eine Marktanalyse haben wir bereits getätigt und dabei festgetellt, dass wir mittelfristig der einzig operierende Anbieter auf dem  nicarguanischen Markt sein werden. Der Vorteil hierbei ist, dass das System der Bevölkerung dort bereits bekannt und vertraut ist. Mit dem Bau des ""Nicaraguakanals"", der jetzt bereits in Gange ist und den niedrigsten Personalkosten auf dem Kontinent, glauben wir, dass Nicaragua der mit Abstand beste Ort für den Bau und den Export der""eSUN-TRIKES""ist.
Die Marke, welche derzeit in Mittelamerika überhaupt und in Nicaragua speziell am weitesten verbreitet ist, wurde in Nicaragua vor etwa einem halben Jahr verboten.
Es wurde angegeben, dass dies aufgrund vermehrter technischer Defekte geschah, da die Batterien der Fahrzeuge auffällig oft in Brand gerieten.

Seit dem Verbot, sind die Fahrzeuge, die sich noch im Umlauf befinden, wirklich die ""letzten ihrer Art"" die verfügbar sind. Da neue Modelle der verbotenen Marke von dem Import und der weiteren Marktteilnahme ausgeschlossen sind, werden die verwendeten Rikschas „symbolisch“ stark an Wert gewinnen. Letztenendes wird es aber zu einem Problem kommen, da z. B.  für erforderliche Reparaturen Ersatzteile nur schwer zu beschaffen sein werden. Dieses, auf Dauer durch den Ausfall der Fahrzeuge entstehende Vakuum werden wir durch unseren Markteintritt verändern.

Bis dahin aber werden  Taxifahrten für die Ärmsten im Land immer teurer. Die noch verbleibenden Anbieter anderer Marken Dreiradfahrzeuge sind dünn gesät und da diese Modelle anfällig sind, bsp. die Motoren häufig überhitzen, haben Sie bei den Fahrern derer einen schlechten Ruf.

Die Preise für dreirädrige Rikschas in Nicaragua sind mittlerweile in ungeahnte Höhen geschossen. 6.000 - 12.000 US-Dollar ist die häufig zu findene Preisspanne für ein gebrauchtes Rikscha in Nicaragua. Mit weiterhin steigenden Preisen wird diese Situation immer schwieriger. Es drückt die Rikscha-Fahrer in dem betreffenden Land aus der Arbeit, da es sich mit mehr lohnt, die Unternehmung profitabel zu führen, wenn die Anschaffungs-kosten für ein Fahrzeug immer höher werden. Es bringt die Leute zurück in die Armut, wenn ihnen dadurch die Lebensgrundlage zum Geldverdienen genommen wird. Dem wollen wir, unter Mithilfe dieser Kampagne, entgegenwirken.
Es ist ein Verkäufermarkt und daher ein günstiger Zeitpunkt um einzutreten. Folgende Kriterien ermutigen uns dazu:
Gültiger Besitz einer Einfuhrlizenz für die ""eSUN-TRIKES"" in Nicaragua
Durchdringen des Marktes mit der Strategie, hier durch deutlich niedrige Anschaffungskosten der Fahrzeuge
Ausschalten des Wettbewerbs mittels niedriger Preise, Innovation und Technologie
Nach unseren Berechnungen werden wir eine Gewinnmarge i. H. v. 500,00 US-Dollar pro Fahrzeug vor Steuern erzielen.

In Nicaragua eintreffend, werden die Fahrzeuge komplett montiert, d. h. Befestigung der Reifen, Softtop, Scheinwerfer, u.s.w.. Abgeschlossen wird der Prozess mit der einzigartigen Lackierung und dem Logo""TIER DESIGN"", mit dem sie ihnen ihren unverwechselbaren Look bekommen und im Strassenbild des Landes sofort auffallen.
Ein bewachtes, firmeneigenes Gelände (500 qm) in Nindiri, nahe der Hauptstadt Managua, wird vorerst als Montage- und Lagerungsort dienen, so dass dort die Endmontage vollzogen werden kann.

Parallel dazu werden wir mit Aufbau eines Vertriebssystems beginnen. Die Vertriebsmitarbeiter werden (für nicaraguanische Verhältnisse) sehr ansprechende Provisionszahlungen für den Verkauf erhalten, nicht zuletzt um sie zu motivieren, schnell und mit Entschlossenheit an den Verkauf der Fahrzeuge zu gehen. Der Verkauf der Fahrzeuge sollte in Anbetracht der geschilderten Marktsituation recht schnell vonstatten gehen und wir prognostizieren, dass die Einfuhr, die Montage und der Vertrieb aller 40-50-Einheiten in insgesamt drei (3) Monaten durch die Konzentration auf den B2B-Vertrieb mit Händlern abgeschlossen werden kann. Wir werden die Einfuhr und den Verkauf von benzin- angetriebenen Trikes, bis die Massenproduktion der solarbetriebenen ""eSUN-TRIKES"" bereit steht, weiterhin in Nicaragua, parallel dazu, betreiben.
2. Phase:

In der zweiten Phase werden unsere inzwischen etablierten Dreiräder mit der Solartechnologie ausgestattet. Dazu werden die Fahreuge mit den Solarpanels versehen und die Käufer der Fahrzeuge erhalten die notwendigen Batterien, unsere „HOME POWER-STATIONS“.

Da es technisch noch nicht möglich ist, Fahrzeuge vollständig durch die von Onboard-Solarzellen erzeugten Energie zu betreiben, werden wir das Problem durch die Verbindung von ""HOME POWERSTATIONS"" umgehen, die aus großen Panelen und 8 Batterien bestehen und mit dem Fahrzeugverkauf dem Kunden geliefert werden. Diese Speicher können problemlos im Hause unserer Kunden eingerichtet werden.
Der Benutzer muss lediglich die Batterie zu Beginn der Arbeit tauschen.

Die Batterie welche wir hierfuer verwenden, ist patentiertierte Technologie (Patent angemeldet), welche sich teilweise im Besitz von unserem Direktor, John Maschewsky befindet. Im Zusammenspiel mit diesem Akku in einer Hand und immer besserer Solar-Panel-Technologie in der anderen, unseren eigenen Ingenieuren und Architekten wollen wir das volle betriebsautonome Selbstladesolartaxi in weniger als zwei (2) Jahren erstellen. Das ist ein realistisches umsetzbares Zeitfenster.

Laut ""Solarcity"" schnitten die neuesten Solarpanele bei Tests hinsichtlich der Effizienz durch das anerkannte ""Renewable Energy Test Center"" 22,04% besser ab, als die zum Vergleich getesteten Vorgängermodelle.

Die neuen Platten erbringen 30% bis 40% mehr Leistung als die aktuellen Modelle, bei gleichen Anschaffungskosten. Die Platten sind 1,61 m oder 1,81 m groß und je nach Modell erbringen sie eine Leistung von bis zu 355 Watt.
3. Phase:
In der 3. Phase ist es das Ziel, die selbstladenden Solar-Dreirad Taxis oder""eSUN-TRIKES“ in Nicaragua zu produzieren und weltweit zu exportieren.

Das deutsche Unternehmen ""TIER“ hält die Markenrechte und gestattet der Tochterfirma ""TIER NICARAGUA"" die Dreiräder unter Lizenz herzustellen. Die Konstruktion der Fahrzeuge wird dann durch das Tochterunternehmen gehandhabt, während die Teile für den Zusammenbau von der ""Motori Visconti Ltd."" in Hongkong geliefert werden.

Die Benzin-Version unserer Dreiräder wurde ausgiebig im tropischen Klima von Bangladesch unter dem früheren Namen ""Aurago"" getestet. Nach anfänglichen Problemen mit Überhitzung der Motoren, gelang es uns, alle technischen Probleme zu lösen, indem unser damaliges Team den Motor erfolgreich überarbeitete. Es war ein großer Aufwand, doch es ist allen Beteiligten gelungen.
Sollte unsere Kampagne erfolgreich sein, werden wir den ärmsten Menschen der Welt ein neues Werkzeug liefern und zwar ohne die Umwelt zu belasten:
Das erste voll betriebsautonome Selbstladesolartaxi weltweit.
Bitte helfen Sie uns, wenn Sie helfen können, das TIER ""eSUN-TRIKE"" zu verwirklichen.
Vielen Dank !

Projektet kort!

Hej Indiegogo, jeg hedder Andreas. Jeg synes, at det er vigtigt, at vores forbrug er så bæredygtigt som muligt. Derfor vil jeg gerne starte en økologisk Fair Trade juletræsproduktion, så produktionen af juletræer efterlader det mindst mulige miljøaftryk. Dit bidrag til projektet vil være med til at sikre, at vi i fællesskab, gør julen lidt grønnere!
column3:
>Hvad skal pengene bruges til?

Omkostningerne i forbindelse med at plante en økologisk Fair Trade juletræsplantage er markant højere i forhold til at plante en konventionel juletræsplantage, fordi de små økologiske juletræer koster ca. 5 gange så meget. Pengene skal bruges til indkøb af små juletræer, såning af hvidkløver (som skal være med til at sikre, at der næsten ikke skal gødes i plantagen), opsætning af hegn (så de små juletræer ikke bliver spist af hjorte), plantning og vedligeholdelse af plantagen. 

Hvis du vælger at støtte projektet, så får du - alt efter hvor meget du støtter med - et eller flere juletræer, når de er klar til at blive fældet. Og ja, der går nogle år inden de er klar til at blive fældet. Jeg regner med, at de første er klar om 6 år - så er juletræerne ca. 1,5 meter høje, men hvis du vil have et lidt højere juletræ, så skal du vente 1 eller 2 år mere. Så det er en langsigtet investering du laver! 

Til gengæld sørger jeg for, at juletræet bliver leveret til et sted nær dig, så du ikke nødvendigvis behøver at køre til Sønderjylland og fælde det selv - men det kunne være hyggeligt!

Når målet bliver nået, så er der råd til at plante 1 hektar med øko juletræer, hvilket er ca. 6000 stk. Hvis der kommer flere penge end målet, så bliver der plantet flere og hvis målet ikke helt bliver nået, så bliver der plantet lidt færre øko juletræer.

column1: <span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)

Jeg håber, at du vil være med til at støtte projektet og sætte skub i udviklingen i den danske juletræsbranche, og være med til at vise, at det kan lade sig gøre at producere flotte økologiske juletræer!
Jeg håber også, at du vil være med til at sprede budskabet om projektet, så flest muligt får kendskab til det!
Tak for opmærksomheden og jeg håber, at vi mødes i juletræsplantagen i bakkerne omkring Krusmølle!
- Andreas
Jul og Grønne Skove

THE PLASTIC PROBLEM IN AUSTRALIA

Australia is the second highest producers of waste in the world, per person.
• Australians use 4 billion plastic bags a year
• That's over 10 million new bags being used every day
• 50 million of these end up in our waterways and oceans
• Plastic bags are only used for 12 minutes but they last for ever!
• They are non biodegradable, endangering and killing our animals and are toxic for the earth.
• Australians use enough plastic bags per year that if these were tied together they would stretch around the world 24 times

THIS IS NOT OK!

But we just don’t think about it because we don’t see it!
Think about it next time you shop.
​Your 12 minutes of shopping convenience can make a difference!

Out of sight out of mind right?

It's time rid the plastic waste problem.

Founders Story

Eko was born from a shopping experience in Europe then to witness the amount of plastics being used in Australia, something just had to be done.

“After living in Germany for 2.5 years and having to pay for plastic bags at the grocery store, it was only a matter of weeks before I changed my ways. Living now back in Australia and seeing the amount of single-use plastic bags being used I had to do something. It was through a nice meditation where I saw the finished product in the form of a ‘baby sleeping bag’!
